loans.name: Luzbeidy Aracely

texts.es:
Luzbeidy tiene 26 años, es casada y  tiene un hijo de edad escolar.  Su pareja se dedica a trabajos como obrero de construcción.  Residen en el distrito de Chepén, ubicado a 1 hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Se dedica a la venta de comida rápida en un carrito sanguchero (una unidad móvil no motorizada, que sirve para preparar comida rápida, como hamburguesas, salchipollo y salchipapa).  Los ingresos que percibe en su negocio le ayuda a mantener a su familia, y apoyar a su pareja con los gastos familiares.  Asimismo ella vende bisutería y ropa interior a cómodos precios.
Luzbeidy desea comprar más mercadería de bisutería y ropa interior para venderlo y obtener mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 800 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Luzbeidy is 26 years old, married and has a school-aged son. Her husband is a construction worker. They live in the district of Chepén, located 1 hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She sells fast food in a food cart (an unmotorized mobile unit where fast food is prepared, like hamburgers, salchipollo [chicken sausages] and salchipapas [fried sausages and potatoes]). The income that her business provides help to maintain her family and support her husband with the family costs. She also sells jewelry and undergarments at affordable prices.

Luzbeidy wants to buy more jewelry and undergarments to sell and get more income. This is why she has thought it necessary to ask for a loan of 800 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry and undergarments to sell to her customers

loans.name: Adelaida

texts.en:
Adelaida M. is from the village of Mimbunga, Gingoog City. She is 49 years old. Adelaida is widowed and has four adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the retail sector running a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling canned goods, snack foods, biscuits, shampoo, soap and beverages in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately $125 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Adelaida joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Adelaida is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be her 4th loan from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to buy more canned goods and snack foods to sell

loans.name: Jaime Wuilian

texts.es:
Jaime tiene 48 años de edad, y tiene un hijo. Vive en casa propia, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de  Monsefú, a 20 minutos de la ciudad Chiclayo. Reside en la parte rural de este distrito. Su comunidad es uno de los más grandes de la ciudad de Chiclayo a pesar de estar alejado de la misma.

Jaime brinda el servicio de transporte de pasajeros en su mototaxi (una unidad móvil, que consiste en una moto y una cabina para transporte de personas).  Este vehículo es de su propiedad y lo tiene desde hace más de 05 años.  Sus ingresos le sirven para mantener a su familia, a quien quiere darle mejor calidad de vida.

Jaime quiere darle mantenimiento a su vehículo, la herramienta de su negocio. Con los ingresos de su negocio, el puede cubrir los gastos de su hijo. Por ello, ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jaime is 48 years old and has a son. He lives in his own home, which is located in the district of Monsefú, 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. He lives in the rural part of this district. His community is one of the biggest around the city of Chiclayo, in spite of being far from it. 

Jaime provides passenger transportation services in his mototaxi (a mobile unit that consists of a motorcycle and a cabin for transporting people). He owns the vehicle and has had it for more than 5 years. His income helps to maintain his family, who he wants to give a better quality of life.

Jaime wants to do some maintenance on his vehicle, his tool for business. With the income from his business, he can cover costs for his son. For this reason, he has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to fix and maintain his mototaxi

loans.name: Buraima's Group

texts.en:
Buraima M., 65, is the leader of this group. She is one of the respectable women in her local community, and has forty years of experience in cattle breeding and dairy business. She has lived in her hometown of Aravan for sixty-five years and knows best of all the pleasant conditions for cattle breeding that this area provides. Many head of cattle have passed through her care. 

Nowadays she owns a cow with a calf. It yields fresh milk every morning which she distributes to her regular customers. Buraima remembers how, being a young lady in 1971, she started with the purchase of her first cow, in which she put big hopes, and spent the last savings in her family budget. At that time, she and her husband were a young couple and her husband was farmer. Since that time, milk products bring in a significant portion of Buraima’s income. 

Thanks to those financial assets, she raised three kids, helped with their employment and finished major repairing at her house. She invests her monthly income of about $215 back into her business. This time she needs some financial assistance in purchasing one more cow. In future she dreams of having a large fruit orchard. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase another cow

loans.name: Zulfiya's Group

texts.en:
Zulfiya Abdurokhmonova, 39, is the leader of this group. She has resided in Aravan for her whole life, a town with a small population and very few employment opportunities. Eleven years ago, right after giving birth to her last son, she laid the foundation for the upcoming business initiative of farming and cattle breeding. Being inspired by more experienced entrepreneurs in the neighborhood, she gathered a small amount of money, saved by her and her husband, that became a potential investment in her business. 

Zulfiya’s children go to school, while her husband is employed in a local construction company. She enjoys inventing new techniques of cultivating land and effective methods of raising cattle. There’s a saying that a man should accomplish three main things in life: plant a tree, build a house and raise a son. Zulfiya’s husband has performed all three, mainly thanks to this family business that they’ve been running for eleven years already. 

Zulfiya hopes to add the acquired loan to her monthly income of about $44 in order to purchase cattle and food for it. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase cattle

loans.name: Merlina

texts.en:
Merlina M. is from the village of Victoria, Alicia, Isabela. She is 49 years old. Merlina is married and has two adult-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a business venture in the services sector, providing recycling services. The main source of income for the business comes from hauling junk and other waste material for local businesses and community members. She has been engaged in her business for over eleven years and earns approximately $233 a month for these activities.

In 2006, Merlina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional waste and junk material to sell. 

Merlina is requesting a new loan of 30,000 PHP which will be used to purchase used bottles and newspapers to sell. This will be her 9th loan from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve her business. 

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful micro-finance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase used bottles and newspapers to recycle

loans.name: Bataa

texts.en:
Bataa is a 39-year-old widow who lives with her two daughters in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. Her older daughter is a student, while her younger daughter is a pupil. She manages a food cafe in her town. 

She started her business in 2004 at a rented booth at a local secondary school. She prepares and provides both teachers' and students' meals at her food cafe. She employs two workers, the chief cook and the assistant cook. Her food cafe offers a variety of delicious sandwiches, salads, smoothies, coffee and more. Therefore, students are delighted to receive service at her cafe. 

She is a diligent woman who attributes her business success to her good accounting skills. She says, "After my husband's death it was hard to feed and educate my children. But now we have learned to earn money, which fills our needs." 

Bataa is requesting a 3,100,000 MNT of loan to purchase vegetables, flour and some seasonings for her business.

loans.use: To purchase vegetables, flour and some seasonings

loans.name: Gulnara's Group

texts.en:
Gulnara J., 48, is the leader of this group. She resides in the small town of Karabalta, is married, and has a twelve-year-old son. Her husband is a construction worker in another town and her son goes to middle school. 

For almost fifteen years Gulnara has been selling milk at home. The fact that she operates a dairy business is known to the whole neighborhood, so there is usually a constant flow of customers. An initial capital of 20,000 KGS was loaned by a local bank, and the family repaid it successfully. Now it generates $83 monthly, but it’s not enough to purchase calves for fattening. 

Therefore, Gulnara applied for a loan from Kiva. She is confident in every member of her group and believes in a high commitment in repaying the loan successfully. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase a calf

loans.name: Bayar-Erdene

texts.en:
Bayar-Erdene is 26 years old and lives with his wife and three children in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in his parents' back yard. His wife, who recently gave birth to twin children, stays home looking after their children. 

He manages an animal rawhide trading business in his town. He started his business in 2004 with the help of his brother-in-law. In 2007, he sold all his husbandry animals and bought a mini-truck to be used in transporting his collected raw materials to his customers. He is a serious man who says, "I am doing my best to feed my family." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more animal rawhides for his business.

loans.use: To purchase animal rawhides

loans.name: Batmakan's Group

texts.en:
Batmakan C., 41, is the leader of this group. Being a resident of the northern town of Karabalta, Batmakan raised three children, the oldest of whom is 18 years old. In 1996 after the privatization of land, Batmakan, along with thousands of farmers like her, used her last savings on the purchase of her first head of livestock. 

Reselling cattle was just a beginning. Soon she used the daily milk yield to produce sour cream, butter, and cheese. A homemade product raises demand in local area residents, who are pleased with accessible prices and good quality. For the distribution of milk, Batmakan uses her husband’s help, because he is employed in the transportation of food products. Her children make a small contribution to the family business by providing their minor help after school. 

A monthly income of about $214 helped the couple purchase an automobile and several cows. Now Batmakan sometimes buys ready milk products and resells them in a local market. In order to accomplish this she has applied for this loan. Batmakan has deep hopes for her children’s future. She wants them to be well-educated and live in Bishkek - the capital of Kyrgyzstan. 

         --- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Micro-finance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. 
MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Micro-finance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year. 

To learn more about MBF and view a video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135 
								
If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and micro-finance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase milk products

loans.name: Demberel

texts.en:
Demberel, 56, is married and lives with his wife and two sons in Uvurhangai province, Mongolia. They live in a ger, the Mongolian traditional nomadic housing tent, in someone's back yard. His wife is a guard at a private company, while his two sons are employed as assistant construction workers. 

Demberel manages a grocery trading booth near to his home. He started his business in 2008. Since then he has been able to stabilize his business and he attributes his business success to the good location of his booth. Now his monthly sales have reached to about $420. He sells a variety of grocery items, including vegetables, flour, candies and drinks. He is an open-minded and polite man who says, "One needs to work hard instead of doing nothing all day." 

He is requesting a 2,000,000 MNT loan to purchase more grocery items in order to increase his sales.

loans.use: to purchase more grocery items

loans.name: Kaneez Fatima's Group

texts.en:
Kaneez fatima is married to M. I. and resides in Pakpattan, Pakistan, which is famous for its agriculture industry. Her house is located in the area of Maday Shah, which is a residential area of the city. She moved here 15 years ago. Her husband operates a business selling animals. He buys young animals, raises them and sells them to his customers. His business grows busier during the Muslim festival of Eid-ul-Azha because people purchase animals to slaughter. At other times, he sells animals to butchers. 

Kaneez is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is very active and tries to do her duties with responsibility. She has given birth to two sons. Her eldest son left his education after matriculation and started working as a salesman. Her youngest son is 17 years old and illiterate. He stays at home. 

Kaneez has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He wants to buy some goats and sheep to sell for profit. He has been doing this business for the past 15 years and Kaneez is confident that after the investment, her husband’s business will grow further and make him even more money every month. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record with her previous loan and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Kaneez fatima.

loans.use: To buy goats & sheep for animal-selling business

loans.name: Byambasuren

texts.en:
Byambasuren is 44 years old and lives with his two children and his wife in Darkhan, the third largest city in Mongolia. They live together in a ger, the traditional Mongolian nomadic tent. His son attends the “Darkhan urguu” university in Darkhan city, and his daughter attends a local secondary school. 

He has been running his transportation business since 2009. He transports people from new Drakhan city to old Darkhan every day from early morning until late in the evening. His wife works with him as a cashier. Batdorj is a very hardworking, optimistic person whose goal is to extend his business and provide good education for his kids, and also to have his own house. 

He is requesting a loan to buy some construction materials to fix his garage.

loans.use: to purchase construction materials to fix his garage

loans.name: Olmaskhan's Group

texts.en:
Olmaskhan B., the 42-year-old leader of this group, lives with her husband and 11-year-old daughter in the small town of Karabalta. Twenty years ago the family was in a desperate economic state, experiencing great difficulty in covering basic living costs. The development of microfinance in Kyrgyzstan pulled her out of this situation when Olmaskhan received a loan in 1991 to start up a business. Purchasing potatoes seeds which she then planted on her small piece of land, she achieved a rich fall harvest.

Agriculture has helped the family improve its living conditions, buy an automobile, and increase the number of cattle the family owns. A monthly income of 6,000 soms, however, is not always sufficient to cover all costs, so Olmaskhan is now requesting a loan from Kiva to pay for the services of a tractor driver and other operating expenses. Olmaskhan hopes to get enough profit so that she can give a good education to her daughter.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to pay for the services of a tractor driver

loans.name: Gulira's Group

texts.en:
Gulira K., the 28-year-old leader of this group, is a divorced mother who resides in the northern town of Karabalta with her one-year-old son. Responsible for meeting his needs, she began her entrepreneurial career sewing and selling dolls as souvenirs and distributing cosmetics for a local beauty company one year ago.

Very successful at face-to-face marketing, Gulira has increased the goods' circulation and receives 4,000 soms of monthly income. She is now requesting a loan to purchase a greater variety of cosmetics in order to expand her operation. Gulira's chief goal is to build a better future for her son.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase more cosmetics

loans.name: Rysjan's Group

texts.en:
Rysjan N., the 43-year-old a leader of this group, resides in Kerben, the hometown of a former president of the country. The mother of two teen-aged sons, Rrysjan has been involved in the selling of flour and baked goods for 15 years, having started the business with about 8000 soms. A monthly income of 5000 soms is usually invested back into the business. Her husband is a farmer, and their main achievement is the purchase of a cow that is expected to have a calf very soon.

The requested loan will be used to purchase flour and other bakery materials. Because her products are always in high demand, Rysjan is confident in her ability to repay the loan in a timely fashion. She is very thankful to all lenders since they have helped her during very harsh financial times in the life of her family.

--- Where Did This Loan Come From? ---

This loan is brought to you by Mol Bulak Finance (MBF), a young, ambitious and socially-focused Microfinance Institution in Kyrgyzstan. MBF is strongly committed to the principles of sustainable development and upholds the triple bottom line – People (building human capital and taking care of its customers as well as society), Planet (keeping environmentally friendly) and Profit (earning revenue to expand autonomously). MBF is the only Microfinance Institute in Kyrgyzstan that delivers its services to customers 365 days a year.

To learn more about MBF and view a Video presentation about the organization, please visit: http://www.kiva.org/about/aboutPartner?id=135

If you would like to support and learn more about Kyrgyzstan and microfinance in Central Asia, please join our Lending Team - Supporters of Kyrgyzstan – Mol Bulak Finance at http://kiva.org/team/kyrgyzstan. Members will get special updates and news from Kiva Fellows in Kyrgyzstan and from the MBF staff.

loans.use: to purchase flour

loans.name: Sarwar's Group

texts.en:
Sarwar belongs to Pakpattan, which is a small city in Pakistan known for its agriculture and dairy industry. She has been living there in the area of Maday shah with her family in a three-room brick house for the past 20 years. Her husband’s name is M. D. and he operates a Punjabi food restaurant business. He sells local traditional food like Daal Chawal (made with chickpeas and served with rice and pickle), chicken and bread. He has a good number of clients due to the good quality and taste of the food. Sarwar is the mother of a son who is married and 28 years old. He helps his father in his business. Sarwar is a very good housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. She also assists her husband in his business by preparing food. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to further improve his business. With the loan, he will buy flour, chickpeas, cooking oil, spices, etc to prepare good quality food and to increase his profits. He has been operating this business for the past five years and Sarwar is hopeful that the loan will help him grow his business and make better profits. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her second loan application. She has established a good credit record with her previous loan and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy ingredients such as flour, chickpeas, cooking oil and spices

loans.name: Excel

texts.en:
Excel A. is from the village of Barangay 17, Gingoog City. He is 38 years old. Excel is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Excel buys and sells prepaid cell phone credits. He also sells firewood and coconut husks for love bird nests. Excel has been engaged in his business for over seven years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Excel joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Excel has successfully repaid a previous loan of 10,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Excel is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional cell phone credits and firewood. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Excel from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional cell phone credits and firewood to resell

loans.name: Amada

texts.en:
Amada G. is from the village of Barangay 26, Gingoog City. She is 56 years old. Amada is married and has two school-aged children. 

To make a living, Amada owns and operates a a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of meals like afritada, fried fish and pork, caldereta and fish soups to customers in the local community. Amada has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Amada joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Amada has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase food and drinks for the restaurant. 

Amada is requesting a new loan of 8,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices and vegetables. This will be the third loan taken out by Amada from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices and vegetables

loans.name: Pacita

texts.en:
Pacita S. is from the village of San Isidro, Medina, Misamis Oriental. She is 52 years old. Pacita is single and has two adult children. 

To make a living, Pacita owns and operates a sari-sari (variety) retail shop, selling snack foods, biscuits, instant noodles and beverages. Pacita has been engaged in her business for over eight years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Pacita joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Pacita has successfully repaid a previous loan of 7,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Pacita is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods. This will be the third loan taken out by Pacita from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods and snack foods

loans.name: Luz

texts.en:
Luz C. is from the village of Talisayan, Misamis Oriental. She is 42 years old. Luz is married and has three school-aged children. 

To make a living, Luz owns and operates a specialized retail store, selling school supplies like chalk boards, pens, sharpeners and also different products like lighters, sunglasses and combs in the local community. Luz has been engaged in her business for over two years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luz joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Luz has successfully repaid a previous loan of 6,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory and for working capital. 

Luz is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products like stationery and toys. This will be the third loan taken out by Luz from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products like stationery and toys

loans.name: Arshaluys

texts.en: Arshaluys S. lives in Aghitu village with her husband and son. She is engaged in agriculture. She also runs a grocery shop near the military hospital. The monthly replenishment of the shop comes to 2,500 USD. The profit is 220 USD. However, the income is not enough to meet the family needs. Arshaluys applied to SEF in order to buy more goods to sell in her shop and increase her income. With the requested loan, she plans to increase the shop’s monthly replenishment and develop the business.

loans.use: to add inventory to her grocery store to offer for sale

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda A. is from the village of San Luis, Gingoog City. She is 53 years old. Luzviminda is widowed and has five adult children. 

To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a tailoring business. Luzviminda has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 15,000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Luzviminda joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Luzviminda has successfully repaid a previous loan of 9,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional tailoring equipment such as needles and threads. 

Luzviminda is requesting a new loan of 9,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional fabrics and materials. This will be the fifth loan taken out by Luzviminda from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional fabrics and materials

location.town: San Luis, Gingoog City, Misamis Oriental

loans.name: Rocio Del Pilar

texts.es:
Rocío tiene 22 años de edad, es soltera y no tiene hijos. Vive en casa de sus padres la cual está ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, ubicado en Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

Se dedica a brindar el servicio de corte de cabello (peluquería) ubicado en su  mismo domicilio. Adicionalmente se dedica a la comercialización de productos de belleza desde hace 05 años. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona.  Los ingresos que percibe por su negocio los utiliza para ayudar a sus padres con el sostenimiento familiar. Rocío desea comprar más utensilios para realizar bien su trabajo.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rocío is 22 years old, single and has no children. She lives in her parents' house which is located in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz in Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.

She provides hair cutting services in her home. Additionally, she has sold beauty products for 5 years. She has an established clientele in the area. The income that she receives from her business are used to help her parents with sustaining their family. Rocío wants to buy more tools to do her work well. For this reason she has asked for a loan of 700 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy more tools for her barbershop

loans.name: Batool's Group

texts.en:
Batool has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who sells vehicle tires. His shop is located in the market and he believes in selling good quality products; that’s why he has a good number of customers who prefers to buy tires from him. With the loan, he will buy new and used vehicle tires to sell in his shop. 

Batool sells bed-sheets to help her husband financially. She buys them from a wholesale market and sells to her local area clients.  She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. All of them are very young and are not of school-going age yet. She is hopeful that this investment will be a profitable one for her husband and he will be able to improve the financial condition of the family. 

Batool is a resident of Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture. She has been living there in the area of Madhay Shah with her family in a 2-room brick house for the past 15 years. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She has established a good credit behavior in the previous loan year and attended every meeting.

loans.use: To buy vehicle tires for tire-sales business

loans.name: Fredesvinda Felicitas

texts.es:
Fredesvinda tiene 48 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. ResiD. en una zona urbana marginal del distrito D. Pacasmayo, perteneciente al departamento D. la Libertad, ubicado a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la venta D. abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad en un puesto ubicado en el mercado D. su localidad desD. hace más D. 15 años.  Los ingresos que percibe D. su negocio le sirve para solventar los gastos D. su familia y darle mejor calidad D. vida. Fredesvinda desea surtir su puesto con mas abarrotes para después venderlos y obtener mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Fredesvinda is 48 years old, married and has 3 children.  She lives in a marginal urban zone in the district of Pacasmayo, which belongs to the department of La Libertad, located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the department of Lambayeque. 

For more than 15 years she has sold groceries and other basic necessities in a stall located in the market in her town. The income that she receives from her business helps to cover the costs of her family and give them a better quality of life. Fredesvinda wants to stock her stall with more groceries to later sell them and get greater income. This is why she has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to stock her stall with more groceries

loans.name: Perch

texts.en: Perch S. lives in Suser village with his wife and two daughters. He is engaged in agriculture from which he receives the main income for the family. Perch’s farm includes 2 cows, 13 cattle, 1 pig and 5 turkeys. He also cultivates 2 hectares of barley and 1.96 hectares of alfalfa. Perch applied to Kiva partner, SEF, in 2009 to increase his livestock. Now he has applied again to increase his livestock. With the requested loan he plans to repair his cattle farm and buy two cows.

loans.use: to repair his cattle farm and buy livestock.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare the food that she sells

loans.name: Gerardo

texts.en:
Gerardo R. is from the village of Talon, Gingoog City. He is 52 years old. Gerardo is married and has 4 adult children. To make a living, Gerardo owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling snack foods, biscuits, instant noodles & beverages. Gerardo has been engaged in his business for over 4 years and earns approximately 8000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2010, Gerardo joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Gerardo has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,000 PHP from HSPFI.  The previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Gerardo is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages. This loan will be the 5th loan taken out by Gerardo from HSPFI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand his business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional canned goods, snack foods & beverages

loans.name: Yessica

texts.es:
Yéssica tiene 19 años, es soltera y  vive en casa de sus padres. Cliente vive en Mórrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. 

Se dedica a la venta de aves de corral y animales menores, los cuales cría en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Los engorda y cuando ya han alcanzado un nivel apropiado de desarrollo los comercializa entre los comerciantes de la zona.  Los ingresos que percibe por esta actividad los utiliza para ayudar a sus padres con sus gastos del hogar. Adicionalmente Yessica vende productos de belleza y cuenta con clientela fidelizada.

Yéssica desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales y comprar productos de belleza para poder responder a los pedidos de sus clientes.  Es por ello que para lograr su objetivo ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yessica is 19 years old, single and lives in the home of their parents. She lives in Mórrope, a district populated by humble and hardworking people that work in agriculture. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

She sells chickens and small animals, which she raises in pens in the back of the house. She fattens them and when they have reached an appropriate weight she sells them to merchants in the area. The income that she gets from this activity is used to help her parents with the costs of living. Additionally, Yessica sells beauty products and has a loyal clientele. 

Yessica wants to buy balanced feed for her animals and to buy beauty products to respond to the requests of her clients. In order to achieve her objective, she has asked for a loan of 800 nuevo soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced feed for her animals and beauty products to sell

loans.name: Maria Del Milagro

texts.es:
María tiene 42 años de edad, es casada y tiene 5 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial ubicado a 2 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María se dedica desde hace 8 años a la comercialización de leche. Este tiempo que le ha servido para adquirir experiencia en el rubro, así como también tener una clientela fidelizada.  Los ingresos que percibe de la venta de la leche le sirve para solventar los gastos de su familia y darle mejor calidad de vida. María desea aumentar su mercadería con la compra de más leche que pueda vender. Por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 42 years old, married, and has five children.  She lives together with her family in Olmos district, an agricultural area with quite a lot of commercial activity which is located two hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

María has been selling milk for 8 years.  Over the years she has gained experience in her business and a loyal customer base.  She uses the income that she makes from selling milk to cover her family's expenses and provide them with a better quality of life.  María would like to increase her stock by purchasing more milk to sell.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to increase her stock of milk to sell

loans.name: Julia

texts.es:
Julia tiene 55 años D. edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos los cuales son mayores e independientes. Vive en casa propia en el distrito D. José Leonardo Ortiz, una zona urbana, granD. y con vía D. crecimiento. Se encuentra unos veinte minutos D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, la capital D. la región D. Lambayeque. Su comunidad cuenta con los servicios D. agua potable y luz eléctrica.

Julia se dedica a la venta D. verduras en el Mercado Moshoqueque, un mercado granD. y con mucho movimiento comercial. Julia cuenta con cuatro puestos propios con los cuales sus hijos la ayudan. Ella tiene más D. 20 años D. experiencia en este rubro. Es muy conocida en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Con su crédito, Julia pretenD. comprar un lote D. verduras (zanahorias y zapallos) a un buen precio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo D. 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Julia tiene como visión la compra D. una camioneta para traer sus propios productos directo D. los agricultores.
texts.en:
Julia is 55 years old, married and has 3 children who are grown and independent. She lives in her own home in the district of Jose Leonardo Ortiz, an urban zone, large and growing. It is located some 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the region of Lambayeque. Her community has potable water and electricity. 

Julia sells vegetables in the Mercado Moshoqueque, a large market with a lot of commercial activity. Julia owns four stalls that her children help her with. She has been in this line of work for more than 20 years. She is very well known in the market and has an established clientele. With her loan, Julia hopes to buy a bundle of vegetables (carrots and gourds) at a good price. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 2000 nuevo soles from Edpyma Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Julia's vision is to buy a truck to bring her own products directly from the farmers.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of vegetables (carrots and gourds) at a good price

loans.name: Maria Josefa

texts.es: Maria tiene 36 años de edad, es separada y tiene 2 hijos. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Maria cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio. Allí ofrece en venta a sus clientes abarrotes y otros productos de primera necesidad. Tiene mas de dos años de experiencia en este negocio, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Adicionalmente, se dedica  a la crianza y venta de aves de corral en la parte posterior de su casa. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Desea usar una parte de su crédito para surtir su bodega con más mercadería (abarrotes). Con la otra parte, invertirá en su ganado. Pretende hacer arreglos a sus corrales para mejor protegerlos del sol. Tambien aumentará su ganado con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Para lograr sus metas, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles. Maria ha manejado otros prestamos de Edpyme Alternativa y pagó sus cuotas puntualmente.
texts.en:
Maria is 36 years old, separated and has two children. She lives in her own home in the rural part of Lambayeque district in the northern part of Peru. Maria runs a small store out of her home. There she offers groceries and other basic supplies for sale to her customers. She has over two years of experience in the business, that is to say, she knows this line of business like the palm of her hand. She has an established customer base in the area. Additionally, she raises and sells poultry in the back part of her home. Once her animals have reached an appropriate level of development she offers them for sale to the merchants who frequently visit the area.

She wishes to use part of the loan to supply her store with more merchandise (groceries). The other part she will use to invest in her livestock. She hopes to make repairs to their corrals to provide better protection from the sun. She will also purchase more birds and buy them a balanced feed. To achieve her aims she felt it was advisable to seek a loan of 1,000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa. Maria has handled other loans from Edpyme Alternativa and made her payments promptly.

loans.use: to stock her shop with merchandise, purchase more poultry and make repairs to their corrals.

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en:
Esperanza S. is from the village of Malibud, Gingoog City. She is 54 years old. Esperanza is widowed and has 2 school-aged children. To make a living, Esperanza owns & operates a sari-sari (variety) shop selling canned goods, snack foods, beverages & detergents. Esperanza has been engaged in her business for over 4 years and earns approximately 5000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2009, Esperanza joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Esperanza has successfully repaid a previous loan of 8000 PHP from HSPFI. The previous loan was used to to purchase additional inventory & working capital. Esperanza is requesting a new loan of 5000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional beverages & canned goods. This loan will be the 3rd loan taken out by Esperanza from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is one of accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional beverages & canned goods

loans.name: Monica Elizabeth

texts.es:
Monica tiene 27 años de edad, es casada y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa de su suegra con su esposo y sus hijos en el distrito de Tambogrande,una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Piura, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Monica vive en la parte céntrica de este distrito y cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz.

Se dedica a la preparación y venta de comida como salchipapas, salchipollos y gaseosas. Vende su comida y bebidas por las noches durante las horas de cenar. Tiene 2 años desarrollando su negocio. Monica es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con clientela ya establecida.  Cuenta con una refrigeradora, mesas, sillas y un carrito sanguchero, una unidad móvil no motorizada que viene equipada con todas las herramientas para preparar su comida. Monica solicita un crédito para comprar un nuevo refrigerador para mejor guardar sus productos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Monica  es conocida para Edpyme Alternativa, siendo éste su segundo crédito con la institución. Monico manejó bien su primer préstamo y tiene un buen historial creditico.
texts.en:
Monica is 27 years old, married, and has three children.  She lives in her mother-in-law's home, with her husband and children, in Tambogrande district.  This is an agricultural area which is located in Piura province, in the region of the same name, more than four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.  Monica lives in the central part of this district and has access to the basic services of water and electricity.

Monica's business is making and selling food such as salchipapas (a fast food made from thinly-sliced, pan-fried sausage or hot dog, french fries and condiments), salchipollos (a similar fast food but made with chicken) and sodas.  She sells her food and drinks in the evenings at dinner time.  Monica has been in her business for two years.  She is very well known in her area and has an established customer base.  She has a refrigerator, tables, chairs and a sandwich cart (a non-motorized vehicle which comes equipped with all the tools necessary for preparing her meals).

Monica is requesting this loan to buy a new refrigerator so that she can keep her products fresh.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  Monica is already known to Edpyme Alternativa as this is her second loan with the institution.  She managed her first loan well and has a good credit history.

loans.use: to buy a new refrigerator to keep the meals that she prepares and sells fresh

loans.name: Marina

texts.es: Marina tiene 46 años de edad, es casada y tiene hijos adultos e independientes. Vive junto a su esposo en el distrito de Pitipo que se encuentra en la provincia de Ferreñafe, a menos de una hora de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Su esposo labora como profesor en la sierra. Desde hace más de 10 años, Marina se dedica a la siembra de maíz amarillo y distintos tipos de frutas que le generan ingresos semanales. Maria puede cobrar un buen precio en el mercado para su maíz lo que le genera un buen margen de ganancias. Adicionalmente, cuenta con animales menores que cría y engorda para luego venderlos a sus vecinos y comerciantes que suelen visitar la zona. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de más insumos como semilla y herramientas de labranzas para su cultivo de maíz. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Marina ha manejado otros prestamos y tiene un buen historial de pago.
texts.en:
Marina is 46 years old, married, and has adult children who are independent.  She lives with her husband in the District of Pitipo in the Ferreñafe province, less than an hour from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region.  Her husband works as a teacher in the mountains.

For over 10 years, Marina has been planting yellow corn and different types of fruit to generate weekly income.  Marina can charge a good price
in the market for her corn, which in turn generates a good profit margin.  Additionally, she raises small animals to later sell to neighbors and merchants who often visit the area.  Marina wants to invest the loan in purchasing more inputs such as seeds and tools for growing crops of corn.  She has therefore deemed it proper to request a loan of 1500 nuevos soles.  Marina has managed other loans and has a good payment history.

loans.use: To buy more seeds and tools for growing crops of corn.

loans.name: Maria Margarita

texts.es: Maria tiene 26 años y es casada. Vive en casa propia junto a su esposo y dos hijos menores en un pequeño caserio ubicado a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Mórrope, un distrito poblado por gente humilde y trabajadora que se dedica a la agricultura. Se encuentra ubicado en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores, los cuales vende quincenalmente después de que ellos hayan alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso. Maria cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. Adicionalmente, genera ingresos adicionales vendiendo pescado de forma ambulante el cual reparte en su caserio y alrededores. Desea invertir su crédito en la compra de alimento para sus animales y en pescado para vender. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Este es el segundo préstamo que Maria ha solicitado de los prestamistas de Kiva. Canceló el primero y pagó sus cuotas de manera puntual. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer sus negocios, los que la ayuda sostener a su familia.
texts.en:
Maria is 26 years old and married. She lives in her own home together with her spouse and 2 young children in a small village located 20 minutes from the city of Mórrope, a district populated by humble and hardworking farmers. It is located in the province of Lambayeque, more than 40 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. 

She raises and sells small animals, which she sells every 15 days after they've reached a good size and weight. Maria raises her animals in pens behind her home. She also creates additional income by selling fish, walking through her neighborhood and the surrounding ones. She wants to invest her credit in buying feed for her animals and fish to sell. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. This is the second loan that Maria has asked for from the Kiva lenders. She paid off the first and made her payments punctually. She thanks the Kiva lenders for support in growing her businesses, which help sustain her family.

loans.use: to buy food for her cattle and fish to sell

loans.name: Feliciana

texts.es: Feliciana tiene  27 años D. edad. Vive con su esposo y dos hijos en un caserío cerca D. Jayanca en la región D. Lambayeque ubicado en el norte D. Perú. Cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio donD. se dedica a la comercialización D. artículos D. primera necesidad  como abarrotes y útiles escolares. Esta actividad la realiza desD. hace 08 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Además obtiene otros ingresos como trabajadora en una empresa agroindustria que elabora frutas y hortalizas. Solicita un crédito para la ampliación D. su negocio con la compra D. más abarrotes y productos D. primera necesidad. Así  generará más ingresos y podrá mejorar la calidad D. vida D. su familia.
texts.en:
Feliciana is 27 years old. She lives with her husband and two children in a village close to Jayanca in the region of Lambayeque, located in the north of Peru. She has a small grocery store in her home where she sells basic necessities like groceries and school supplies. She has been doing this for 8 years and knows the work well. She has an established clientele in the area. She also obtains income from working in an agro-industrial business that makes fruits and vegetables. 

She asks for a loan to increase her business by buying more groceries and basic goods. This way she will generate more income and be able to improve the quality of life of her family.

loans.use: to buy more groceries and basic necessities to sell

loans.name: Teresa Amparo

texts.es: Teresa tiene 52 años de edad, es soltera y tiene dos hijos que son independientes. Vive en casa propia,  que está ubicada en el caserío  San Isidro en el distrito de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque. Vive en la parte rural de este distrito y no cuentan con los servicios básicos de agua y luz. Teresa se dedica a la preparación y venta de helados y gelatinas en su domicilio, contando con equipos y refrigerador necesario para su negocio. Por el calor intensa que hace en su caserío, sus productos refrescantes son de gran demanda. Ella lleva 4 años realizando este negocio. Desea seguir creciendo en su negocio y por ello, solicita un préstamo de 1600 nuevos soles para la compra de más insumos para preparar sus gelatinas y helados.  También pretende hacer mejoras en su las partes de su vivienda donde vende sus productos.
texts.en:
Teresa is 52 years old, single and has two grown children. She lives in her own home in the village of San Isidro in the district of Tambogrande, an agricultural zone in the region of Piura, more than 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo which is the capital of the region of Lambayeque. She lives in the rural part of the district and they don't have basic services like water and electricity.

Teresa prepares and sells ice creams and jellos in her home, and has the equipment and refrigerator necessary for her business. Because of the intense heat in her village, her refreshing products are in great demand. She has been doing this for 4 years. She wants to continue increasing her business and for that reason has asked for a loan of 1600 nuevos soles to buy more ingredients to prepare her gelatin and ice cream. She also hopes to make improvements in the parts of her home where she sells her products.

loans.use: to buy more ingredients to prepare gelatin and ice cream

loans.name: Robert

texts.en: Robert is a twenty-eight year-old married man with four children, living in Fort Portal, Uganda.  He has a semi-permanent house, and his dream is to construct a permanent one and to educate his children.  He deals in the selling of agricultural produce and also cuts timber for a living.  He has been in business for five years and this has enabled him to maintain the family welfare.  He has limited capital to finance his activities and his desire is to have at least four acres of trees for lumbering. Robert needs the loan to buy trees for lumbering.

loans.use: to buy trees for lumbering.

loans.name: Regi Henry

texts.es: Regi tiene 34 años de edad y es soltero. Vive con sus padres en el distrito de Pueblo Nuevo, una zona joven y rural ubicada en la provincia de Chepen en el norte de Perú. Regi se dedica a la crianza y venta de animales menores. Los cria en corrales ubicados en un pequeño terreno cerca de su domicilio. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los ofrece en venta a los negociantes que suelen visitar la zona. Con su préstamo, Regi desea arreglar sus corrales para mejor proteger a sus animales ya que la zona donde vive no es muy segura. Tambien comprará alimento balanceado para usar en la crianza de sus animales. Espera que sus animales logren un mejor tamaño y peso para poder venderlos a un mejor precio. Regi agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en el crecimiento de su negocio,
texts.en: Regi is 34 years old and single. He lives with his parents in the district of Pueblo Nuevo, a new and rural zone located in the province of Chepen in the north of Peru. Regi raises and sells small animals. He raises them in pens on a small plot of land near his home. When they have reached a good level of development, he offers to sell them to the businessmen that usually visit the area. With his loan, Regi wants to fix his pens to better protect his animals, since the area where he lives isn't very secure. He will also buy balanced feed to use to raise his animals. He hopes that his animals will reach a good size and weight so that he can sell them for a better price. Regi thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in the growth of his business.

loans.use: to fix his pens and buy balanced feed for his animals

loans.name: Nvard

texts.en:
Nvard S. lives in the village of Sarukhan, in the Gegharkunik region, with her husband, father-in-law, mother-in-law, and daughter. Nvard runs a business and sells shoes at the market. Her business demand is increasing and she would like to purchase new inventory to help develop her business. 

Nvard is applying to SEF for a loan to purchase more shoes to sell. In the future, Nvard plans to expand her shoe business and increase her income.

loans.use: to purchase shoes to sell

loans.name: Edison

texts.en: Edison is a forty-seven year-old married man with eight children, living in his own semi-permanent house in Fort Portal, Uganda. The responsibility of looking after the family solely rests on him, and his desire is to educate his children and buy land.  After realizing that raising cattle has low returns, he decided to sell off some of the cows and start a shop.  He has been in business for five years. He has a challenge of bad debtors, and his future plan is to have a wholesale shop.  Edison intends to use the loan to buy rice, paraffin, and match boxes.

loans.use: to buy rice, paraffin and matchboxes.

loans.name: Grenter

texts.en:
Grenter is a married woman with nine children (two boys and seven girls), all of whom attend school. They live in a rental house that has neither electricity nor piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food, rent bills and school fees.

For over twenty years, Grenter has operated a tailoring business, selling in a shop to her neighbors and passersby.  Grenter has been able to educate her children and also provide basic needs. She faces a major challenge of competition from other tailors in her area of operation. She dreams of purchasing another sewing machine and expanding her business in the future. 

With the Kshs 30,000, she wants to purchase 20 pieces of cloth materials and thread.  She decided to work with Yehu Microfinance Trust to access funds to improve her living standards.

loans.use: to purchase 20 pieces of cloth materials and thread.

loans.name: Santos Julia

texts.es: Santos tiene 40 años de edad. Vive con su esposo y 2 hijos en el distrito de Jayanca, un distrito agrícola del departamento de Lambayeque, ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida criando y vendiendo ganado ovino y caprino. Los cria en una parte posterior de su domicilio. Cuando ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo, los ofrece en venta en el mercado local. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales y alimento balanceado. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles.  Con los ingresos que genera, Santos puede ayudar a su esposo con el sostenimiento de su familia. Agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en el crecimiento de su negocio.
texts.en: Santos is 40 years old and lives with her husband and two children. They live in the district of Jayanca, an agricultural area in the department of Lambayeque, located 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo. She makes a living raising and selling sheep and goats. She raises them in back of her home. When they have reached a good level of development, she sells them in the local market. She wants to increase her business by buying more animals and balanced feed. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 1500 nuevos soles. With the income that is generated, Santos will be able to help her husband to sustain their family. She thanks the Kiva lenders for their support in the growth of her business.

loans.use: to buy more cattle and balanced feed

loans.name: Saidaan's Group

texts.en:
Saidaan is a housewife as well as a working woman. She is a professional seamstress and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is very skillful and provides good quality services to her clients. She has been living in the city of Pakpattan (known for its agriculture) in Pakistan for the past 15 years. She lives there in a 2-room brick house with her family. Her husband’s name is M. A. and he is a watchman by profession.  

Saidaan is the mother of two sons; one is adopted by her and he is the elder one. He operates a business selling fish feed. Saidaan’s two biological children are illiterate and stay at home. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the further expansion of her adopted son's business. He wants to buy larger quantities of fish feed for resale. He has a good deal of experience in his business and Saidaan is confident that an investment will be a productive one for him. 

She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. She paid her installments on time in the previous loan year and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Saidaan.

loans.use: To buy fish feed for resale.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy tools for his construction business

loans.name: Claire

texts.en:
Claire is a twenty-five year-old married woman with two children, living in a rented house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She takes care of the family with the help of her husband, who is a taxi driver. Their goal is to build a residential house.  

For three years, Claire has been in the salon business.  She got her start-up capital of 2,000,000 Uganda shillings from her husband, and her current working capital is 3,000,000.  She has the challenge of the current inflation in the country, and irregular customers.  Her dream is to own a beauty parlor. Claire needs the loan to buy synthetic hair and setting lotions for the salon.

loans.use: to buy synthetic hair and setting lotions for the salon.

loans.name: Oscar

texts.es: Oscar tiene 60 años y es soltero. Vive en casa familiar en el distrito de Motupe, una zona agrícola que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y que se encuentra ubicada a una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Cliente vive en la parte rural del distrito no cuenta con servicios de agua y luz. Gana la vida vendiendo ganada para engorde. El vende animales menores a clientes de su caserio y sus alrededores que los crian y los engordan para luego venderlos a los comerciantes que suelen visitar los mercados locales. Oscar desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más animales menores y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá seguir generando buenos ingresos que usa para solventar sus gastos familiares y de su hogar.
texts.en:
Oscar is 60 years old and single.  He lives in his family home in Motupe district, an agricultural area in Lambayeque province, one and a half hours from the city of Chiclayo.  Oscar lives in the rural part of the district and he doesn't have access to water or electricity services.

Oscar earns a living selling livestock to be fattened.  He sells young animals to customers in his village and surrounding areas who then raise them and sell them to the traders who visit the local markets.

Oscar would like to expand his business by purchasing more young animals and balanced feed.  With this investment, he will be able to continue making good profits which he uses to cover his family and household expenses.

loans.use: to buy more livestock

loans.name: Juana Medaly

texts.es: Juana tiene 19 años de edad, es casada y tiene un hijo. Vive junto a su familia en el distrito de Olmos, una zona agrícola de bastante movimiento comercial que se encuentra situada en la provincia de Lambayeque, a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Gana la vida vendiendo productos de belleza a sus vecinos en su comunidad. Vende sus productos por catalogo y toma pedidos de sus clientes. Cuenta con dos años de experiencia con este negocio. Juana es muy conocida en su caserío y cuenta con clientela establecida. Desea ampliar su negocio con la compra de más mercadería. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 600 nuevos soles. Esta inversión la ayudará responder a los pedidos que ya ha recibido. Con los ingresos de su negocio, ayuda a su esposo solventar los gastos familiares y de su hogar. Juana posee muy buenas referencias personales y laborales de su comunidad.
texts.en:
Juana, 19 years old, is married and has one son. She lives with her family in the district of Olmos, an agricultural zone with a lot of commercial activity located in the province of Lambayeque, about an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. 

She makes her living selling beauty products to her neighbors in the community. She sells her products by catalog and takes orders from her clients. She has two years of experience with this business. Juana is well known in her neighborhood and counts on an established clientele. She wants to expand her business with the purchase of more merchandise. For this she has decided to request a loan of 600 new sols. This investment will help her respond to the orders she has received. 

With the income from her business she helps her husband meet the family expenses of their home. Juana has very good personal and work references from her community.

loans.use: To buy more beauty products for resale

loans.name: Bashraan's Group

texts.en:
Bashraan is a widow who stays at home and does her household responsibilities.  She is a mother of two sons. Her elder son is married and operates a breakfast stall where he serves his customers "Nan chanay" (made with chick peas and served with bread) while her younger son sells "Daal chawal" (a dish made with lentils and served with rice and pickle)  which is a traditional Punjabi dish. 

Bashraan has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her elder son who wants to improve his breakfast stall business. Thanks to the loan, he will purchase required ingredients such as spices, cooking oil, chick peas, etc. so that he can serve many more customers and enhance his monthly profits. He has been operating this business for the past 5 years and Bashraan is confident that he will successfully be able to improve his business after the loan investment. 

She belongs to Pakpattan which is a small city in Pakistan, known for its agriculture. She has been living there in a 2-room brick house with her family for the past 20 years. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 2nd loan application. In the previous loan year, she has proved herself to be a responsible client by paying her installments on time and attending every meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady raising her hand is Bashraan.

loans.use: To buy required ingredients such as spices, cooking oil and chick peas, etc. for breakfast stall

loans.name: Peter

texts.en:
Peter T. is a 35 year-old single, hardworking gentleman. He has been operating a mobile phone service, locally known as M-PESA.  He also sells phone accessories to his customers, who are mostly the residents of Kahawa Wendani, where he lives.

He has been in this business for three years and earns a profit of KES.10,000 per month. He is applying for his third loan, which he plans to use to increase his M-PESA float so that he can serve his customers well. He repaid the previous loans well and in good time.

The anticipated profits he will plow back into the business

loans.use: to increase the M-PESA float(money transfer service)

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to add stock of cement

loans.name: Rwengoma Twkirize Group

texts.en: Elizabeth is a forty-seven year-old single mother of four children, living in her own house in Fort Portal, Uganda.  She is solely charged with the responsibility of looking after her children.  Her greatest desire is to educate them up to university.  After separating from her husband, she decided to venture into goat-selling, and she also set up a retail shop.   She has been in business for four years. Elizabeth has challenges of limited capital to meet the demands of her customers and her dream is to own a ranch.  Elizabeth intends to use the loan to buy goats, rice, sugar, and soap to sell.

loans.use: to buy goats, rice, sugar, and soap.

loans.name: Lillian

texts.en:
Lillian M. S. has been selling household goods in Kariobangi south for seven years.  She is married to Boniface, and they have two school-aged children.

She was introduced to KADET LTD. by a friend.  She is applying for her second loan to enable her to buy more stock of household goods for sale. The generated income she will plow back into the business.
 
In the future, Lillian hopes to grow her business and to offer her children better education.

loans.use: to purchase more stock of household goods, like plates, spoons

loans.name: Sabra's Group

texts.en:
Sabra is a talented lady who operates a kite-making and selling business. She operates this business to financially support her family. Kite-making is a popular business in every city of Pakistan because people love to fly kites.  She makes good sales, particularly during the kite flying festival. In Urdu, the kite flying festival is known as "Basant". 

Sabra resides with her family in a 2-room brick house in the area of Shakr Gunj which is a small residential area in the city of Pakpattan. Pakpattan is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan, known for its agriculture. Her husband’s name is N. A. and he operates a fruit-selling business. His shop is located in the market and he offers good quality fresh seasonal fruit to his customers to earn income. 

Sabra has two sons and a daughter. All of them work to financially contribute to the family. Her elder son has a construction supplies business while the younger one works in a bicycle repair workshop. Her daughter sews clothes for her neighboring clients. 

Sabra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband’s business. He will utilize the loan to buy fresh seasonal fruit that will help him sell more and increase their earnings. He has been operating this business for the past 15 years and Sabra is hopeful that an investment will be a profitable one for him and will bring more profits in result.

loans.use: To buy fresh seasonal fruit for fruit-sales business.

loans.name: Samandar

texts.ru: Samandar P. rodilsya v 1961 qodu. On jenat i imeyet 3 detey. Samandar v Absheron regione uje 7 let vmeste so svoyey jenoy i detmi. Samandar 8 let kak nachal rabotat taxistom. Ranshe on zanimalsya skotovodstvom i raznosil moloko kefiri v magazini na mashine. No potom on reshil stat taxistom tak kak na etoy rabote on uje mojet ludshe soderjat svoyu semyu.
