With this loan, the women hope to make a monthly profit of 17,500 FCFA which will be used in their businesses.

loans.use: to purchase grains.

loans.name: Laïdou Group

texts.fr:
Le groupe LAÏDOU est composé de 10 femmes mariées qui ont une moyenne d’âge de 30 ans et de 3 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le village de DIOUTIEBOUGOU préfecture de BOUGOUNI, troisième région administrative de la république du Mali. Ces femmes se sont connues par des relations de mariage, de parenté et de commerce. 
Dans l’intention d’augmenter leurs ressources financières elles ont décidé d’adhérer à  l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso et cela pour faire le commerce de condiments alimentaires. Elles sont à leur septième prêt de groupe. Avec ce nouveau prêt, Assa D.  compte acheter, 7 boites de 2kg de concentrée de  tomate, 4 sacs de 25kg de sel, 10 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses qualités de condiments. Les produits sont payés auprès des grossistes de BOUGOUNI pour les revendre ensuite en détail, au comptant ou à crédit dans le village de DIOUTIEBOUGOU. Leur clientèle est composée essentiellement de femmes. Avec ce prêt, Assa espère obtenir un bénéfice mensuel de 15.000 F CFA  qui sera utilisé dans les frais de santé et d’éducation des enfants.
texts.en:
The LAIDOU group is made up of ten married women, who are on average 30 years old and have three children. They live in traditional extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husbands. These women reside in the village of DIOUTIEBOUGOU, BOUGOUNI prefecture (the third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). These women got to know each other through conjugal, family, and trade relations. They decided to join the Soro Yiriwaso microfinance institution with the intent to increase their financial resources, in order to engage in the trade of condiments. This is their seventh loan as a group.
With this new loan, Assa D.  intends to purchase seven two-kilo boxes of tomato paste, four 25-kilo bags of salt, ten 100-count packs of Maggi bouillon cubes, and various kinds of condiments. The products are paid to wholesalers in BOUGOUNI to then be retailed cash or credit in the village of DIOUTIEBOUGOU. Their client base is comprised mainly of women. With this loan, Assa hopes to make  15,000 CFA francs in monthly benefit, to be used for the children's healthcare and education expenses.

loans.use: to purchase condiments

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy maize, sugar, cooking fat and maize flour

loans.name: Barra Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe BARRA sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 25 ans et 2 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier Massablacoura de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Afin de satisfaire leurs clientèles en nette croissance, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de microfinance Soro Yiriwaso pour la première fois. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Aminata D. la présidente du groupe, compte acheter 5 boites de 2kg de tomate concentrée, 5 sacs de 25kg de sel, 3 paquets de 100 morceaux de cube maggi et diverses qualités de condiments., 20 cartons de savons auprès des grossistes de Bamako. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit au marché de Bougouni. 
Avec ce prêt Aminata D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 10.000 FCFA  qui sera utilisé pour soutenir les frais de santé des enfants.
texts.en:
The members of the BARRA group are all married women who average 25 years of age and two children each. They live in extended traditional conjugal families with their brothers, sisters, children and husbands. They reside in the Massablacoura district of the city of BOUGOUNI (third administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another as neighbors, and through ties of business and kinship.

In order to satisfy their growing customer base, they turned to the microfinance institution Soro Yiriwaso. Aminata D., president of the group, plans to use her loan to buy the following from Bamako wholesalers: five 2 kg boxes of condensed tomatoes, five 25 kg bags of salt, three 100-unit bags of Maggi cubes, various grades of condiments, and 20 boxes of soap. She sells at retail and wholesale at the Bougouni market, for cash or credit.

With this loan, Aminata D. hopes to earn a monthly profit of 10,000 FCFA, which she will use to cover her children’s healthcare expenses.

loans.use: to buy condiments

loans.name: Sabali Group

texts.fr:
Les femmes du groupe SABALI sont toutes mariées et ont une moyenne d’âge de 33 ans et 4 enfants. Elles vivent dans des familles conjugales traditionnelles élargies avec leurs frères, sœurs, co-épouses, enfants et époux. Ces femmes résident dans le quartier de Dougounina de la ville de BOUGOUNI, (troisième région administrative de la république du Mali). Ces  femmes se sont connues par des relations de commerce, de parenté et de voisinage. 
Afin de satisfaire leurs clientèles en nette croissance, elles ont décidé d’adhérer à l’institution de micro finance Soro Yiriwaso. Elles sont à leur deuxième prêt de groupe et  le premier a été correctement remboursés. 
Avec ce nouveau prêt Fatoumata D., compte acheter, 3 tonnes de céréales (mil, fonio, arachides, niébé etc.) auprès des producteurs des villages environnants. Elle effectue sa vente en détail et en gros, au comptant et à crédit, à domicile, dans le marché de Bougouni, aux consommateurs et revendeurs. 
Avec ce prêt Fatoumata  D. espère réaliser un bénéfice mensuel de 55.000 FCFA dont une partie sera utilisé dans les activités et l’autre partie dans les dépenses de la famille.
texts.en: The women of the group SABALI are all married, and they average 33 years of age and four children each. The women live in traditional conjugal extended families with their brothers, sisters, co-wives, children, and husband. And they reside in the Dougounina neighborhood of the village of BOUGOUNI (3rd administrative region of the Republic of Mali). They know one another through ties of commerce, kinship, and community. In order to satisfy their clearly growing customer base, the group members decided to join the micro-finance institution Soro Yiriwaso and are now on their second group loan. The first one was properly repaid. With this new loan, Ms. Fatoumata D. intends to buy 3 tonnes of grains (millet, fonio, peanuts, black-eyed peas, etc.) from producers of surrounding villages. Accepting cash or credit, she sells wholesale and retail at the house and at the Bougouni market. Her customer base is comprised of consumers and retailers. With this loan, Fatoumata hopes to make a monthly profit of 55,000 francs CFA. Part of the profits will be used for her work, and the other part, for family expenses.

loans.use: to buy grains

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy potatoes and tomatoes

loans.name: Pauline

texts.en: Pauline is a single mother of three.  She is able to raise her children with the income she gets from her cafeteria.  She has two years of experience in the business and has employed three people.  She also farms for extra income. Being a businesswoman, she needed a way to access loans easily; hence she registered for a group in Faulu Kenya, a partner of Kiva. Currently, she needs 20, 000 KES to buy a gas cylinder and furniture.

loans.use: to buy a gas cylinder and furniture

loans.name: Margaret

texts.en:
Margaret is a widow with five children, all of whom attend school. She lives at a rental house that has electricity and piped water. Her greatest monthly expenses are food and school fees. 

For the past two years, Margaret has operated a firewood selling business, selling from her home to her neighbors and passersby. She also runs a tailoring business, which contributes to her income. She faces the major challenge of high transportation costs in her business. She dreams of expanding her business in the future.

With the KES 50,000 she is requesting, Margaret wants to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale. She decided to join Yehu to access loans to boost her business.

loans.use: to purchase bundles of wheat flour, maize flour and sugar for sale

loans.name: Florence

texts.en:
Florence is 33 years old and a single mother.  She is able to raise her 4-year-old child with the income from her salon. She has been in the salon business for six years.  

Since she joined Faulu Kenya, she has become more focused in her business.  She is looking forward to opening another outlet of her business in the future.  

She has requested 20,000 Kenyan shillings to buy a facial machine.

loans.use: to buy a facial machine

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace K., 36 years old, is married and the mother of three children aged between 4 and 16 years old. She is a business lady operating a retail shop, which she has been doing for the last five years. 

She learned about KADET from a colleague who is already a KADET registered client. This marks her first loan, which she is planning to use to expand her business. Her retail shop is situated on a strategic point in the town and she hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business. 

Her hopes and dream is to become a great business lady. She is an energetic woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying sugar, rice and beverages

loans.name: Óscar De Jesús

texts.es:
A sus 63 años de edad, Óscar se siente orgulloso de ser emprendedor y de trabajar diariamente largas jornadas para ofrecerle un mejor futuro a su familia y mejorar su calidad de vida. De su padre aprendió el oficio del campo y fue así como desde hace algunos años decidió darle vida a su propio negocio, es así como empezó a cultivar tomate de árbol, café, maíz y fríjol que son ahora su fuente de sustento. 

Los cambios climáticos, las plagas y la falta de recursos para mejorar su negocio, son algunas de las limitaciones a las que se enfrenta este campesino que actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar insumos agropecuarios y reparar su invernadero.
texts.en:
At 63 years of age, Oscar feels proud to be an entrepreneur and to work long hours each day to provide a better future for his family and improve their quality of life.  He learned to farm from his father, and then some years ago he decided to start his own business, so he started to cultivate the tamarillos, (also known as tree tomatoes), coffee, corn and beans that are now his source of livelihood.

Changes in the weather, pests and the lack of funds to improve his business are some of the constraints that this farmer faces.  At this time he needs a loan to buy agricultural supplies and to repair his greenhouse.

loans.use: to buy farming supplies and to repair his greenhouse

loans.name: Agnes

texts.en:
Agnes W. M. has been selling beverages for the last four years in Mwiki town. She is divorced and a mother of two school-going children. Out of this business, she gets an income of 5,100 Kenyan shillings per month.

She is applying for her first loan from KADET LTD to start up a new business selling rice; the anticipated profit she will save and also use to pay school fees for her children.

In the future, Agnes hopes to grow her business to educate her children and improve the living standards of her family. She also dreams of buying a pickup for the business.

loans.use: To start selling rice

loans.name: Loise

texts.en: Loise is 41 years old and a single mother. She runs a mobile phone money transfer business. She also sells beverages in the same business premise. She has been in this business for 2 years. In addition, she does farming. She believes that through Faulu Kenya she will open other branches of her business in the future. She has requested 20,000 KES to buy mobile phone credit cards and add capital in her mobile phone money transfer business.

loans.use: to buy mobile phone credit cards and add capital in her mobile phone money transfer business

loans.name: Dalmas

texts.en:
Dalmas is a married man with 5 children, all of whom attend school. He lives in a rental house that has electricity and piped water. His greatest monthly expenses are school fees and food for the family. He has operated a goat meat business for the past 5 years. His potential customers are community members and butchers.

With the 20,000 KES he is requesting, Dalmas wants to purchase 10 goats to sell for meat. Dalmas decided to work with Yehu to access loans to boost his business.

loans.use: to purchase 10 goats

loans.name: Mary

texts.en: Mary is a registered member of Joy Kajiado group in Faulu Kenya. She joined the group so that she could easily access loans from Faulu Kenya because the members of the group guarantee each others' loans. For a living, she runs a retail shop. She has been in the business for 10 years. Previously, she was farming. She hopes to build rental houses within 10 years. She has requested 20,000 KES to pay school fees for her 3 children.

loans.use: to pay school fees

loans.name: Mario De Jesús

texts.es:
Mario de Jesús Z. Z. heredó de su padre un negocio familiar, estadero que se ha convertido en la forma de ganarse la vida porque como el mismo lo afirma se la ha rebuscado para que el negocio permanezca en el tiempo y cautive cada vez más clientes pues de eso depende que él y su familia cubran sus necesidades familiares. 

Actualmente, Mario necesita de un préstamo para comprar surtido y así tratar de incrementar sus ventas, ya que el inventario poco a poco se ha ido acabando.  De este préstamo depende que este emprendedor y su familia sigan trabajando en esta herencia que ha sido su forma de vida.
texts.en:
Mario de Jesús Z. Z. inherited a family business from his father, a bar that has become a way to earn a living.   As he says, he has worked hard so that the business continues, and with time he has attracted more customers.  His family depends on the income to cover household expenses.

Now Mario needs a loan to buy supplies and to try to increase sales since his inventory is running out.  This loan will help the entrepreneur and his family continue with the inheritance that has become their way of life.

loans.use: To buy supplies

loans.name: Grace

texts.en:
Grace W. M. is 38 years old, married to John and together they are blessed with 4 children. She has been selling farmers' choice products for the last 12 years and gets an income of 9,600 KES.


She has never borrowed from any other MFI. She is applying for her fourth loan, which she plans to buy more stock of farmers' choice products like sausages and hot dogs to sell.  She will use the anticipated profit to pay school fees for her children.


In the future, she hopes to grow her business and open a grocery store. She desires to educate her children to a higher level of education.

loans.use: to buy more stock of sausages and hot dogs for sale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase and insure a dairy cow

loans.name: Nairoshi Ene

texts.en:
Nairoshi Ene K. is 46 years old, married and a mother of 5 children. She is a business lady who deals with ornaments and necklaces and has been doing so for the past 15 years. She sells her products in Narok town, specifically to tourists in the area.


She was introduced to KADET LTD by a registered client. She is planning to expand her business with her first loan. She hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest back into her business.


Her hope and dream is to become a great businesswoman. She is a lively woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to expand her business by buying more ornaments and necklaces for sale

loans.name: Onesmus

texts.en: Onesmus is a 31-year-old, married man. He is blessed with 3 children. He uses his motorbike to supply water to homesteads.  He has sustained his business for 5 years and has employed one person. He also does dairy farming for extra income. Onesmus really appreciates Faulu Kenya because with their help, he has managed to buy a piece of land. He hopes to put up big water tanks in the future. Onesmus has requested 20,000 KES to buy water tanks.

loans.use: to buy water tanks

loans.name: Annette

texts.en:
Annette is 34 years old and married to Chrispine. She has 6 children. She operates a hotel in the Kangemi area. She has been in this business for a period of 6 years. 

With this loan, she plans to buy cooking oil, flour, rice, and other food stuffs. This is her first loan from KADET LTD and she is hopeful that it will boost her business. 

Annette desires to give her children a better education and a good life to the family.

loans.use: to buy food items for her hotel

loans.name: Saturnina

texts.es: La señora Saturnina se dedica a la crianza de ganado lechero y es productora de leche y su esposo es albañil constructor, el crédito lo requiere para la compra de una vaca lechera de buena calidad para incrementar su producción de leche; vive en casa propia ubicada en la localidad de Achacachi en la provincia Omasuyos; es casada y tiene dos hijos.
texts.en: Saturnina has a business raising dairy cows and she also produces milk.  Her husband is a bricklayer in the construction sector.  Saturnina needs a loan to buy a good quality dairy cow so that she can increase her milk production.  She lives in her own home, located in Achacachi in the Omasuyos province.  She is married and has 2 children.

loans.use: to buy a dairy cow to increase her production of milk

loans.name: Wangninan De Dessah 2 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement WANGNINAN DE DESSAH 2 est composé de 23 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier et qui mènent ensemble certaines activités. La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Agossi Emilienne, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Agossi Emilienne est née le 30 Juin 1972 à Ifangni, dans le département de l'Ouémé. Mariée à un maçon du nom de Lucien, Agossi Emilienne est mère de quatre enfants, tous scolarisés. Il y a environs quinze ans que la famille s'est installée à Tchaada / Dessah dans l'Ouémé. Le couple assure ensemble les charges de la maison. Depuis cinq ans, Agossi Emilienne mène comme activité la vente de maïs et d'huile de palme qu'elle transforme ensemble avec ses autres membres. C'est au marché d'Ikpinlè et aussi à Cotonou que Agossi Emilienne s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de satisfaire sa clientèle, Agossi Emilienne sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est de diversifier davantage son activité afin d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
Group WANGNINAN OF DESSAH 2 is composed of 23 members who live all in the same neighborhood and who undertake certain activities together. 

The president, named Agossi Emilienne, has a hand raised on the photograph. 

With the aim of raising the level of their activity in order to better face the demands of their customers, this group solicits their first financial support from ALIDé. 

Agossi Emilienne was born on June 30, 1972 in Ifangni, in the department of l' Ouémé. 

Married to a mason of the name of Lucien, Agossi Emilienne is mother of four children, all in school. The family has been in Tchaada/Dessah in l' Ouémé for about fifteen years.

The couple carry the household together. 

Agossi Emilienne has sold corn and palm oil that she transforms together with the other members.

The supply is from the market d' Ikpinlè as well as in Cotonou. 

With an aim of increasing her business and of satisfying her customers, Agossi Emilienne requests a loan from ALIDé.

Her ambition is to diversify her activity to increase her income.

loans.use: to buy palm nuts and bags of maize

loans.name: Jane

texts.en:
Jane is 37 years old. She is married to Hamed, and together they have 4 children; ages between 7 and 22 years old. Jane's primary business is selling honey. She has been doing this for the past year.

Jane hopes that with this loan she will be able to add more stock and grow the business substantially. She wants to buy some honey from the locals to sell. 

In the future, she plans to diversify her business and start selling cereals like rice and other grains.

loans.use: to buy honey to sell

loans.name: Cristian

texts.es: El señor Cristian tiene un snack donde vende hamburguesas, salchipapas, pizzas y refrescos; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de sillas y  mesas para ofrecer mayor comodidad a sus clientes. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona de 14 de septiembre de la ciudad de La Paz;  es soltero  y no tiene hijos.
texts.en: Cristian has a snack bar where he sells hamburgers, salchipapas (a dish with sausage and potatoes), pizzas and soft drinks.  He needs a loan to purchase chairs and tables so that he can offer greater comfort to his customers.  He lives in a rented home located in the "14 de septiembre" neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  He is single and does not have children.

loans.use: to buy tables and chairs so that he can offer greater comfort to the customers of his snack shop

loans.name: Meluan

texts.en:
Meluan O. K., aged 55, is married and has eight children. He lives in Ntulelr-Narok, Kenya and has been in farming for the last four years.
Meluan is a humble client. He found out about Kiva partner, KADET, through other clients registered in the area in which he lives. This will be his second loan from KADET and he intends to use the loan to prepare the land for farming. He intends to plow back his anticipated profits into the farm and dreams of being a big farmer one day. He can do more if provided with the resources.

loans.use: to prepare the land for farming

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase three sacks of charcoal, twenty liters of cooking oil, mugs and plates for her cafe

loans.name: Josephine Atieno

texts.en:
Josephine Atieno O. runs a salon as her primary business and a car hire business as a secondary business. She has been working in these businesses for 12 years in the summer and earns an income of 12,000 KES. She is widowed and blessed with five children.
Josephine has applied for her first loan from Kiva partner, KADET. She plans to use the entire loan amount to purchase more beauty products for resale. She will use her anticipated profits to pay school fees for her children. Josephine hopes to expand and improve her car hire business by purchasing a new vehicle.

loans.use: to purchase more beauty products for resale

loans.name: Sambacouda Group

texts.fr:
Le Banc Villageois de SAMBACOUNDA est composé de 27 femmes qui sont toutes issues du même village que porte le nom dudit Banc Villageois. Le Banc Villageois est créé en décembre 2008 , mois de son inauguration. L'activité principale des femmes est le petit commerce, et en hivernage elles pratiquent l'agriculture avec les cultures vivrières. 

Madame BAMBY K. (tout à fait à droite de la photo, et un peu en retrait vers l'avant) est présidente du Banc Villageois. Elle est âgée de 44 ans. Elle est mariée et mère de 04 enfants. 

Avec son nouveau crédit elle envisage fiancer son activité de petit commerce d'huile de palme et de pâte d'arachide.

Elle va acheter de l'huile de palme et des arachide qu'elle va transformer en pâte qu'elle vend dans le village et les marchés hebdomadaires de sa localité.

Son objectif est de participer à l'amélioration des conditions de vie de sa famille, assurer la santé et l'éducation de ses enfants.
texts.en:
Le Banc Villageois of SAMBACOUNDA is composed of 27 women who all come from the village of Sambacounda.  Le Banc Villageois was created in December of 2008, the month of its inauguration.  These women mainly run small businesses and in the winter work to grow food.  
Madame Bamby K. (all the way to the left in the photo, and somewhat behind the one in front of her) is the president of the Banc Villageois.  She is 44 years old. She is married and the mother of 4 children. 
With her new loan, she plans to finance her small business to buy palm oil and peanut paste.
She is going to buy the palm oil and the peanuts, that she will turn into paste and sell, in the village and at the weekly markets in her area.  
Her goal is to contribute to improving her family’s living conditions and to ensure the health and education of her children.

loans.use: to buy palm oil and peanuts

loans.name: Concerned Mothers-Kampala Group

texts.en: Betty M., a 47-year-old happily married mother of four, has been running a clothing sales business for the past ten years in Royal-Kampala. She says she began this business after the completion of her university studies. Betty says that hard work, determination and prayers have brought her far in her business. She also has a small school that she runs. This business generates a monthly profit of 300,000 UGX. With this loan, Betty says she is going to purchase more bales of clothes to resell.

loans.use: to purchase more bales of clothing to resell

loans.name: Chrispin

texts.en: Chrispin is 26 years old and married. He runs a tailoring business, which he has sustained for three years because he is a very hardworking man. He is able to attract more customers to his business even though the business is located in a competitive environment. Chrispin hopes to expand his business in the future. He has requested a loan of 20,000 KES to buy a sewing machine and fabric.

loans.use: to buy a sewing machine and fabric

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase winter bedding and sports shoes for children

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria teresa se dedica a la venta de frijoles cosidos, leña, leche y bolsitas. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este negocio, anteriormente ella se dedicaba a la venta de comida pero como se traslado a vivir con su esposo tuvo que empezar un nuevo negocio. La mayoría de sus clientes llegan a comprar los productos que ofrece que son de primera necesidad, para las personas que viven cerca su vivienda, ya que es aquí donde está ubicado su negocio. El financiamiento que solicita es para la compra de los productos como frijoles, leña, leche, azúcar, frutas, bolsas para la elaboración de sus bolsitas.
texts.en: Maria Teresa has a business selling cooked beans, firewood, milk and "bolsitas" (beverages sold in little plastic bags.)  She has had this business for more than 20 years.  Before that, she had a business selling food, but since she moved to be with her husband she had to start a new business.  Most of her customers come to buy the everyday consumer goods that she sells.  She sells to the people who live near her house, since that is where her business is located.  The loan that she requests will be used to purchase products such as beans, firewood, milk, sugar, fruit and plastic bags to make her "bolsitas."

loans.use: to buy beans, firewood, milk, sugar, fruit, and plastic bags to make her "bolsitas"

loans.name: Naisiae Ene

texts.en:
Naisiae Ene R. T. is 41 years old, married to John T. (who is a farmer) and has six children. She is a businesswoman who deals with ornaments and necklaces. She has been in this business for the last three years and makes a monthly income of 5,000 KES.
Naisiae was introduced to Kiva partner, KADET, by a registered client. This is her first loan, with which she is planning to buy more jewelry items for resale. She hawks her products due to the presence of tourists in the area.
Naisiae hopes to use the profit from this loan to reinvest into her business. Her hope and dream is to become a great businesswoman. She is a vigorous woman who is dedicated to her work and who can do more if supported financially.

loans.use: to buy more jewelry items for resale

loans.name: Mujeres Encantadoras Group

texts.es: Este grupo se llama MUJERES ENCANTADORAS, las integrantes eligieron el nombre porque añoran el éxito cotidiano en su negocios, buscando  una oportunidad  de tener más ventas y crecer. Están ubicadas en el Estado de México,en México. El grupo está conformado por 11 integrantes y es la primera vez que solicitan un prestamio. Micaela S. M. es integrante del grupo. Tiene 43 años, estudió hasta la secundaria, es ama de casa y tiene 2 hijos, una mujer y un hombre. Ella se dedica a la venta de equipos  de telefonia que inició hace 5 años. Solicita el prestamo para adquirir más equipos y tener una variedad de productos que sus clientes le demandan mas equipos recientes en una gran variedad de marcas. Sus clientes son aledañas de la comunidad, prefieren comprar los productos con ella por la calidad, buen servicio que ofrece y la atención muy amable de la señora, eso ayuda a incrementar su mercado. Al monento  de solicitar este  préstamo se siente con mucha alegria de tener la oportunidad de invertir nuevamente y poder distribuir más producto en movimiento. Su negocio es tan importante ya que con ello puede salir adelante con los gastos de su familia y asi tener una mejor calidad de vida tanto de ella como la de sus hijos que añora darles una carrera  profesional  para tener un mejor futuro. Observaciones, la señora que no se ve en la foto se llama Maria Guadalupe H.
texts.en: This group  is called "Mujeres Encantadoras" (Enchanting Women.)  The members chose this name because they yearn for the daily success of their businesses.  They are looking for an opportunity to increase their sales and grow their businesses.  They are located in the state of Mexico in Mexico.  This group has 11 members, and this is the first time that they have requested a loan.  Micaela S. M. is a member of the group.  She is 43 years old, and has a middle school education.  She is a housewife who has 2 children: a boy and a girl.  She has a business selling telephone equipment that she started 5 years ago.  She requests a loan so that she can buy more equipment and have the variety of products that her customers demand: newer equipment in a greater variety of brands.  Her customers are from the areas surrounding her community.  They prefer to buy from her because of the quality of her products, the good service that she offers, and the friendly attention that she provides them, which helps her to expand her customer base. At this time, as she requests this loan, she feels very happy to have the opportunity to make a new investment in her business and to be able to distribute more products.  Her business is so important, since with it she can cover the household expenses and in this way have a better quality of life for herself and her children.  She also yearns to provide her children with a professional degree so that they can have a better future.  Note that the woman that is not seen in the photo is Maria Guadalupe H..

loans.use: to invest in cellular telephones

loans.name: Brigith

texts.es: La señora Brigith se dedica a la venta de diferentes artefactos para el hogar; el crédito lo requiere para la compra de ollas, escobas, lámparas, etc., pues sus clientes le han hecho muchos pedidos; con las actividades que realiza cubre los gastos que tiene. Vive en anticretico ubicada en la zona  Cotahuma de la ciudad De La Paz, es casada y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la segunda vez que solicita un crédito a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Brigith makes a living selling a variety of household products. She is requesting the loan to purchase pots, brooms, lamps and other items that are in high demand from her customers. Her work covers her expenses. She leases a home located in the Cotahuma area of the city of La Paz, and is married and has two children. This is the second loan she has requested through Kiva.

loans.use: to purchase pots, brooms, lamps and other items

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy farm inputs

loans.name: Luz Mery

texts.es:
Desde hace 6 años, cuando Luz Mery A. Osorio perdió a su esposo en un accidente de tránsito, esta emprendedora mujer a la que la vida la golpeó se vio enfrentada a llevar las riendas del hogar, fue entonces cuando valiéndose de su conocimiento acerca de la confección, empezó a realizarle costuras a sus vecinos y conocidos, desde entonces esta es la manera como ella se gana la vida. 

Actualmente Luz Mery necesita de un préstamo para comprar materia prima y poder responder con prontitud a sus pedidos. En el futuro espera tener un taller en el que pueda emplear a mujeres que al igual que ella son cabeza de hogar.
texts.en: Six years ago Luz Mery lost her husband in a traffic accident, and this enterprising woman was forced to take the reins of her household. She started taking advantage of her knowledge of sewing and started making items for neighbors and acquaintances. This is how she has made a living ever since. Currently, Luz Mery is requesting a loan to purchase sewing supplies so she can respond quickly to her orders. In the future she hopes to have a sewing shop where she can employ women who like her are head of their households.

loans.use: to purchase sewing supplies

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to purchase primary-need items to stock store

loans.name: Henry

texts.en: Henry is 43 years old and a father of four. He does quarrying to earn a living. He has two years of experience in the business. Being a businessman, he joined Kiva partner, Faulu Kenya, so that he could access business loans easily. Henry works with two casual laborers in his business. He hopes to expand his business in the future. Henry has requested a loan of 15,000 KES to hire more land for quarrying and to purchase tools.

loans.use: to hire more land for quarrying and to purchase tools

loans.name: Sor Miriam

texts.es:
Las necesidades económicas por las que atravesaba la familia de Sor Miriam conformada por su esposo y sus dos hijos fueron el impulso para que esta emprendedora empezara a hacer de la tradicional arepa su propio negocio, una entrada familiar que aunque como ella misma lo afirma no son muchas las ganancias por lo menos se equilibran los gastos del hogar. 

Actualmente Sor necesita de un préstamo para realizar algunas adecuaciones locativas, pues para poder continuar vendiendo su producto deberá cumplir con unas normas básicas de sanidad.
texts.en:
The economic needs faced by the family of Sor Miriam -- made up of her husband and their two children -- were the impetus for this entrepreneur to start her own business making traditional arepas [corn cakes]. Although she admits that the profits from this source of family income are not large, at least the household expenses are covered.

Currently, Sor needs a loan to carry out some improvements to her work area, since in order to continue selling her product, she will have to comply with some basic health standards.

loans.use: to improve her work area in order to meet basic health standards

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy auto parts, tools, tires, auto glass, and other products that he needs to provide good service

loans.name: Therese

texts.en:
Therese is 48 years old and married with four children between 15 and 25 years old. She is a tailor and her business is well organized. She employs one person in her business to help her. Her business runs from 6am until 8pm every day except on Sunday. She has one year of experience in this business.

Therese has requested a loan from Kiva lenders to purchase a new machine for tailoring. With the profit, Therese will expand her business, save for the future and build her own house.

loans.use: To purchase a new machine for tailoring.

loans.name: Claudia Milena

texts.es:
A sus 22 años y como madre soltera, Claudia Milena, de origen campesino y sin la oportunidad de estudiar o encontrar un trabajo que le permitiera sacar adelante a su hija de 3 años de edad, esta joven se vio en la necesidad de emprender su propio negocio, un criadero de cerdos que sus padres le permitieron tener al lado de su casa. 

Esta es la manera como Claudia se gana la vida, cubre sus gastos, los de su hija y aporta a los gastos de su familia. Su sueño es crecer con este negocio pues así considera que su hija tendrá más oportunidades para salir adelante. Actualmente necesita de un préstamo para comprar 12 cerdos y cuido de engorde y así aumentar sus ingresos e ir creciendo poco a poco en la medida de sus posibilidades.
texts.en:
At the age of 22 and as a single mother, Claudia Milena -- who is from the countryside and did not have the opportunity to study or find a job that would permit her to provide a better future for her 3-year-old daughter -- saw the need to start her own business: raising pigs in a stall that her parents allowed her to set up beside their house. 

This is the way in which Claudia earns a living and covers her expenses and those of her daughter; she also contributes to her family's expenses. Her dream is to expand this business, since she thinks it will help her give her daughter better opportunities to get ahead. Currently, she needs a loan to buy 12 pigs and supplies to fatten them up, so that she can increase her income and expand little by little to the extent of her ability.

loans.use: to buy pigs and supplies to fatten them up

loans.name: Edith

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Edith, es soltera y tiene 38 años de edad,  tiene una hija de 12 años de edad, ella es secretaria en una institución privada y también tiene un pequeño negocio  propio la socia tiene un cafetín en el poblado de Limatambo, ella  suele invertir el dinero que se presta en la compra de servicios, vajillas, sillas, insumos, frutas del día, azúcar, café, y otros. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de insumos y servicios para implementar su cafetín.

La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This borrower belongs to San Rafael Communal Bank, located in the District of Huanchac, part of the Province and Department of Cusco.

Edith is single and is 38 years old. She has a 12-year-old daughter and is a secretary at a private institute. She also has a small business – a café in the town of Limatambo. She often invests the money borrowed in the purchase of services, dishes, chairs, supplies, fruits of the day, sugar, coffee, and other items. She is requesting the loan to invest in the purchase of supplies and services for her café.

Edith values and appreciates the loan granted and promises to make her payments on time.

loans.use: to purchase supplies and services for her café.

loans.name: Jacinto

texts.es: El  señor Jacinto tiene su movilidad y trabaja como chofer de transporte de pasajeros. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de llantas nuevas, pues las que está usando están viejas y no desea tener ningún accidente. Vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Bajo Tacagua de la ciudad de La Paz, es casado y tiene dos hijos. Los anteriores créditos también los utilizo para el mantenimiento de su automóvil. Es cliente de IMPRO desde el año 2009.
texts.en: Jacinto has a vehicle and works as a taxi driver.  He needs a loan to buy new tires, since the ones that he is using are old and he doesn't want to end up having an accident.  He lives in his own home in the Lower Tacagua neighborhood of the city of La Paz.  He is married and has 2 children.  He has used prior loans to maintain his automobile.  He has been a client of IMPRO since 2009.

loans.use: to buy tires for his taxi

loans.name: Rosario

texts.es: La señora Rosario tiene un puesto de venta de queques, empanadas y todo referente a masitas; el crédito lo requiere para la compra insumos como ser: harina, azucar, levadura, saborisantes, etc.; vive en casa propia ubicada en la zona de Tembladerani de la ciudad de La Paz,  es casada  y tiene dos hijos. Esta es la sexta vez que solicita un préstamo de IMPRO y la segunda a través de Kiva.
texts.en: Rosario has a stall where she sells cakes, empanadas and all other kinds of pastries.  She requires a loan to buy supplies such as flour, sugar, yeast, flavorings, etc.  Rosario lives in her own home which is located in Tembladerani district, in the city of La Paz.  She is married and has two children.  This is the sixth time that she has requested a loan from IMPRO and her second loan through Kiva.

loans.use: to buy flour, sugar and other supplies for her business preparing and selling cakes, empanadas and other pastries

loans.name: Noemi Luz

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Noemi Luz, es casada y tiene 51 años de edad, ella tiene 4 hijos de los cuales 2 son ya mayores e independientes y otros dos de 16 y 15 años que las socia todavía los apoya tanto en los estudios como en lo moral y material; la socia tiene una tienda de ferretería, ella vende todo tipo de materiales para la construcción, la socia trabaja con su esposo y su hija, ella nos comenta que cada año ella prospera de forma gradual y que cuenta con el apoyo de su familia para llevar adelante esta tienda. La socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales para abastecer su tienda ferretería.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Noemi Luz is a member of the "SAN RAFAEL” community bank which is located in Huanchac district, in Cusco province, in Cusco department.  She is 51 years old, married, and has four children.  Two of her children are grown up and live independently.  The other two are 16 and 15 and she still supports them in their studies as well as morally and materially.

Noemi Luz has a hardware store where she sells all kinds of construction supplies.  She works with her husband and her daughter.  She tells us that every year she is gradually prospering and that she has her family's support in running her store.  She is requesting a loan to invest in buying materials to stock her store.

Noemi Luz is appreciates the loan she has been granted and is grateful for it.  She pledges to make her loan repayments in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying materials to stock her hardware store

loans.name: Daynor

texts.es: El señor Daynor es chofer y tiene una movilidad de transporte de pasajeros y su esposa es comerciante; con las actividades que ambos realizan cubren los gastos que tiene. El crédito lo requiere para la compra de un motor nuevo, pues el que ahora está instalado en su vehiculo ha comenzado a fallar y esto es peligroso por el hecho de que transporta pasajeros. Vive en alquiler ubicada en la zona  de Achachicala de la ciudad De La Paz, es casado y tiene un hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en:
Daynor is a driver with his own vehicle for transporting passengers; his wife is a storekeeper. The work they both do covers their expenses.
Daynor needs the loan to buy a new motor because the one in his car now has started to break down, making it dangerous to transport passengers.
Daynor lives in a rental located in the Achachicala district of the city of La Paz. He and his wife have one child. This is his first loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: to purchase a motor for his transportation vehicle

loans.name: Rosa Aura

texts.es:
Rosa Aura Z. L. aprendió al lado de su hermana a realizar diferentes productos fritos típicos que después se convirtieron en la fuente de sustento para ella y su familia, su negocio ubicado en la orilla de la carretera ofrece sus productos a turistas que pasan por la zona así como a los camioneros que frecuentan el lugar.

El invierno es una de las mayores dificultades que atraviesa esta emprendedora, por ello, necesita de un préstamo para comprar una carpa y surtido para mejorar su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa Aura Z. L. learned at her sister's side how to make various typical fried dishes, which later turned into a livelihood for her and her family. Her business is located on the side of the road. She sells her products to tourists passing through and truck drivers who frequent the area.
The rainy season is one of the biggest challenges that this entrepreneur faces, which is why she needs this loan to buy a stall covering and supplies to improve her business.

loans.use: to purchase a stall covering and supplies

loans.name: Luis

texts.es: El  señor Luís es chofer y trabaja en el sindicato de transportistas Eduardo Avaroa, el crédito lo requiere para la el arreglo del motor de su vehiculo; vive en casa de sus padres ubicada en la zona de Ciudad Satélite en la ciudad de  El Alto, es casado y tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que trabaja con IMPRO y KIVA.
texts.en:
Luís is a driver and works with the Eduardo Avaroa transportation workers union. He needs this loan to fix his vehicle’s motor.
He lives in his parents’ house located in the Ciudad Satélite area of the city of El Alto. He is married and has one child. This is his first time working with IMPRO and Kiva.

loans.use: to repair his transportation vehicle's motor

loans.name: Las Cuatro Fantasticas Group

texts.es:
El grupo las Cuatro Fantásticas está conformado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras; ellas son Gema Suyen P., Javiera O., Teresa Matamoros y Francisca Teresa Ríos. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora P. de 26 años quien se dedica al comercio de ropa.
Ella inicio este negocio por ayuda de sus tías quienes le mandaban ropa para vender y luego ella continúo con el negocio con ayuda de su hermana.
Mientras O. de 20 años vende ropa y zapatos desde hace 3 años e invertirá en mercadería, Matamoros de 27 años comercializa productos Arabela y Ríos de 34 años tiene carritos de hot-dog, chicha y frijoles.
texts.en:
The "Cuatro Fantásticas" group is made of up four hard-working, strong and entrepreneurial women; they are Gema Suyen P., Javiera O., Teresa Matamoros and Francisca Teresa Ríos. The group's coordinator is Mrs P., 26, who is in the clothing business.
She started this business through the aid of her aunts who used to order clothes from her to sell and then she continued in this business with the aid of her sister.
O., 20, has sold clothes and shoes for 3 years and will invest in stock, Matamoros, 27, sells Arabela products, and Ríos, 34, has a van selling hot-dogs, chicha and beans.

loans.use: To buy clothing stock for the summer season.

loans.name: Simon

texts.es: El señor Simon es chofer y tiene un vehiculo de transporte de pasajeros  y su esposa es comerciante; el crédito lo requiere para el arreglo en el sistema de frenos de su vehiculo para no tener problemas en el futuro. Vive  en casa de sus propia ubicada en la zona de Los Andes de la ciudad de El Alto, es casado  tiene un  hijo. Es la primera vez que obtiene un crédito en IMPRO.
texts.en: Simon is a driver and has a vehicle for transporting passengers, and his wife is a storekeeper; the loan is needed for the repair of the braking system in his vehicle so that there are no problems in the future. He lives in their own home located in the Los Andes area in the city of El Alto. He is married and has a son. This is the first time he has had a loan with IMPRO.

loans.use: To repair the braking system in his vehicle for transporting passengers.

loans.name: Victoria

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Victoria, es casada y tiene 29 años de edad, ella tiene 1 hijo de 7 años; la socia tiene una tienda club de atención de productos herbalife; la socia es dueña de esta tienda que ellos le denominan club, la socia requiere el crédito para comprar productos de esta línea y abastecer su negocio y estos a su vez venderlos a terceros. Estos productos son conocidos como productos de salud naturales hechos a base de hierbas naturales y medicinales. La socia solicita e préstamo para invertir en la compra de productos para la venta.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
The member belongs to the “SAN RAFAEL” communal bank; This bank is located in the Huanchac District, in the Cusco province and department.

Victoria is married and is 29 years old, she has a 7 year old son; the member has a club store focusing on herbalife products; the member is the owner of this store that is called a club, the member requires the loan to buy this line of products and to supply her business and then sell to third parties. These products are known as natural health products made from a base of natural herbs and medicines. The member is asking for the loan to buy products to sell.

 The member values and is grateful for the loan granted and promises to fulfill the payment of her debts in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: To purchase products to sell.

loans.name: Luz Marina

texts.es:
La señora Luz Marina B. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 36 años. Ella tiene una pulpería desde 1990 la cual comenzó con 400 córdobas vendiendo pan y chiverías es su casa. En sus inicio tenía todo revuelto la venta con su casa en la actualidad ha logrado independizar su pulpería construyendo un lugar propio para ella y su última inversión fue en la compra de una mantenedora.
B. invertirá el crédito en mercadería como granos básicos, gaseosa, chiverías…etc. y meta principal es tener una miscelánea  lo cual poco a poco va lograr.
Ella ha participado en las capacitaciones de Adim en los Programa de Desarrollo Empresarial, Programa de Desarrollo de la Autonomía Personal, Programa de Intercambio Empresarial y Programa de Articulación de Actores Económicos. El que más le ha gustado es el de la autoestima de la mujer lo cual puesto en práctica.
texts.en:
Mrs. Luz Marina B. is a hardworking woman, a strong and enterprising 36 year old. She has had a small grocery store which she started with 400 cordobas selling bread and dairy products from her home. At the beginning everything was combined, her store and her house, but now she has been able to separate them by constructing a separate place for the store. Her last investment was the purchase of a refrigerator. 

Mrs. B. will invest this loan in merchandise such as basic grains, sodas, dairy products, etc. Her main goal is to have a general store, which she will achieve little by little. 

She has participated in Adim trainings on Business Development, Personal Autonomy, Business Exchange and Articulation of Economic Actors. She most enjoyed the one about women's self-esteem, which she has put into practice.

loans.use: to buy merchandise like basic grains, sodas, dairy products, etc, with the goal of slowing achieving a general store.

loans.name: Gaby Alejandra

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Gaby, es soltera y tiene 22 años de edad, La socia es economista y está trabajando en una consultora, ella por el momento sigue viviendo en casa de sus padres y formando parte de este banco comunal, la socia nos comenta que requiere el préstamo para poder apoyar a su madre y comprar materiales de construcción y otros para poder implementar su ferretería, la socia solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de materiales de construcción y otros para aumentar en la ferretería de sus padres.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SAN RAFAEL" communal bank which is in the district of Huanchac in the province and department of Cusco.

Miss Gaby is single and 22 years old.  She is an economist and works as a consultant.  She still lives at home with her parents and is part of the communal bank.  The loan she has requested is to help her mother and buy construction materials to expand her parent's hardware store.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy construction materials to expand parents' hardware store

loans.name: Dionisio Eduardo

texts.es: Dionisio Eduardo su actividad económica es la pesca artesanal. Hace más de 22 años que se dedica a este negocio. Lo inicio con mucho esfuerzo pues necesitaba brindarle a su familia los ingresos necesarios. La ubicación de su negocio es en su vivienda, ya que diariamente trabaja fuertemente ya que todos los días tiene que salir a vender los diferentes productos que ofrece. El motivo del financiamiento es para la compra de redes, entre otros equipos de trabajo necesario para su negocio.
texts.en:
Dionisio Eduardo has worked as an artisan fisherman for over 22 years.  He began his business with much effort because in order to provide a much needed income for his family.

He works out of his home and must go out and sell his products every day.  He needs the loan to buy nets and other work supplies for his business.

loans.use: To buy nets and other work supplies

loans.name: Wangninan De Dessah 1 Group

texts.fr:
Le groupement WANGNINAN DE DESSAH 1 est composé de 22 membres qui vivent tous dans le même quartier et qui mènent ensemble certaines activités (la transformation de noix de palme et la vente d'huile de palme). La présidente de ce groupement, du nom de Gonoussi, est celle ayant une main levée sur la photo. Dans le but de rehausser le niveau de leur activité afin de mieux faire face à la demande de leur clientèle, ce groupement sollicite pour une première fois l'appui financier de ALIDé.
Gonoussi est née en Janvier 1961 à Dokè au Bénin. Gonoussi est une veuve ayant quatre enfants, tous scolarisés, dont trois à sa charge. Il y a environs vingt cinq ans que Gonoussi s'est installée à Tchaada / Dessah dans l'Ouémé, où elle vit avec ses enfants.Pour subvenir à ses besoins et à ceux de sa famille, Gonoussi mène comme activité depuis douze ans environs, la vente de condiments de sauce et d'huile de palme qu'elle transforme ensemble avec ses autres membres. C'est au Nigéria et aussi à Cotonou que Gonoussi s'approvisionne. Dans le but de renforcer son activité et de mieux satisfaire sa clientèle, Gonoussi sollicite un crédit auprès de ALIDé. Son ambition est d'avoir dans l'avenir son propre palmeraie et d'accroître son revenu.
texts.en:
The group WANGNINAN DE DESSAH 1 is composed of 22 members who all live in the same area and who do similar work together (processing coconuts and selling the coconut oil). The president of the group, named Gonoussi, is the one in the photo in front with her hand raised.  With the goal of increasing the level of their work  to be able to meet customer demand better, this group is requesting a loan for the first time through the financial institution ALIDé.
Gonoussi was born in January 1961 in Doké, in Bénin. Gonoussi is a widow with four children, all of whom attend school, and three of whom are in her care.  Gonoussi settled in Tchaada/Dessah, in Ouémé about 25 years ago.  She lives with her children.  In order to meet her needs and those of the family, Gonoussi has been selling sauces and palm oil, which she processes with other members of the group, for about 12 years. Gonoussi gets her supplies in Nigeria and also in Cotonou.  With the goal of strengthening her business and better satisfying her customers, Gonoussi is requesting a loan through ALIDé. Her ambition is to have her own palm operation in the future and to increase her revenue.

loans.use: To buy coconuts and sauce condiments (fresh tomatoes, onions, peppers, etc.)

loans.name: Zela Ivone

texts.es:
La señora Zela Ivone Z. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 59 años quien inicio hace 13 años a vender comida la cual inicio con unos cuantos platos actualmente vende mayor cantidad. Ella con el crédito comprara productos para la playa para aprovechar la temporada de verano  especialmente en liquidos como gaseoas, cervesas, agua etc... lo caul vendera en San Juan del Sur.

La meta de ella es mejorar su casa la cual espera sea pronta.
texts.en:
Mrs. Zela Ivone Z. is a 59-year-old entrepreneur who is a hard worker and very committed.  She set up a food stall 13 years ago and began selling only a few meals, but since then business has grown. 

She plans to use the loan to buy products for the summer season such as sodas, beer, water, etc., which she will sell in San Juan del Sur.

Her goal is to make home improvements as soon as she can.

loans.use: To buy summer products such as sodas, water, beer, etc.

loans.name: Nohemi

texts.es:
La socia pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

La Sra. Nohemi, es soltera y tiene 18 años de edad, La socia trabaja junto a su amiga en la tienda de venta de productos de herbalife, ella atiende por las mañanas y por las tardes ella realiza llamadas a celulares para lo cual cuenta con teléfonos celulares y presta el servicio de llamadas a 0.50 céntimos el minuto. La socia solicita el préstamo para poder invertir junto a su amiga en los productos de herbalife y así poder hacerse socios.

 La socia valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SAN RAFAEL" communal bank which is in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Miss Nohemi is single, 18 years old and works with a girlfriend at a store that sells Herbalife products.  She works at the store in the mornings and in the afternoons has a cell phone calling business, charging 0.50 cents a minute to make calls.  She plans to use the loan to buy Herbalife products and set up business with her friend.

She is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy Herbalife products and set up business with a friend

loans.name: Fredy Humberto

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Fredy, es conviviente y tiene 38 años de edad, el tiene 2 hijos de 6 y 4 años; el socio se dedica  ala venta de productos de consumo masivo, el socio vende y distribuye detergentes, jabones, desmanches,, desinfectantes, entre otros productos. El socio suele solicitar el préstamo para invertir en su hogar en algunos arreglo y mejoras de su casa o comprar muebles o también en la compra de productos al por mayor para vender de forma independiente. El socio solicita el préstamo para poder comprar de los mayoristas productos de limpiezas y repartirlos en forma independiente.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the "SAN RAFAEL" communal bank which is located in the district of Huanchac, in the province and department of Cusco.

Mr. Fredy is 38 years old, has a live-in partner and two children, ages 6 and 4.  He is in the business of selling and distributing consumer products such as detergent, soap, stain-remover, disinfectant and other products.  Fredy usually requests a loan for home improvement and to buy furniture, and wholesale products to sell independently.  This loan will be used to buy wholesale cleaning products for independent distribution.

He is grateful for the loan and committed to paying it back on time.

loans.use: To buy wholesale cleaning products and work independently

loans.name: Alphonse

texts.fr: Né en 1969 à Daagbé au Bénin, Alphonse habite le quartier Ifangni dans le département de l'Ouémé, depuis trois ans environs. Alphonse est marié à une revendeuse du nom de Sabine et a cinq enfants à sa charge, dont quatre sont ses propres enfants. Certains des enfants sont scolarisés. Le couple assure ensemble les diverses charges de la maison. Alphonse a arrêté l'école au cours secondaire et a appris ensuite le métier de rebobinage, une activité qu'il mène passionnément depuis quinze ans environs et qui lui permet d'assurer les besoins de sa famille. A côté de cette activité, Alphonse vend des fils de rebobinage et accessoires à Igolo à Porto-Novo. Alphonse achète ses produits au Nigéria, Etat voisin du Bénin. En vue d'élever le niveau de son activité et de mieux satisfaire la demande de sa clientèle, Alphonse sollicite pour la deuxième fois, l'appui financier de ALIDé. Le crédit précédemment obtenu a été bien remboursé. Dans l'avenir, Alphonse désire étendre beaucoup plus son activité.
texts.en:
Born in 1969 in Daagbé in Bénin, Alphonse has lived in the lfangni district in the department of Ouémé for about three years.  
Alphonse is married to a saleswoman named Sabine and has five children in his care, four of whom are his own children.  Some of the children go to school. Together, the couple takes care of the household expenses.  Alphonse quit school at the secondary level and then learned how to repair motors, work for which he has had a passion for about 15 years, and which allows him to meet the needs of his family.  Along with this work, he sells wires and accessories in Igolo in Porto-Novo.  Alphonse buys his products in Nigeria, which neighbors Bénin.  With the goal of raising the level of his business and better meeting customer demand, Alphonse is requesting a loan, for the second time, through the financial institution ALIDé.  His first loan was fully repaid.  In the future, Alphonse wants to greatly expand his business.

loans.use: to buy wires and accessories for motors

loans.name: Johana Del Carmen

texts.es:
Johana del Carmen P. de 31 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien vende calzado. Ella inicio este negocio  hace siete años con unos ahorros y ha continuado por medio de los préstamos lo cual le ayudo a mejorar su negocio.
Ella invertirá el crédito en calzado como sandalias, zapatos, chinelas…etc.

P. junto con su compañero de vida cría a sus cuatro hijos de 13, 12. 6 y 3 años por los cuales trabajan arduamente.
texts.en:
Johana del Carmen P., 31, is a hardworking woman, dedicated and enterprising, who sells shoes. She began this business seven years ago with some savings and has carried on by means of borrowed money which helped her improve her business. 

She will invest the loan in footwear such as sandles, shoes and flip-flops. 

P., along with her life companion, is raising four children of 13, 12, 6 and 3 years of age, for whom they work arduously.

loans.use: to purchase footwear for her business.

loans.name: Concepcion

texts.es: Concepción se dedica a la venta y elaboración de tortillas y frijoles cocidos. Tiene más de 32 años, inicio este negocio por la necesidad de no tener un trabajo que le generara ingresos necesarios. Concepción se siente muy feliz de tener este medio de vida, es muy conocida en su cuadra por brindar estos productos. Este financiamiento es para la compra de maíz, frijoles y leña. Ella sueña con mejorar su nivel de vida, ella es una persona emprendedora sabe que tiene que levantarse todos los días temprano para realizar su actividad.
texts.en:
Concepción earns a living making and selling tortillas and cooked beans. She is over 32 years of age and started this business out of necessity as she had no job to generate the necessary income. Concepción is very happy to have this way of earning a living and is well known on her block for offering these products. 

This loan is for the purchase of corn, beans and firewood. She dreams of improving her standard of living. She is an enterprising person who knows she must get up early every day to carry out her business.

loans.use: to purchase corn, beans and firewood.

loans.name: Atsoupi

texts.fr: Atsoupi est une jeune femme active, dynamique  de 37ans qui vend du charbon, du sodabi (boisson locale faite à base de vin de palme très appréciée au Togo) et des produits de premières nécessités.  Son mari est conducteur de camion et ils ont 04 enfants en charge. Il ya 12ans qu’elle exerce cette activité. Elle s’approvisionne à Zafi, Ahepe et Lomé et revend à Anfamé (un quartier de Lomé).  Elle veut voir son activité prospérer, s’occuper mieux de ses enfants  avoir sa propre maison et être plus tard un grossiste dans la vente de ses produits c’est pour cela elle sollicite ce premier  prêt pour acheter  du charbon de bois, du sodabi et des produits de premières nécessités.
texts.en:
Atsoupi, age 37, is an energetic woman who sells charcoal, sodabi (a local beverage made with palm wine, very much appreciated in Togo) and staples. Her husband is a truck driver, and they have four children to support. She's been running this business for 12 years. She gets her supplies in Zafi, Ahepe, and Lomé, and resells in Anfamé (a neighborhood in Lomé).

She wants to see her business bolster, take better care of her children, and have her own house. Later, she wants to become a wholesaler. This is why she's seeking this first loan, in order to buy charcoal, sodabi and staples.

loans.use: to buy charcoal, sodabi (a local beverage) and staples

loans.name: Richard

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Richard, es soltero y tiene 23 años de edad, el socio se dedica a trabajar y a estudiar él estudia administración de empresas en la universidad, el socio también trabaja en un hotel en el área de recepción, el socio sueña con tener un negocio propio y para lo cual a estado ahorrando y requiere una parte de dinero para cubrir unos gastos más, el socio está pensando invertir en un negocio pequeño para empezar y sería en la venta de computadoras o de repente en la venta de repuestos eléctricos, aún no ha decidido pero tiene ya todos los costos y ha hecho su análisis para poder decidirse entre los dos negocios. El socio solicita el préstamo para aumentar para invertir en un nuevo negocio.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
Sr. Richard is a member of the San Rafael Community Bank which is located in the Huanchac District, in the province and department of Cusco.

He is single, 23 years old, and has a job as well as attending university where he is taking a business administration course. He works in a hotel at the reception desk. Richard’s dream is to have his own business for which he has been saving and now needs money for further expenses. He is thinking of starting a small business selling computers or perhaps spares for electrical appliances. He hasn’t yet decided, but he has all the costs and has done an analysis so he can make an informed decision about which business to choose. Richard is seeking a loan to put towards the cost of this new business.

He is grateful for the valuable assistance of a loan and promises to pay it back in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to start a small business

loans.name: Leyla Del Socorro

texts.es:
La señora Leyla del Socorro G. mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años de edad. Ella se dedica a la elaboración y venta de pantalones de vestir, tanto para uniformes de colegio como para uniformes de trabajos entre otros.

Leyla con el crédito comprara materia prima principalmente telas para cumplir con los encargos que tiene. El sueño de ella es que su taller sea más grande y tener su propia tienda.
texts.en:
43-year old Señora Leyla del Socorro G. is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman. Her job is making and selling dress pants as well as school uniforms, work uniforms etc.

With the loan Leyla plans to buy supplies, mainly fabric, to fulfill the orders that she already has. Her dream is to expand her workshop and have her own store.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, buttons etc.

loans.name: Mylène Estelle

texts.fr:
.Mylène est âgée de 39 ans, célibataire avec 2enfants de 2 à 8ans d’âge dont 1 va l’école.
En 1980 elle commence son activité de vente des divers et  les légumes de saison  avec un capital de 50.000 Frs..
.Avec ce prêt du  cycle 3, elle va acheter 6 filets d’oignon, 2 cartons de tomate concentrée, 1 carton d’aile, 1 caisse de tomate en fruit, 2 filets de pomme de terre, 1 sacs de sels, deux sacs de riz, 1bidon d’huile, 5paquets de cubes.
.Son souhait est de régénérer assez de bénéfice afin d’être grossiste  ainsi que améliorer les conditions de vie de ses enfants et est aussi beaucoup féliciter pour son activité.
Elle beaucoup encouragé par son entourage.
texts.en:
Mylène, age 39, is single and has two children, age 2 and 8, out of whom one attends school. In 1980, she started her business selling various items and seasonable vegetables with a capital of XOF 50'000. With this third loan, she will buy six bags of onions, two boxes of tomato concentrate, one box of garlic, one box of fresh tomatoes, two sacks of potatoes, and bag of salt, two sacks of rice, one can of oil, and five packs of bouillon cubes.

She wishes to generate enough profits to become a wholesaler and improve the living standard of her family. She is very much congratulated for her business, and receives much encouragement from her entourage.

loans.use: to buy onions, tomatoes, garlic, potatoes, rice, etc

loans.name: Thelma Leonor

texts.es:
Thelma Leonor Aguilera es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora desde hace cinco años inicio vendiendo cosméticos Avon, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catalogo actualmente comercializa ropa usada en la que invertirá su crédito. Ella tiene seis hijos de 24, 22, 21, 18, 15 y 14 años la menor.
Ella ha trabajado arduamente para que sus hijos tenga una mejor calidad de vida, estudien y se preparen.
texts.en: Thelma Leonor Aguilera is a hardworking, entrepreneurial woman who began selling Avon cosmetics five years ago. Avon is well-known for its catalog sales. Thelma currently also sells used clothing and it is for this that she wishes to use the loan. She has six children aged 24, 22, 21, 18, 15, and the youngest is 14. Thelma has always worked hard so that her children can have a better quality of life, attend school, and make their way in the world.

loans.use: to buy bundles of used clothing

loans.name: María De Jesús

texts.es:
La señora María de Jesús M. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien es propietaria de una pulpería desde hace 6 años comenzó con unos ahorros vendiendo chiverías y poco a poco gracia a su ardua labor y los prestamos su negocio ha ido creciendo. 
Ella es madre y padre de dos niños de 13 y 10 años los cuales son su razón de ser y su meta es tener una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Mrs. María de Jesús M. is a hard working, dedicated and enterprising woman who is the owner of a grocery store she has had for 6 years. She started with some savings selling chips and little by little, thanks to her hard work and the loans, her business has grown. 
 
She is both mother and father to the children, aged 13 and 10, who are her reason for being. Her goal is to have a variety store.

loans.use: She will invest im basic grains, meat, chips, soft drinks, cheese, etc.

loans.name: Feliciano

texts.es:
El socio pertenece al banco comunal “SAN RAFAEL”; Este banco está ubicado en el Distrito de Huanchac,  provincia de Cusco y  departamento de Cusco.

El Sr. Feliciano, es soltero y tiene 30 años de edad, el socio trabaja en el I.N.C. Ministerio de Cultura,  el socio esta en el área de investigación, el paralelamente a su trabaja tiene un negocio de celulares, el socio apertura su negocio para poder tener un ingreso extra, el socio en esta oportunidad está solicitando el préstamo para poder apoyar a  su padre y comprar unos medicamentos para su salud, el socio está muy preocupado por la salud de ambos y solo quiere que se mejoren y poder comprarles la medicación correcta, este préstamo él irá pagando con su sueldo. El socio solicita el préstamo para invertir en la compra de medicamento para su padre.

El socio valora y agradece el préstamo otorgado y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus deudas de forma disciplinada.
texts.en:
This member belongs to the “SAN RAFAEL” community bank. The bank is located in the district of Huanchac, province and department of Cuzco. 

Feliciano is single and 30 years old. He works in the I.N.C. Ministry of Culture. He works in the area of research. At the same time, he has his celular phone business. He opened his business to be able to have extra income. At this time, he is asking for the loan to be able to support his father and buy some medications for his health. He is very worried about the health of both of them and only wants them to get better and be able to buy them the correct medication. He will pay off this loan with his salary. He is asking for the loan to buy medication for his father.

Feliciano values and is grateful for the loan and he is committed to paying off his loans in a disciplined manner.

loans.use: to invest in buying medication for his father.

loans.name: Misioneras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Misioneras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. La coordinadora del grupo es  la señora Luz Marina Martínez Calero de 35 años quien desde hace 4 años instalo una pequeña venta en su casa y empezó a comercializar CD, DVD y videos. 
Ella junto a su esposo laboran arduamente para poder brindarles educación, salud, alimento y todo lo posible a sus tres hijos de 15, 14 y 12 años respectivamente. Ella invertirá el crédito en surtir ambos negocios con mayor cantidad y variedad de productos. Además desea invertir en otro negocio que es la venta de ropa.
Sus compañeras de grupo son Alejandra Castilla la cual vende frescos y gaseosas, y Liseth Antonia R. quien desde hace cuatro años empezó a distribuir productos de la Zermat, marca reconocida por sus ventas vía catálogo.
texts.en:
The Misioneras (Missionaries) group is comprised of three hard-working, dedicated, and entrepreneurial women.  Luz Marina Martínez Calero, age 35, is the coordinator of the group.  Four years ago she set up a small sales business in her house.  She started out selling CD’s, DVD’s, and videos.

She and her husband work arduously together to be able to provide their three children with an education, good health, and food.  They work to provide the children; ages 15, 14, and 12; with everything possible.

She will use the loan to stock both businesses with more products and a greater variety of products.  She also wishes to invest in another business of selling clothes.

Alejandra Castilla, a colleague in the group, sells juices and soft-drinks.  Liseth Antonia R., the other group member, has been selling Zermat products for four years.  Zermat is a well-known brand, and she sells by catalog.

loans.use: to buy merchandise, especially CD's and DVD's

loans.name: Mercidia

texts.es: La señora Mercidia tiene 59 años su estado tiene 6 hijos, los cuales ya son mayores de edad. Su negocio que es la venta de mercadería en general, el cual lo inicio como una forma de vida para sufragar, después con mucho esfuerzo y sacrificio pudo establecerse ella sola y salía a vender en diferentes lugares para ofrecer. Actualmente ya tiene 26 años de trabajar sola, pues la mayoría de sus clientes siempre les ofrece una gran variedad de productos. Ella solicita este préstamo con el único objetivo de invertirlo en el negocio y comprar perfumes, cosméticos, colonias, cremas, polvos, ropa en general entre otros productos. Su sueño es que Dios le brinde salud para seguir trabajando y de esta manera ganarse el pan de cada día, además de esto desea realizar unas mejoras en su vivienda.
texts.en:
Señora Mercidia is 59 years of age and has six grown children. Her business is the sale of general merchandise which she began as a means of covering her expenses. Eventually with much effort and sacrifice she was able to establish herself on her own and would go out to offer her products in various places. Currently she has been working on her own for 26 years as she generally offers her customers a wide variety of merchandise. 

She is seeking this loan with the sole objective of investing it in her business and buying perfumes, cosmetics, colognes, creams, powders, clothing in general and other products. Her dream is that God will grant her good health in order to keep on working and by these means earn her daily bread. In addition she would like to make some improvements to her living quarters.

loans.use: to purchase perfumes, cosmetics, colognes, creams, powders, clothing in general and other products.

loans.name: Aida

texts.es:
Aida Luz Aragón de 72 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras desde hace 8 años. Ella invertirá el crédito en yuca, papas, repollo, tomate, quequisque, ayote, chayote, pipianes, naranjas…etc. 
Ella tiene tres hijos, ya mayores y desea seguir trabajando y superándose.
texts.en: Aida Luz Aragón, 72 years old, is a hard-working and enterprising woman who for eight years has made a living selling fruits and vegetables. She will use the loan to buy cassava, cabbage, tomatoes, taro, multiple types of squash, oranges, etc. She has three children, already grown up, and she wishes to continue working and betting herself.

loans.use: to buy cassava, cabbage, tomatoes, taro, multiple types of squash, oranges, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous Group
loans.use: to pay college fees for his children

loans.name: Constance

texts.fr:
Agée de 46ans, Constance est mère de 5enfants qui sont âgée entre 8 et 17ans.
La vente dans la friperie est une question familiale chez elle car sa défunte grand-mère et mère ont exercées ce commerce .Elle a commence en 2005 avec un capital de 80.000.
 Elle est toujours vendeuse des friperies et a bénéficier des deux premier prêt de Hope Congo qu’elle a  remboursée sans défauts de payement. Ses ventes journalières sont de 100.000F à 150.000F.
Avec ce troisième prêt, elle va acheter 1ballot de serviette fin de série, 1ballot de draps non utilisés, 1ballot de sac à main, 1ballot de grands rideaux.
Son souhait, croitre son commerce, vendre les articles de qualités satisfaisants, faire plus de bénéfice et réalisée ses projets de devenir grossiste ou fournisseur de ballots de friperie un jour.
L’éducation de ses enfants lui préoccupé et veut les soutenir jusqu’au niveau d’études supérieurs.
texts.en:
Constance is 46 years old and the mother of five children ranging from 8 to 17 years old. She sells second-hand clothing, just as her late grandmother and her mother also used to do. She started her activity in 2005 with a capital of 80,000F.

She previously obtained two loans from Hope Congo, which she repaid without difficulty. Her daily sales range from 100,000F to 150,000F.

With this third loan, she will buy one bale of discontinued towels, one bale of unused sheets, one bale of handbags, and one bale of large curtains. 

She wishes to expand her business, sell good quality merchandise, increase her profits, and achieve her goal of becoming a wholesaler or a supplier of bales of used clothing. 

She cares about her children’s education and plans to support them in pursuing advanced studies.
