loans.use: to buy bales of curtains, handbags, sheets, towels

loans.name: Yader Fernando

texts.es: Yader se dedica a brindar el servicio de taxi, el es una persona muy abnegada y disfruta de su actividad económica. Esta no es la primera vez que realiza financiamientos, por lo que ha sido una gran experiencia. Hace más de 20 años que tiene este medio de vida,  pues siempre ha sido una persona muy emprendedora y disfruta de obtener este medio de vida, ya que el siempre está pendiente de brindar un buen servicio. Este crédito es para la compra de llantas, repuesto,  entre otros productos que son necesarios.
texts.en: Yader makes a living providing taxi services. He is a very selfless man and he enjoys his work. This is not the first time that he has received financing. He has been making a living this way for over 20 years, so he has always been a very enterprising person and he enjoys this lifestyle, and he is always providing good service. This loan is for the purchase of tires and replacement parts, among other necessary products.

loans.use: to buy tires, replacement parts, and other needed products

loans.name: Jacqueline

texts.fr:
Mère Jacky est âgée de 53 ans, célibataire avec 2 enfants de 17 et 27ans dont 1 va à l’école et l’autre exerce le même commerce : la vente du poisson salés en détail.
E n 2006, elle commence  la vente des poissons salés au marché plateau avec un capital de55.000F.
Diversifier les poissons à vendre est son secret, elle a des ventes qui varient selon les jours, 20.000f et 50.000F.
Avec l’actuel prêt, du cycle 3,  elle va acheter : 4carton de poissons morue, 2cartons de poissons soles, 2 cartons de poissons thons.
Bien présenter les tas, accueillir le client avec gentillesse est sa stratégie de vendre plus et continuer d’accroitre ses revenus. 
‘‘Que Dieu me bénisse  et que mes enfants comprenne ce je fais afin de me seconder un jour’’.
texts.en:
Mother Jacky is 53 years old and single with two children ages 17 and 27, one of whom attends school while the other works in the same trade as his mother, the retail sale of salted fish.

Jacky began selling salted fish in 2006 at the Plateau market with a capital of 55,000F. Her secret is the diversification of merchandise. Her daily sales range from 20,000 to 50,000F. 

With this third cycle loan, she plans to buy four cartons of cod, two cartons of sole, and two cartons of tuna fish.

Her business growth strategy to increase her revenue is to set up nice displays and greet her customers kindly. 

“May God bless me, and may my children understand what I do so that they may one day assist me.''

loans.use: to strengthen her stock with the purchase of cartons of cod, sole, and tuna fish

loans.name: Tayson Group

texts.es:
El grupo Tayson lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras. Una de ella es Cecilia Z. de 41 años es propietaria de una pulpería la cual inicio con $50 dólares hace 4 años que le regalo su padre.  Ella ha si do beneficiada con Adim tanto con el crédito como con las capacitaciones las cuales le han ayudado a administrar su negocio según comento. 
Z. tiene cuatro hijos pero solo el menor de 17 años depende de ella quien este año inicio la universidad. 
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Juana Vertida Muños de 64 años quien es modista y tiene un modesto taller de costura y Maribel L. Mendoza de 45 años vende frutas y tamales desde hace 25 años.
texts.en:
The Tayson group is made up of three hard working enterprising people.  Cecilia Zavalda, years old, runs a general store, which she started four years ago with an investment of $50, a gift from her father.  She says that she’s benefited from ADIM not only because of the loan, but also the training that has taught her how to manage her business.  Z. has four children, but she only still supports the youngest, age 17.  This year he began studying at the university.

The other members are 64 year old Juana Vertida Muños who is a fashion designer and has a tailor shop, and 45 year old Maribel L. Mendoza, who has been selling fruits and tamales for 25 years.

loans.use: to buy items to stock her store

loans.name: Gabriella M. Stella

texts.fr: Jeune dame  active de 28ans, Mme Gabriella est mère d’un(01) enfant  et est mariée à un entrepreneur.  Elle a ouvert  sa boutique en 2008 et vend des produits de premières  nécessités et divers.  Elle s’approvisionne  au Grand Marché  de Lomé et revend  dans sa boutique. Elle sollicite ce premier prêt  pour acheter de l’eau vitale, du lait, du sucre et autre produits  pour vendre afin d’avoir plus de bénéfices, s’épanouir  et  pour avoir  la certitude que ces enfants  grandiront dans de bonnes conditions.
texts.en:
Mrs. Gabriella, age 28, is an active woman. She's the mother of one child and married to an entrepreneur. In 2008, she opened her shop where she sells staples and various other items. She gets her supplies at the Grand Market in Lomé.

She's seeking her first loan in order to buy Eau Vitale (a brand of mineral water), milk, sugar, and other products to resell. She will thusly increase her profits, blossom, and make sure that her children will grow up in good conditions.

loans.use: to buy mineral water, milk, sugar and other products

loans.name: Alpha P. Bangura's Group

texts.en:
Pictured here are teachers from the RC Primary School, Boys Junior in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was opened in 1973 by the Roman Catholic Mission to educate the children of Lunsar and it environs. Presently, the school has 15 teachers and 636 pupils.
This is the first loan this school is accessing from Kiva through SMT. School staff from this institution, like many other school staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish certain tasks that they would otherwise not be able to accomplish with their salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children; others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.
Alpha P. B., aged 58, is a teacher at the school and leader of this group. Born in Freetown, Sierra Leone’s capital city, Alpha now lives and works in Lunsar. He has been in the teaching profession for 38 years now. He is a widower and has seven children – five adults and two attending secondary schools. Mr B. has requested this loan from Kiva lenders in order to buy house-building materials. Your loan will go a long way in helping Alpha build a dwelling house, as he is in dire need of a house for his family.

loans.use: to buy house-building materials

loans.name: La Esquinita Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario La Esquinita está integrado por tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son  Mirna Lorena L. Elías, Arianne Liceth G. Sánchez y Elisa Sánchez. La coordinadora es la señora L. tiene una pulpería hace 8 años y una bloquera desde hace 12 años e  invertirá el crédito en materiales para la bloquera como es el chasqui, arena y cemento. 
Ella tiene  tres hijos de 22, 17 y 15 años  quienes junto a unos trabajadores elaboran bloques en sus tiempos libres.

Mientras Arianne se dedica al comercio de ropa  por catálogo y productos ZERMAT, marca reconocida en especial por sus cosméticos y perfumes; y Elisa Sánchez de 30 años tiene una pulpería.
texts.en:
The La Esquinita community bank is made up of three hard-working, driven and enterprising women: Mima Lorena L. Elías, Arianne Liceth G. Sánchez and Elisa Sánchez.   The group's coordinator is Mrs L. who has owned a grocery store for eight years and a block-making business for twelve years.  She will invest her loan in materials for her block-making business such as aggregate, sand and cement.  Mrs L. has three children aged 22, 17 and 15 who, together with some workers, make blocks in their spare time.

Arianne sells clothes and ZERMAT products (a brand which is particularly well known for its cosmetics and perfumes), through catalogs.  Elisa Sánchez is 30 years old and owns a grocery store.

loans.use: to buy materials for making blocks such as aggregate, sand and cement

loans.name: Richard

texts.fr:
Richard est marié père de 3enfants dont l’âge varie entre 7 et 19ans, il âgé de  46ans.
Il débute en 1994 dans la vente des vivres frais, il a bien gérer les deux premiers prêt sans défauts de payement car ses ventes journalière sont comprises entre 75000F et 100000F.
Avec le prêt actuel, elle va se focalisé sur les denrées non périssables tels que : 4cartons d jus en boites, 5cartons de petits pois, 5cartons  de  champignons  en boîte, 2cartons de tomates pelées, 2 cartons de tomates concentrées, 2catons de sardines à huile, 2cartons des saucisses en boîtes, 10paks d’eau minérales.
Ses projets sont :
Vendre plus, faire d’énormes bénéfices pour ouvrir une boucherie parallèle.
Il vient de construire sa maison et il veut améliorer les conditions pour que sa famille y vive en paix.
texts.en:
Richard is 46 years old, married and the father of three children, age 7 to 19. In 1994, he started selling fresh food. His first two loans have been well managed and repaid without default, because his daily sales range from XOF 75'000 to 100'000 (ca US$ 160 to 215).

With this loan, he will focus on non perishable foodstuffs, such as : 4 boxes of canned orange juice, 5 boxes of peas, 5 boxes of canned mushroom, 2 boxes of peeled tomatoes, 2 boxes of tomato concentrate, 2 boxes of oil sardines, 2 boxes of canned sausage, and 10 packs of mineral water.

His projects are to sell more and make a large profit in order to open a butcher shop in parallel. He just built his house and wants to improve it, so that its family can live there in peace.

loans.use: to buy orange juice, peas, canned mushroom, peeled tomatoes, etc

loans.name: Cayetana

texts.es:
Cayetana tiene 49 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Eleuterio D. 55 años y su querido hijo Rodrigo D. 14 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad D. vida. El almacén más lleno del barrio “Hijos D. Grau” del distrito D. Ventanilla, lo tiene Cayetana, quien lleva a su humilD. barrio los productos más necesarios y útiles para sus clientes. Ella administra su tienda hace más D. 10 años, es muy feliz vendiendo sus productos y satisfaciendo la demanda D. sus clientes, lo más difícil D. su trabajo es permanecer todo el día en su negocio sin poder salir, ya que atienD. todo el día y siempre está cuando sus compradores la solicitan.
Para el futuro D. su negocio, desea ampliar su tienda y tener muchos más productos que vender, puesto que su barrio esta creciendo y la mercadería con la que cuenta ya no le alcanzaa. Es el quinto crédito con MFP, su primer crédito lo pago puntualmente y sin problemas, es la socia más activa y solidaria D. su banco comunal, por lo cual es muy querida. Con los dos mil nuevos soles que ha solicitado, comprará más mercadería para implementar mejor su almacén.
texts.en:
Cayetana is a 49 year old woman who is very kind and hardworking.  She lives in her own home with her husband Eleuterio who is 55 years old, and their son Rodrigo, who is 14 years old.  They want to proviD. him with a better quality of life.  

The best stocked grocery store in the "Hijos D. Grau" neighborhood in Ventanilla belongs to Cayetana, who brings the most necessary and useful products to her customers in her humble neighborhood.  She has owned this store for ten years.  She is very happy selling her products and satisfying her customers needs.  The most difficult part of her work is to stay at the store all day without being able to leave, since she works there all day and is always there when the customers ask for her.  

In the future, she wants to expand her store and sell more products, since her neighborhood is growing and the merchandise that she has already can't meet the demand.  This is her fifth loan with MFP.  She paid her first loan on time and without problems.  She is the most active and supportive member of her community bank, so she is very well liked.  

With the 2000 nuevos soles she has requested, she will purchase more merchandise to improve her store.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her grocery store.

loans.name: Mercedes

texts.es:
La señora Mercedes Amalia G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzadas y emprendedora originaria de Managua. Ella se dedica al comerció desde muy joven y su productos es variado es decir vende lo que está en temporada y de todo un poco desde ropa, calzado, accesorios, cosméticos etc.
Ella invertirá el crédito en productos de temporada como sandalias, lentes para el sol, trajes de baño, shorts…etc.
texts.en:
Mercedes Amalia G. is a hardworking and enterprising woman originally from Managua.  She has worked as a merchant from a young age.  Her products are varied because she sells what is in season and a little bit of everything, like clothing, shoes, accessories, cosmetics, and more.

She will invest this loan in the purchase of seasonal products like sandals, sunglasses, bathing suits, shorts, and more.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal merchandise for her clothing business.

loans.name: Ana Marisol

texts.es:
La señora Ana Marisol A. R. de 38 años es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras. Este negocio lo inicio desde muy joven empezó con el negocio para ganarse el pan de cada día.
Ella tiene dos hijos de 15 y 18 años los cuales le ayudan a vender después de clase y su meta es seguir prosperando.
texts.en:
Ana Marisol A. R. is 38 years old.  She is a hard-working and enterprising woman who works selling fruits and vegetables.  She started this business when she was young to earn her daily bread.

She has two children who are 18 and 15 years old who help her after school.  Her goal is to continue prospering.

loans.use: to purchase seasonal fruits and vegetables.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr's Group

texts.en:
Salone Microfinance Trust (SMT), a partner of Kiva.org in Makeni, northern Sierra Leone, is pleased to present to you teachers of the Ahmadiyya Primary School in Lunsar, a town in northern Sierra Leone. This school was founded in 1960 by the Ahmadiyya Muslim Mission. The school is currently staffed with nine teachers and has an enrollment of 326 pupils. This is the first loan from Kiva lenders from which teachers of this institution have benefited. 

Abu B. B. is a teacher at the school and the leader of this group. The 49-year-old Abu was born in the township of Lunsar. He has been in the teaching profession for twenty-one years now. Abu is married and has two children who are in college. Abu is requesting a loan of 1,200,000 SLL in order to pay college fees and buy school learning materials for his children in college. 

School staff from this institution, like many other schools' staff within SMT’s operational areas, come to SMT to apply for loans. With the help of these loans, they can accomplish some certain tasks that they would otherwise not have been able to accomplish with their mere salaries alone. But with the help of this loan, some can pay school fees for their children, while others can use the loan to buy pieces of furniture, a plot of land, house-building materials, or to invest in business. At the end of each month, these teachers can repay the loan out of their monthly salaries. The institution’s bursar is directly responsible for deducting the repayment and pays SMT on their behalf.

loans.use: to pay college fees and buy school learning materials for his children in college

loans.name: Denise

texts.fr:
Mère de 7enfants, Denise, est mariée et âgée de 45ans, elle se lance dans le commerce du poisson salé au marché en 1993 avec un capital de 50.000f.
Ses ventes journalières sont de  50.000F quand les temps sont bonnes et 25.000F quand l’activité sont en baisse.
Le prêt 3 qu’elle aura, elle va renforcer son activité en achetant : 7cartons de morue, 5cartons de thon, elle faits aussi des yaourts en sachets pour cela, il a aussi acheté 1sac de lait en poudre, 1sac de sucre, aromes et 5lot de sachets d’emballage.
Faire accroitre son activité est  sa préoccupation majeure, son but est d’arriver à stocker 30 cartons pour vendre beaucoup et réaliser plus  de bénéfices pour aider sa fille ainée d’aller poursuivre ses études après son bac à l’étranger. Pour maintenir son commerce au top, elle se bat.
texts.en:
Denise is a 45-year-old married woman and mother of seven children. In 1993, she started selling salted fish at the market with a capital of 50,000F. On a good day, her sales can reach 50,000F but are closer to 25,000F on a slow day.

She will use this third loan to strengthen her business by buying seven cartons of cod and five cartons of tuna fish. She makes yogurt packets so she will also buy one bag of powdered milk, one bag of sugar, some extracts, and five packs of packaging bags.

Her primary ambition is to expand her activity. Her goal is to be able to stock 30 cartons to bolster her sales and increase her profits in order to help her oldest daughter pursue studies abroad after completing her bachelor’s degree. She strives to keep her business at the top.

loans.use: to strengthen her stock by buying cartons of cod and tuna fish, as well as powdered milk, sugar, extracts, and packaging bags

loans.name: El Milagro Oli Group

texts.es: LA SEÑORA CARMEN C. Q. ES MIEMBRO DEL GRUPO "EL MILAGRO OLI". ELLA VIVE EN EL ESTADO DE MEXICO, SE DEDICA A LA VENTA DE ROPA Y PIDIO ESTE PRESTAMO PARA INVERTIR EN MÁS ROPA DE VARIEDAD, DE UNA MEJOR CALIDAD Y DE GRAN VARIEDAD PARA EL GUSTO DE TODAS SUS CLINTAS. SE SIENTE CONTENTA YA QUE GRACIAS A ESTA OPORTUNIDAD LOGRARA AMPLIAR SU NUMERO DE CLIENTES, YA QUE EN LA ZONA DONDE ELLA RADICA NO HAY MUCHA GENTE QUE SE DEDIQUE A ESTE NEGOCIO. ELLA DESEA QUE CON LAS GANANCIAS PUEDA MEJORAR LA CALIDAD DE VIDA DE SU FAMILIA Y ASI MISMO SEGUIRA TRABAJANDO COMO HASTA EL DIA DE HOY PARA SEGUIR HACIENDO CRECER SU NEGOCIO.
texts.en:
Carmen C. Q. is a member of the group El Milagro Oli.  She lives in the state of Mexico.  

She works selling clothing and is asking for this loan to purchase a larger variety of good quality clothing so that she has a variety of clothing to satisfying all of her customers.  She is happy that thanks to this opportunity she will be able to expand her number of customers since there are not many people selling clothing in her area.  

She hopes that she can improve her family's quality of life with her income and continue working like she is today to make her business grow.

loans.use: to purchase clothing for her business.

loans.name: Andrea

texts.es: Andrea, de 46 años, es una mujer muy amable y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Wilder de 38 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. Al restaurante de Andrea lo que menos le faltan son clientes, puesto que esta ubicado en una zona céntrica de su barrio. Sus principales comensales son sus vecinos, quienes luego de una larga mañana de trabajo, no dudan en degustar los deliciosos platos que ella prepara. Los precios que ofrece a sus clientes son muy accesibles y este es el principal gancho de su restaurante, lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es cocinar y ver como las personas alaban su buena sazón, lleva 1 año realizando esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es atender a todos sus clientes y mantenerlos satisfechos, espera que en el futuro su restaurante se convierta en uno de los más conocidos del distrito de ventanilla, sabe que para alcanzar sus metas tiene que trabajar muy duro y esta dispuesta a hacerlo. Este es el cuarto crédito con MFP y al igual como hizo con sus primeros créditos, esta dispuesta a pagar todas sus cuotas a tiempo, en su banco comunal es una socia muy querida y respetada por la responsabilidad que demuestra. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará más sillas y mesas para mejorar la atención en su restaurante.
texts.en:
Andrea is 46 years old and is a kind and hardworking woman.  She lives in her own home with her husband Wilder, who is 38 years old, and their three children, who they want to give a better quality of life.  

At Andrea's restaurant there is no shortage of customers, since it is located in a central area in her neighborhood.  Its main diners are her neighbors, who enjoy the delicious dishes she prepares after a long morning of work.  The prices she charges are very accessible, and this is the main draw of her restaurant.  The thing she likes best about her work is cooking and seeing how people praise the good flavors.  She has had the restaurant for one year.  She considers taking care of all the customers and keeping them satisfied the most difficult part.  She hopes that in the future, her restaurant will be one of the most well-known in the Ventanilla district.  She knows that to achieve her goals, she has to work very hard and she is ready to do so.  

This is her fourth loan with MFP and just like with the others, she is ready to make all of her payments on time.  In her community bank, she is a well liked and respected member because of the responsibility she shows.  With the 2000 neuvos soles she is requesting, she will purchase more seats and tables to improve the attention at her restaurant.

loans.use: to purchase tables and chairs for her restaurant.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a fence and put guards on the windows and doors.

loans.name: Señor De Cautivo Group

texts.es:
Los socios pertenecen al banco comunal “SEÑOR DE CAUTIVO”; Este banco se ubicada en el distrito de Urubamba, perteneciente a la provincia de Urubamba y departamento de Cusco.

La socia es la Sra. Marina; ella es casada y tiene 42 años y 4 hijos; La socia trabaja en su negocio de venta de chicha (bebida a base de maíz), la socia también vende animales menores como cuyes, pollos y chanchos, la socia vende la chicha y cría a sus animales en su casa y luego los vende en el mercado de Urubamba, la socia quiere construir su casa. La socia solicita el préstamo para comprar materiales de construcción como yeso, cemento y arena y acabar de construir su casa.


Los otros socios  se dedican la venta de chicha, transporte, tienda de abarrotes, maestro de construcción  y taller mecanico. 


La socia agradece a quienes forman parte de este sueño mediante este medio y se compromete a cumplir con el pago de sus cuotas en el plazo establecido.
texts.en:
The members of the community bank SEÑOR DE CAUTIVO are located in the Urubamba district in the Urubamba province and Cusco department.

Marina is a member of the community bank.  She is 42 years old, married, and has four children.  She works selling chicha (a corn-based drink) as well as selling animals such as guinea pigs, chickens, and pigs.  She sells chicha and raises her animals in her home and then sells them in the market in Urubamba.  She would like to build her house.  She is asking for this loan to purchase construction materials such as plaster, cement, and sand to finish building her house.

The other group members work selling chicha, in transportation, at a grocery store, as a construction worker, and at a mechanic shop.

Marina thanks those who are part of this dream and promises to make her payments at the established times.

loans.use: to purchase materials like plaster, cement, and sand.

loans.name: Sadia

texts.es:
La señora Sadia Z. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada, emprendedora y de carácter fuerte de 33 años. Ella inicio en  Adim en el crédito grupal en el grupo las Pepas y este su segundo préstamo como individual. 
Z.  tiene una tortillería la cual inicio con el fin de mejorar la calidad de vida de sus hijos e invertirá el crédito en artículos de temporada como chinelas, toallas, pelotas, trajes de baño, shorts para vender y aprovechar este tiempo.
texts.en:
Sadia Z. is a hard-working, driven and enterprising woman with a strong character.  She is 33 years old.  She started working with ADIM's group loans as a member of the 'Las Pepas' group.  This is her second individual loan.

Mrs Z. has a totilla bakery which she established in order to improve her children's quality of life.  She will invest her loan in buying seasonal products such as thongs (flip flops), towels, balls, swimsuits and shorts to sell, taking advantage of the season.

loans.use: to buy seasonal items such as thongs (flip flops), towels, balls, swimsuits and shorts to sell

loans.name: Elizabeth Magdalena

texts.es: Elizabeth Magdalena se dedica a la venta de mercadería en general. Tiene la edad de 29 años. Hace más de 6 años que se dedica a esta actividad. Ella tiene que ofrecer sus productos a los departamentos ya que tiene ciertos clientes que le compran sus productos al por mayor,  lo que le resulta mucho más favorable. La ubicación de su negocio es de manera ambulante, es una mujer que logrado adquirir experiencia y que ha enfrentado muchas dificultades, pero a pesar de este problema ha luchado por salir adelante. Ella solicita este crédito para capital de materia prima como perfumes, cremas, colonias, ropa, calzado y ropa interior, ropa en general. Su deseo es comprar una camioneta para el uso de su negocio.
texts.en:
Elizabeth Magdalena's business is selling general merchandise.  She is 29 years old and has been in this business for more than six years.

Elizabeth has to sell her products in different departments.  She has some customers who buy her products wholesale which works out much better for her.  Elizabeth does not sell from a fixed sales location.  She is a woman who has gained experience and faced a lot of difficulties.  However, in spite of her difficulties, she has fought to get ahead in life.  She is requesting this loan so that she can buy merchandise such as perfume, creams, cologne, clothes, footwear and underwear.  Her wish is to buy a small truck to use in her business.

loans.use: to buy perfume, creams, cologne, clothes, footwear and underwear

loans.name: María Elena

texts.es:
La señora María Elena F. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 31 años en el 2,000 inicio su pulpería con 500 córdobas compró unas chiverías (meneítos, platanitos, dulces, tortillerías, yuquitas, ranchitas, papas…etc.) y poco a poco fue creciendo.   
Ella tiene dos hijos de 12 y 9 años por los cuales trabaja arduamente y desea tener una miscelánea.
texts.en:
Maria Elena is a hard-working, striving, and enterprising woman of 31 who launched her small store in 2000. With just 500 cordobas she bought some snacks (including seven or more types of typical treats, candies, etc.), and little by little, her business grew.

Maria Elena has 2 children, ages 12 and 9, for whom she works arduously, and she hopes to have a general store.

loans.use: TO BUY BASIC GRAINS, MEAT, SNACKS, SOFT DRINKS, ETC., TO SELL

loans.name: Claudia

texts.es: Claudia, de 48 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y alegre, vive en su casa propia junto a su esposo Mauro de 52 años y sus 3 queridos hijos, a quienes desea brindar un mejor futuro. Son 6 años los que Claudia lleva vistiendo a la gente que concurre al mercado central de la ciudad de Lima, vendiendo de forma ambulatoria ha logrado ganar una gran cantidad de clientes, ya que tiene una amplia variedad de prendas de vestir, tanto para damas como para caballeros. A ella le gustaría poner una tienda más grande, donde pueda atender mejor a sus clientes y mostrarles más ropa, puesto que disfruta de vender y conversar con sus clientes, eso si lo que le resulta difícil es transportar la ropa hasta su lugar de trabajo, ya que es demasiado cansado para ella sola. Es el cuarto crédito con MFP, y al igual como hizo con sus anteriores préstamos, desea pagarlo a tiempo y sin dificultades, en su banco comunal es muy respetada, ya que es la socia más activa y comprometida. Con los tres mil nuevos soles, planea comprar más mercadería y así incrementar la cantidad de ropa que vende.
texts.en:
Claudia, 48 years old, is a very simple and happy woman who lives in her own house with her husband Mauro, who is 52, and her 3 dear children, to whom she wishes to offer a better future. For 6 years Claudia has been clothing the people who gather at the central market of the city of Lima. Selling on the streets there, she has managed to accumulate a large number of customers. Claudia provides a wide variety of clothing items, for both women and men. 

Claudia would like to establish a large shop where she could better attend to her customers. A main reason is that it's very difficult for her to transport clothing to the place where she works. It is too tiring for her to do alone.

This is Claudia's 4th loan through MFP, and once again, just as in the previous cases, she promises to repay on time and without difficulties. She is very respected in her communal bank because she is the most active and committed member. With this 3,000 new sols she plans to buy more merchandise and thus, expand the quantity of clothing she sells.

loans.use: TO BUY MORE CLOTHES TO STOCK HER BUSINESS

loans.name: Johana Syjey

texts.es:
La señora Johana Sujey S. es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 35 años quien desde joven se dedica al comercio, ya que su madre era comerciante. Ella trabaja con Adim desde hace 10 años con el cual le ayudado tanto con el crédito como con las capacitaciones.
El negocio de S. consiste en la venta de ropa, zapatos y alquiler de sillas y mesas desde hace 15 años. En la actualidad invertirá el crédito en productos de temporada como gaseosa, cerveza, agua para ir a vender a San Juan del Sur destino turístico que en esta época se llena de extranjeros y nicaragüenses que van a pasar semana santa.
Ella tiene dos hijos de 18 y 16 años los cuales ha sacado adelante y meta es tener su casa propia.
texts.en:
Johana Sujey S. is a hard working 35 year old entrepreneurial woman.  She’s been in business since she was a young woman because her mother was also in business.  She’s been working with ADIM for the past 10 years and it has helped her though the loan and through the training.

S. sells clothing and shoes and rents out tables and chairs.  She’s been doing this for 15 years.  S. will use the money from this loan to invest in seasonal merchandise like soft drinks, beer, and bottled water to sell in San Juan del Sur, a tourist destination that is frequented by foreign and Nicaraguan tourists during holy week.

She has a two children, ages 18 and 16, whom she has managed to get ahead.  Her goal is to have her own house.

loans.use: to buy drinks for resale

loans.name: María Del Rosario

texts.es:
La señora María del Rosario C. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 50 años quien inicio en Adim con crédito grupal y actualmente este es su segundo crédito individual. La señora se dedica a la venta de leche soya, pinolillo, frescos etc. desde hace tres años.
Con el crédito comprara maíz, cacao, frutas (tamarindo, naranjas, granadilla, chilla…etc.) y su meta principal es tener su casa.
texts.en: María del Rosario C. is a hardworking, and entrepreneurial 50 year old woman who started with Adim with a group loan.  This is her second individual loan.  She has been selling soy milk, pinolillo drink mix, and fruit drinks for three years.  With this loan she will purchase corn, cacao, fruit (tamarind, oranges, pomegranates, chilla, etc.).  Her goal is to buy a house.

loans.use: to purchase soy milk, fruit, cacao, etc.

loans.name: Liduvina

texts.es:
Lidubina es una señora trabajadora que a sus 66 años quien inicio en Adim con crédito grupal y actualmente va por su segundo crédito individual.  Ella ha trabajado de todo un poco como  vender fritanga (pollo asado, enchiladas, tacos, carne asada, ensaladas, gallo pinto), sopas los domingos (de pollo, de mondongo, de hueso, de queso) y bisutería actualmente. 
B. con el crédito comprara arroz, aceite, pollo, azúcar, además de materiales para la bisutería, actividad que inicio después de participar en un taller. Con ella trabajan dos de sus 7 hijos las cuales se encargan de la comida y ella solo da la sazón. 
El sueño de esta jovial señora sueña en viajar lejos y conocer México.
texts.en:
Lidubina is a hardworking woman who is 66 years old.  Her first loan with Adim was a group loan and this is her second individual loan.  She does a little bit of everything, such as sell fritanga (roasted chicken, enchiladas, tacos, carne asada, salads, beans and rice), sell soup on Sundays ( chicken, tripe, bone marrow, and cheese) and make jewelry. 

With this loan she will purchase rice, cooking oil, chicken, sugar, and supplies to make jewelry, an activity she started after attending a workshop.  Two of her 7 children work with her.  They are in charge of the cooking and she does the seasoning.  Her dream of this jovial woman is to travel far and visit Mexico.

loans.use: to purchase rice, cooking oil, chicken, sugar, and materials for jewelry making.

loans.name: Las Pagadoras Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Pagadoras lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras provenientes de la capital de Managua. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Johana Núñez M. de 27 años quien es estilista desde hace 4 años. Ella aprendió este oficio con su cuñada la cual tiene un salón y luego se independizo realizando trabajos a domicilio. 

Ella invertirá el crédito en su negocio con el fin de seguir creciendo con ese fin comprara cosméticos, exfoliantes, gel refrescante, pinturas, tintes etc.

Las otras integrantes son Adela Dolores quien vende cosméticos y perfumes actividad en la que invertirá el crédito y Jaqueline del Socorro Anduraly quien comercializa repostería.
texts.en: The Las Pagadoras group is made up of three hardworking and entrepreneurial women from the capital, Managua.  The group coordinator is Johana Núñez M., age 27, who has been a stylist for 4 years.  She learned this trade with her sister-in-law who has a salon, and then she started working independently at her customers' homes.   She will use this loan to continue growing her business.  She will purchase cosmetics, exfoliator, refreshing gel, makeup, etc. The other members of the group are Adela Dolores, who sells cosmetics and perfumes, fore which she will use this loan, and Jaqueline del Socorro Anduraly who sells pastries.

loans.use: to puchase cosmetics, exfoliator, refreshing gel, makeup, etc.

loans.name: José Luís

texts.es:
A la vivienda del señor José Luís H. le esta haciendo falta las protecciones en las puestas y ventanas de su casa.
Esta solicitando un préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para  pagarle a la persona que se encargara de realizar las protecciones y colocarlas.
Pagaría el crédito con el ingreso que tiene de su trabajo en una tienda comercial como jefe de carnes. 
Desea que el patrimonio y su familia estén seguras  ya que tiene miedo que les pueda pasar algo el se encuentre trabajando.
texts.en: José Luís H.'s house needs security bars for the doors and windows.  He is requesting a loan because he doesn't have enough money to pay the person who makes the security bars and installs them.  He will repay the loan with his income from working at a store as the head butcher. He wants his family and property to be safe, and he is concerned that something could happen to them when he is working.

loans.use: to put security bars on the doors and windows of his home.

loans.name: Liliana Maritza

texts.es: La señora Liliana tiene 44 años es casada y tiene 2 hijos D. 22 y 9 años D. edad, ella tiene una moto taxi que compro con los ahorros que ella tenia producto D. su trabajo como obrera D. campo, la moto taxi es manejada por su esposo solo por las tardes por en las mañanas trabaja en fundo como obrero D. campo, generándole otro ingreso su sueño en el futuro es poder comprar una unidad D. transporte(auto) para mejorar sus ingresos y poder darle tranquilidad a su familia, el dinero será invertido en hacerle unas mejoras a su moto taxi, darle  mantenimiento cambio D. llantas para su buena imagen y buen funcionamiento y los clientes quieran utilizar sus servicios, Liliana esta muy agradecida por la confianza que se le esta brindando
texts.en: Liliana is 44 yeas old, married, and has two children ages 22 and 9.  She has a motorcycle taxi that she bought with savings from her job as a farm laborer.  The moto taxi is driven by her husband only in the afternoons because in the mornings he works on a ranch as a laborer, earning additional income.  Her dream for the future is to be able to purchase a car to increase her earnings and bring peace of mind to her family.  The money from the loan will be used for maintenance on the moto taxi, changing the tires so the taxi looks good and functions well and customers will want to use her services.  Liliana is very thankful for the trust you are placing in her.

loans.use: to perform maintenance on her motorcycle taxi, changing the tires and painting it.

loans.name: Marisela

texts.es:
La señora Marisela vive en una casa prestada junto con su esposo y un hijo que tiene de pequeña edad.
Como desea tener su propia vivienda esta tramitando una casa por medio de Infonavit (Crédito Gubernamental), pero el valor de la vivienda es superior al crédito que ella pude recibir ya que su sueldo es bajo. 

Marisela trabaja como empleada de una papelería. Por tal motivo solicita un préstamo para completar el crédito gubernamental y así adquirí su casa. 
Desea tener un patrimonio seguro para su hijo.
texts.en:
Marisela lives in a borrowed house together with her husband and her young son.  As she would like to own her own home, she is applying for a house through Infonavit (who provide government-subsidized housing loans) but the cost of the house is higher than the amount of the loan she qualifies for because her wages are low.

Marisela works as an employee in a stationery store.  She is requesting a loan to make up the difference between the amount of the government loan and the amount of down payment required so that she can acquire her house.  She would like to have secure equity for her son.

loans.use: to put towards the down payment for acquiring a house through Infonavit

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Heriberto

texts.es:
El señor Heriberto y su esposa la señora Elvira tiene tres hijos que están estudiando pero tiene un problema en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la comprar de útiles escolares y pago de la colegiatura. 
Don Heriberto trabaja en una agencia aduanal como documentados y Doña Elvira realiza trabajos de costura en su casa para no descuidar a sus hijos. Esta son los ingresos que tiene para su familia y con los cuales una parte será para pagar el crédito.
Ya que desean que sus hijos sigan estudiando y que puedan terminar una carea profesional.
texts.en: Heriberto and his wife Elvira have three children in school but they have a problem right now in that they do not have the money they need to buy school supplies and pay school fees.  Heriberto works for a customs agency and Elvira does sewing work from home so that she can look after her children.  These are the sources of income they have for their family and they will use part of this money to repay their loan.  They would like their children to continue studying and for them to have a career.

loans.use: to pay for school expenses

loans.name: Jose Alfredo

texts.es: El sr. José, vive la zona de Molle Molle, vive en casa propia, su esposa tiene una tienda de barrio donde ofrece variedad de productos es una tienda muy surtida, tienen 4 hijos que están en el colegio, el sr. José es muy conocido en su trabajo el es transportista de una  línea de minibús de sacaba,  trabaja de lunes a sábado los domingos se dedica a su familia, es una familia muy trabajadora y muy unida, el préstamo lo destinara para el tapizado de asientos de su minibús , ya e están muy gastados y hará el cambio de todos los asientos, el deseo del Sr. José es el de ver a sus hijos profesionales,   esta muy agradecido con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
José lives in his own home in Molle Molle district.  His wife has a neighborhood store where she sells a variety of products.  It is a very well-stocked store.  They have four children who are all in school.  José is very well known in his work.  He is a driver on a Sacaba minibus line.  He works from Monday to Saturday and devotes Sundays to his family.  His is a very hard-working and united family.  

José will use his loan to upholster the seats in his minibus since they are very worn.  He will change all the seats.  José's wish is to see his children become professionals.  He is very grateful to the institution for the support they have given him.

loans.use: to upholster the seats in his minibus

loans.name: Maria

texts.es:
Maria Elena E. vive en Guaitil de Guanacaste, ella es conocida por las deliciosas tortillas que hace manualmente.
Ella empezó con un pequeño negocio donde vendía sus tortillas, sin embardo la demanda aumento muchísimo y tuvo que comprar  un molino Industrial. Ahora ella necesita un préstamo de ₡ 500 000 (quinientos mil colones) para la compra de repuestos para el molino Industrial
Ella quiere mejorar su negocio, y hacer que este crezca con esto mejorara la calidad  de su vida y la de su familia.
texts.en:
Maria Elena E. lives in Guaitil de Guanacaste.  She is well known for the delicious tortillas that she makes by hand.

Maria started out with a small business selling her tortillas.  However, demand increased a lot and she had to buy an industrial mill.  Now she needs a loan for 500,000 colones to buy spare parts for her industrial mill.

Maria would like to improve and grow her business.  This will improve her own quality of life and that of her family.

loans.use: to buy spare parts for her corn grinding machine

loans.name: Elena Angela

texts.es:
Elena es una fémina trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora la cual se cataloga como una botánica y esotérica originaria de la costa Caribe de Nicaragua. Inicio en Adim con crédito solidario y actualmente se graduó a crédito individual. 
Elena tiene un pequeño taller de costura  desde hace 20 años donde hace ropa, fundas, ropa de cama, etc. las cuales comercializa en sus dos tramos en waspan. Además tiene una venta den pollo y especies la cual inicio con el  crédito pasado. El crédito lo invertirá en pollo, mortadela, jamón, chorizo etc. y una parte en mejoras del hogar.
Ella tiene tres hijos ya mayores los cuales trabajan con ella y su meta principal es mejorar su casa y que sus hijos tengan cada uno la suya.
texts.en:
Elena is a hard-working, driven and entrepreneurial woman who classes herself as a botanist and esoteric person, originally from the Caribbean coast of Nicaragua.  She started working with ADIM's group loans and has now graduated to receiving individual loans.

Mrs Elena has a small sewing workshop which she has had for 20 years.  She makes clothes, cushion covers, bedclothes, etc. which she sells on her two sales stands in Waspan.  She also has a business selling chicken and spices which she set up with her last loan.  She will invest part of this loan in buying chicken, bologna, ham, chorizo etc. and will use the rest of the loan to make some home improvements.

Mrs Elena has three grown-up children who work with her and her main goal is to improve her own home and to ensure that her children each have one as well.

loans.use: to buy chicken, bologna, ham, chorizo, etc.

loans.name: Julia Mercedes

texts.es: Julia Mercedes tiene 33 años, es madre 3 hijos a su cargo. Ella se dedica a brindar los servicios de costura, que está ubicado en su vivienda, Julia es una mujer muy luchadora que le gusta trabajar ya que todas dificultades que ha tenido que atravesar le han enseñado a mejorar la administración de su negocio. Ella ofrece una gran variedad en la elaboración de sus prendas como son vestidos, trajes, pantalones, faldas, uniformes, trajes para niños, bordados entre otros. El financiamiento que solicita es para capital de trabajo que será destinado para telas, hilos, tijeras, agujas y para comprar una maquina nueva. Su deseo es proporcionarle mejoras a su vivienda.
texts.en: Julia Mercedes, age 33, is a mother with three children to care for. She dedicates her time to offering a dressmaking service, which she does from home. Julia is a very determined woman who enjoys working. Every difficulty she has hard to overcome has taught her to improve how her business runs. She offers great variety in the garments she can make, which include dresses, suits, trousers, skirts, uniforms, children's outfits and embroidery, among other things. The loan she is seeking will provide working capital, destined to buy cloth, thread, scissors and needles, and to buy a new sewing machine. Her dream is to make improvements to her home.

loans.use: to buy cloth, thread, scissors, needles adn a seing machine

loans.name: Adriana

texts.es:
Adriana C. R. es una joven estudiante  de 21 anos, y esta termiando su licenciatura de Administración de recursos Humanos
Ella es de Ostional Guanacaste, y  necesita una computadora portátil para terminar sus estudios, ya que está finalizando su Postgrado  en Administracion de recursos humanos.  Par a eso necesita un préstamo de ₡ 350 000 (trescientos cincuenta mil colones). Ella espera que después de terminar sus estudios, empezara a trabajar  para poder ayudar a su familia económicamente. 
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito  Apoyo Comunal Ostional,  una de las 110 Empresa socias de EDESA en  Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Adriana C. R. is a 21 year-old student who is finishing her degree in Human Resource Management.  She is from Ostional, Guanacaste and needs a laptop to finish her studies.  She needs a loan for 350,000 colones.

Adriana hopes that after finishing her studies she will start working so that she can help her family financially.  She is a member of the 'Empresa de Crédito Apoyo Comunal Ostional' which is one of EDESA's 110 member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy a laptop

loans.name: Janett

texts.es:
Janett M., mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 39 años. Ella inicio su negocio hace  20 años  con un modestos y pequeño negocio de comida,  empezó vendiendo enchiladas para ver si el negocio era viable y luego como vio que había mucho movimiento instalo su comideria en la cual trabaja junto con su hermana y una sobrina.
Este crédito que solicito es de autoestima el cual ocupara para realizarse unos exámenes médicos.
texts.en:
Janett M. is a hard working, enterprising 39 year old woman who puts a lot of effort into her food stall business that she started 20 years ago.  She began selling enchiladas to see if this was a viable business and once she had a lot of movement, she opened the dining room, where she works with her sister and niece.

She will use the money from this loan to pay for some medical exams.

loans.use: to pay for medical expenses

loans.name: Xiomara

texts.es:
La señora Xiomara Estela M., mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora quien se dedica al comercio de ropa. Negocio en el que le va muy bien y que gracias a los créditos lo ha ido mejorando poco a poco. Ella sueña con tener una tienda de ropa y calzado el cual si Dios quiere será pronto.
M. solicito un crédito de autoestima el cual es otorgado a las clientas para su uso personal ella con el crédito se realizara un chequeo médico.
texts.en: Xiomara Estela M. is a hard working enterprising woman who puts a lot of effort into her clothing business.  The business is doing well, thanks to the loans she has gotten; she has been able to improve her business little by little.  She hopes to have a clothing and shoe store one day, God willing it will not be far off.  M. is asking for this loan so that she can pay for a medical exam.

loans.use: to have a medical exam

loans.name: Francisca Del Socorro

texts.es:
Francisca del Socorro M. Salazar es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 56 años tiene un comedor donde oferta desayunos, almuerzos y cena en el plantel los coco. Ella trabaja junto a su compañero de vida con el propósito de ampliar su negocio y salir adelante.

Ella ha participado en las capaciones que Adim brinda lo cual les ha ayudado a salir a delante.
texts.en:
Francisca del Socorro M. Salazar is a hardworking, 56 year old enterprising woman who puts a lot of effort into her food business.  She has a dining room where she sells breakfasts, lunches, and dinners on the coconut plantation.  She works with her life partner and wants to expand her business and get ahead.

She has gotten training from ADIM which has helped her get ahead.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Yader Alexander

texts.es: Yader tiene 22 años. Es un hombre muy responsable su actividad económica es la venta de trofeos. Hace más de 24 años que inicio con este negocio con ahorros que tenia, por lo que anteriormente se dedicaba a trabajar como obrero, pero el observo que era una actividad muy rentable y fue con poco productos que el inicia este negocio y fue así que obtuvo a  sus clientes pues siempre ofrece un buen servicio. Este crédito es para la compra de medallas, copas, materiales entre otras cosas necesarias. El deseo de Yader es terminar de construir su humilde vivienda.
texts.en: Yader is 22 years old and is a very responsible man who sells trophies, a business he started with his savings 24 years ago.  He used to work as a laborer, but he noticed that this was a very profitable business and he started with a few products.  He’s been able to attract customers because of the great service he offers.  He will use the money from this loan to buy medals, cups, and other supplies he needs for the business.  Yader wants to finish building his humble home..

loans.use: to buy trophy supplies for his business

loans.name: Maria Judith

texts.es: La Sra. María, vive en  la localidad de Colomi camino al Chapare,  es soltera, vive en la casa sus padres es independiente, realiza su venta solo los días de feria los jueves y domingo ella vende frazadillas, chamarras, ropa para niños, poleras, chompas para niños ella vende variedad de mercadería según a la temporada, el préstamo lo invertirá para la compra de mercadería de invierno ya que se esta acercando la época de frio y no cuenta con esta mercadería y ya muchos de sus  clientes le hicieron pedidos, es una persona joven con muchas ganas de superación y agradecida con la institución por el 	apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Maria lives in Colomi, along the road to Chapare.  She is single, lives with her parents, and sells her wares (blankets, jackets, children’s clothing, t-shirts, and children’s sweaters) on fair days, Thursdays and Sundays.  She sells a variety of merchandise according to the season.  She will use the money from this loan to buy winter merchandise because the cold months are approaching and she doesn’t have these items in stock.  Many of her customers have asked for them.  She is young, has a great desire to succeed, and is grateful to the institution for its support..

loans.use: to buy winter merchandise

loans.name: Las Esperanzadas Group

texts.es:
El grupo Las Esperanzadas lo conforman seis mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellas son Anielka Rodríguez, Sheyla L. y Izayana V.. La coordinadora es la señora Anielka Rodríguez  quien comercializa ropa usada desde hace 12 años. Ella vende de manera ambulante en distintas partes del país.  
Ella con el crédito comprará paca de ropa y calzado.
Sheyla L. tiene una pulpería y su meta principal es tener su casa y Izayana V. vende plata desde hace 30 años y su sueño es tener una tienda de variedades.
texts.en:
This group, “Las Esperanzadas” is made up of six hard working, enterprising women who put forth a great amount of effort.  They are Anielka Rodríguez, Sheyla L., and Izayana V..  Anielka Rodríguez is the group’s coordinator and has been selling used clothing for 12 years.  She sells on foot in different areas of the country.  She will use the money from this loan to buy clothing and shoes.

Sheyla L. has a small grocery store and her goal is to have a house of her own.  Izayana V. has been selling silver for 30 years and her dream is to have a variety store.

loans.use: to buy clothing for resale

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy supplies

loans.name: Leonidas

texts.es:
Leónidas es vecino de la comunidad de Ostional en Guanacaste, el es una persona muy trabajadora y ama la agricultura.
El se ha dedicado a la agricultura de granos básicos durante toda su vida,  y  en este momento necesita un préstamo de ₡250 000 (doscientos cincuenta mil colones) para la compra de abonos y sobre de herramientas necesarias para sembrar sus  cosechas.  El está muy motivado por que los precios han mejorado bastante. Asegura que a final de este ano tendrá más recursos económicos para disfrutar con su familia.
El es socio de la Empresa de Crédito  Apoyo Comunal Ostional,  una de las 110 Empresa socias de EDESA en  Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Leónidas is from the Ostional community in Guanacaste.  He is a very hard working person who loves agriculture.

He has been dedicated to raising basic grains all his life and at the moment he needs a loan of ₡250,000 to buy fertilizer and tools that he needs to plant his crops.  He is very motivated because prices have greatly improved and he is certain that by the end of this year he will have more financial resources to enjoy with his family.

He is part of the “Empresa de Crédito Apoyo Comunal Ostional,” one of the 110 EDESA social businesses in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy farm tools and fertilizer

loans.name: Santa Lucia Group

texts.es:
El grupo Santa Lucia está integrado por cuatro mujeres trabajadoras una de ellas son la joven Neysi Rebeca C. Vallecillo tiene una pequeña librería y comercializa ropa nueva y usada. Esta joven de 25 años inicio con la ayuda de la Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura donde estudio operador en computación y como forma de apoyarlos les dio un financiamiento para que iniciaran su negocio.

Es entonces que C. instala su pequeña librería a finales del 2005 y luego para aumentarlo empezó a prestar con lo cual luego de un tiempo invierte en otro negocio que es en ropa y cosméticos. Ella con el préstamo comprara pacas de ropa y cosméticos ya que en esta época son los productos que tienen mayor demanda.

Sus compañeras son Idalia U. quien vende frescos, gaseosas, comida y cosméticos; Karla C. de 21 años la cual para poder costear sus estudios y lograr ser una enfermera empezó hace dos años y medio a vender nacatamales, platillo típico que se consume generalmente los fines de semana y Heysell Carolina C. vende cosméticos.
texts.en:
Rebeca C. Vallecillo has a small bookstore and also sells new and used clothing.  This 25 year old woman began with the help of “Asociación de Promotores de la Cultura,” where she studied computing and received a loan to start a business.

It was then, at the end of 2005, that C. started her small bookstore and later, in order to grow it, she began borrowing and invested the money in her clothing and cosmetic business.  She will use the money from this loan to buy packs of clothing and cosmetics, as this is her busy season and these products are in high demand.

Her fellow members are Idalia U. who sells soft drinks, food, and cosmetics; Karla C., age 21, who began selling nacatamales, a typical dish normally enjoyed on the weekends, 2 ½ years ago in order to pay for her tuition for nursing school; and Heysell Carolina C. who sells cosmetics.

loans.use: to buy clothing for her business

loans.name: San Pablo Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Pablo lo conforman cuatro personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras ellos son Ana María Sánchez, Virginia Azucena Velázquez y Dina Raquel C. originarios de Ticuantepe.  La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Sánchez  quien tiene una comideria desde hace tres años la cual inicio con unos ahorros y con los prestamos ha ido aumentando.
Ella inicio con una fritanga, restaurante popular que consiste en comida frita  la cual pone fines de semana y diario vende almuerzo. El préstamo lo invertirá en granos básicos, aceite, carne, verduras, especies…etc.
La señora Velázquez se dedica a la venta de cosméticos desde hace tres años e invertirá en cremas y perfumes, y la señora C. vende ropa usada y nueva con el crédito comprará mercadería de temporada.
texts.en:
The San Pablo group is made up of three hard working, enterprising women who put forth a lot of effort.  They are Ana María Sánchez, Virginia Azucena Velázquez, and Dina Raquel C. from Ticuantepe.  Ms. Sánchez is the coordinator and has had a dining room for the past three years.  She started it with her savings and has been growing it with the help of some loans.

She opened a “fritanga,” a popular restaurant that specializes in fried foods, which she sets up daily at lunchtime.  She will use the money from this loan to buy basic grains, cooking oil, meat, vegetables, spices, etc.

Ms. Velázquez has been selling cosmetics for three years and she will use the money to buy creams and perfumes.  Ms. C. sells second hand clothing and will use the money to buy seasonal clothing.

loans.use: to buy ingredients and merchandise

loans.name: Las Dalias Group

texts.es:
La A.C. “LAS DALIAS” iniciará su segundo ciclo en Pro Mujer, como parte del Centro Villa Exaltación, está compuesta por nueve integrantes y está dirigida por una mesa directiva, de la que es secretaria de actas la señora Susana. Los negocios que las integrantes de la asociación comunal llevan adelante son variados entre ellos tenemos: venta de alfombras y edredones, venta de CD’s, venta de frutas, pensión, tejido de cubrecamas, mandiles y chompas, venta de comida.

La señora Susana,  indica que hace dos ciclos que trabaja con Pro Mujer, ingresando por invitación de los asesores y compañeras de su zona. En la actualidad ella tiene un negocio de tejido de chompas a máquina, el que lo realiza en su C.. Nos cuenta también, que ella aprendió este negocio en la C. de su tía y lo viene realizando hace un año atrás.

El crédito que ahora sacará es para forma un capital de lana (materia prima para sus productos), este material lo comprará de la calle Max Paredez  (lugar comercial de la ciudad de La paz). Posterior a la elaboración de sus productos los comercializará de forma ambulante, ya que ella no cuenta con un puesto fijo.; los lugares son indistintos, pero en su mayoría en la Ceja (zona comercial de la ciudad de El Alto) o cerca de los colegios. Esta forma de trabajo le permite generar recursos para apoyar en lo posible a su familia, pues ella vive en concubinato y tiene un hijo.  

Cuando se le consulta qué le gusta de Pro Mujer, ella responde que le gusta la capacitación.

En la foto, hay una persona que acompaña al grupo, es la hermana de la señora María, pero cuando se les saco la foto prefiere darse la vuelta.
texts.en:
“LAS DALIAS” community bank is about to start its second loan cycle with Pro Mujer, as part of the Villa Exaltación regional office.  This group has nine members and is managed by a board of directors.  The group's secretary is Susana.  The businesses that the women are engaged in are varied and include: selling rugs and comforters, selling CDs, selling fruit, running a small restaurant, knitting bedspreads, aprons and sweaters, and selling meals.

Susana tells us that this is her second loan cycle with Pro Mujer.  She joined through an invitation from the organization's advisers and some friends from her area.  Susana's business is machine knitting sweaters at home.  She tells us that she learned this business in her aunt's home and has been carrying it out for one year.

Susana's current loan will be used to buy yarn (raw material for her products).  She buys her yarn in Max Paredez Street (a commercial area in the city of La Paz).  After making her products, she sells them as an itinerant street vendor because she doesn't have a fixed sales location.  She sells mainly in La Ceja (a commercial area of the city of El Alto) or near schools.  This work allows her to make money to support her family.  She lives with her partner and has one child.

When we asked her what she likes about Pro Mujer, she replied that she likes the training.

In the photo, there is an additional person accompanying the group.  This is María's sister but when the photo was taken she preferred to turn her head.

loans.use: to buy yarn

loans.name: Nubia

texts.es:
Nubia Pérez H. es vecina de Upala de Alajuela, una de las zonas con mayor cantidad de mujeres emprendedoras.
Ella se ha dedicado siempre  a la agricultura, principalmente a la ganadería   de doble propósito.  Y es por eso que ella quiere solicitar un préstamo de ₡400 000 (cuatrocientos mil colones) para la compra de 3 toretes para cuidarlos  y luego venderlos en Subasta, aprovechando  los buenos precios. 
Asegura que con este negocio, crecerá personalmente, y con los resultados mejorara su situación económica.
Dona Nubia es socia de la Empresa de Crédito Bansuperafe, una de las 110 empresas socias de Edesa en Costa Rica.
texts.en:
Nubia Pérez H. lives in Upala, in Alajuela.  This is an area with a lot of entrepreneurial women.

Nubia has always worked in agriculture, mainly raising livestock.  She would like to request a loan for 400,000 colones to buy three bulls which she will care for and then sell in Subasta, taking advantage of the good prices.  She assures us that this business will enable her to grow personally and the results will enable her to improve her financial situation.

Nubia is a member of 'Empresa de Crédito Bansuperafe', one of Edesa's 110 member companies in Costa Rica.

loans.use: to buy bulls

loans.name: San Sebastian Group

texts.es:
El grupo San Sebastián está conformado por tres mujeres ejemplares una de ellas es Erika C. quien desde joven se dedica a la producción y comercio de buñuelos dulces tradicionales hechos a base de yuca, queso y miel. Ella tiene ocho hijos de los cuales solo dependen de ellas siete de 19.18, 17,14, 11,8 y 3 años de los cuales dos de ellos no estudian la pequeña y la niña de 11 con capacidades diferentes. 

Las otras integrantes son Gloria Elena F. que se dedica desde hace  ocho años vende comida y Miguelina M. quien tiene una zapatería desde hace 15 años.
texts.en:
The San Sebastián group has three members.  They are all exemplary women.  One of them is Erika C. who has been making and selling sweet 'buñuelos' (a type of fritter) from cassava, cheese and honey since she was young.  She has eight children, of whom seven are still dependent on her.  They are 19, 18, 17, 14, 11, 8 and 3.  Two of her children do not study: her youngest and her 11 year-old [daughter] who is differently abled.

The other members of the group are Gloria Elena F., who has been selling meals for eight years, and Miguelina M. who has owned a shoe store for 15 years.

loans.use: to buy cassava, cheese, sugar, cinnamon, oil, etc.

loans.name: Monte Nuevo Group

texts.es:
El grupo solidario monte nuevo esta conformado por tres mujeres que se dedican al comercio, todas ellas tienen varios años de conocerse y de trabajar juntas como grupo, a continuacion se detallan las diferentes actividades que ellas realizan:

La señora Candida M. M. tiene 58 años de edad, es madre soltera de dos niños y se dedica a la venta de golosinas en un puesto ubicado en la entrada principal de Nacaome a la par de la llantera el Amigo.
Candida es una mujer servicial y trabajadora. En su negocio vende tacos, enchiladas, pollo, tajadas, papas, refrescos, agua , etc.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de materiales para la fabricacion de las comidas, ahorita que empieza la semana santa tiene muchas ventas.
las ganancias las necesita para salir adelante con sus 2 hijos.

La señora Ana Bessy E. tiene 28 años de edad, es madre de dos niños y se dedica a la venta de abarroteria , tiene una pulperia en la cual vende productos como ser manteca, pasta dental, huevos, jabon, refrescos, carnes, lacteos, embutidos y otra variedad de productos.
Ana es una mujer emprendedora y se destaca por ser una mujer simpatica, Ana es reconocida por las personas de su barrio y es muy popular entre los vecinos del mercado.
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de abarroteria al por mayor y asi surtir su negocio.

la sra. Cinthia Carolina E. tiene 21 años de edad, es madre de un niño y se dedica a la venta de tortillas desde hace 2 años, sus tortillas las vende en comedores, colegios, escuelas  y otras instituciones.
Cinthia es una mujer atenta, amable y trabajadora .
el credito lo utilizara para la compra de los materiales para la fabricacion de las tortillas.
Cinthia tiene la ayuda de su esposo, el es trabajador de la contruccion.

la meta de ellas es darles una mejor calidad de vida a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Monte Nuevo community bank is made up of three women who work in sales.  They have known each other and worked together as a group for several years.  Here we will provide details about their different business activities:

Candida M. M. is 58 years old.  She is a single mother and has two children.  Her business is selling food from a stall which is located at the main entrance to Nacaome, alongside El Amigo tire shop.  Candida is a helpful and hard-working woman.  In her business she sells tacos, enchiladas, chicken, sliced plantain, potatoes, soft drinks, water, etc.  She will use her loan to buy supplies that she needs for making her food.  Now that Semana Santa (Holy Week) is starting, she has a lot of sales.  She needs the profits from her business to get her two children ahead in life.

Ana Bessy E. is 28 years old.  She has two children and her business is selling groceries.  She has a small grocery store where she sells products including butter, toothpaste, eggs, soap, soft drinks, meat, dairy products and cold meats.  Ana is an enterprising woman and she is also noted for being kind.  She is well known by the people in her neighborhood and is very popular with her neighbors in the market.  Ana will use her loan to buy groceries wholesale so that she can stock her business.

Cinthia Carolina E. is 21 years old and has one child.  She has been selling tortillas for two years.  She sells her tortillas to small restaurants, high schools, elementary schools and other institutions.  Cinthia is an attentive, kind and hard-working woman.  She will use her loan to buy the supplies she needs to make her tortillas.  Cinthia has the help of her husband.  He is a construction worker.

The goal of these women is to provide their children with a better quality of life.

loans.use: to buy beef, chicken, vegetables, soft drinks, corn, firewood, water, butter, oil, beans, rice, sugar, toilet paper, candles and sanitary towels

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Reseda Group

texts.es:
El grupo Reseda lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras  originarias de Morimbo, Masaya. Esta ciudad fue nombrada la cuna del folklore nicaragüense en especial por que se trabaja mucho lo artesanal.
 La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Silvia B. López ella se dedica al comercio de ropa típica desde hace 8 años. Ella tiene un pequeño taller de costura donde su especialidad es la realización de cotonas.
El crédito lo invertirá en tela, hilos, bordado y su meta es tener una tienda.
Las otras dos integrantes son  María Isabel M. quien también realiza ropa típica en especial las maxi y María O. Sandigo se dedica a la elaboración de sombreros de palma la cual comercializa en el norte del país.
texts.en:
The Reseda group is made up of three hard-working, driven and enterprising people from Monimbo, Masaya.  This city was named the birthplace of Nicaraguan folklore in particular because its people make a lot of handicrafts.

The group's coordinator is Silvia B. López who has been selling traditional clothes for 8 years.  She has a small sewing workshop where her speciality is making thick cotton shirts.  She will invest her loan in buying fabric, threads and embroidery supplies.  Her goal is to own a store.

The other two members of the group are María Isabel M. who also sells traditional clothes, in particular long skirts, and María O. Sandigo who makes palm leaf hats which she sells in the north of the country.

loans.use: to buy fabric, threads, etc.

loans.name: Alfa Y Omega Group

texts.es:
El grupo Alfa y Omega lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras originarias de Diria, Masaya. La coordinadora del grupo es la señora Martha Mendosa quien es comerciante de ropa la cual vende en la isla de Ometepe (localizada en el lago de  N. y gran centro turístico) Ella lleva en este negocio aproximadamente 5 años e invertirá el crédito en mercadería.
Las otras integrantes son Arling Caldera quien se dedica al comercio de ropa y Reyna N. quien vende verduras.
texts.en:
The "Alfa y Omega" ["Alpha and Omega"] group is made up of three hard-working, determined and enteprising women who come from Diria, Masaya. The group's coordinator is Martha Mendosa, who sells clothing. She sells her merchandise on Ometepe Island (a popular tourist center located on N. Lake). She has operated this business for about 5 years, and she will invest the loan in merchandise. 

The other members are Arling Caldera, who sells clothing, and Reyna N., who sells vegetables.

loans.use: to buy seasonal clothing to sell.

loans.name: Vitalio

texts.es: El Sr. Vitalio se dedica al negocio de la elaboración de salchipapas desde hace dos años trabaja conjuntamente su esposa, el puesto de venta esta ubicado en la localidad de llaukenquiri, trabaja desde horas de la tarde hasta casi media noche, actualmente vive con su esposa en domicilio de propiedad de sus suegros, con el dinero del crédito desean ampliar el negocio comprando una cocina mas grande  para la  elaboracion de salchipapaps y comprar material para construcción para mejorar su domicilio ya que están haciendo arreglar la habitación donde viven, es una persona muy trabajadora y agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en: Vitalio has had a business making salchipapas (a Bolivian dish featuring sausages and fried potatoes) for 2 years.  He works together with his wife in a sales stall that is located in the town of Llaukenquiri.  He works from the afternoon until almost midnight.  He currently lives with his wife in a home owned by his in-laws.  With the money from the loan he wants to expand his business by buying a bigger stove to make his salchipapas, and also buy construction materials to make improvements to his home, since they are doing repairs to the house where they live.  He is a very hardworking person who is grateful to the institution for the support provided.

loans.use: to buy a stove to make salchipapas and to make improvements to his home

loans.name: Meyling Group

texts.es:
El grupo Meyling lo conforman tres personas trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Juana P. quien desde muy joven se dedica al comercio de frutas y verduras, actividad que aprendió de su madre.

Ella con el crédito comprar frutas de temporada en especial los jocotes y sandillas.

Las otras integrantes del grupo son Damaris A. y Luis Alberto F. ambos igual que la coordinadora se dedican al comercio de las frutas y verduras e invierten su crédito en la compra de cosechas.
texts.en:
The Meyling group is made up of three hardworking and enterprising people.  One of these is Juana P.  who has had a fruit and vegetable business since she was very young-she learned the business from her mother.

With the loan she will buy seasonal fruit, especially jocotes (a local fruit) and watermelons.  The other group members are Damaris A. and Luis Alberto F. who, along with the coordinator, sell fruit and vegetables and will use their loan to buy fresh produce.

loans.use: To purchase seasonal fruit such as jocotes (a local fruit) and watermelons.

loans.name: Leydi

texts.es: El señora Leydi dedicada a la venta de abarrotes en el mercado cercano a su domicilio la señora inicio sus ventas cuando no existía ninguna construcción el mercadito ahora ya cuenta con un puesto fijo, tiene muchos clientes que la conocen por su buena atención, y por la variedad de mercadería y también ofrece sus productos a precios diferenciados a los demás esto para ayudar de una u otra forma a sus clientas, el crédito  que solicita la señora es para incrementar su capital comprando abarrotes por cantidad  y así poder tener en lo posterior un almacén que es el deseo que tiene la Sra. Leydi, esta muy agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Leydi sells groceries in the market close to her home.  She began selling when there were no buildings, and now has a fixed post at the market.  She has many customers who know her for her good service and the variety of merchandise she offers.  She also offers her products at different prices from the rest in order to help her customers in one form or another.  

She is requesting this loan to increase her capital by buying groceries in bulk.  In the future, she wants to have a store.  Leydi is very thankful to the institution for the support they have given her.

loans.use: to purchase groceries.

loans.name: Lluvia De Amor Group

texts.es:
El grupo Lluvia de Amor lo conforman tres mujeres trabajadoras, esforzadas y emprendedoras una de ellas es la señora Ninoska P. quien desde muy joven se dedica al comercio de plantas las cuales vende en el norte del país.
Ella con el crédito comprar plantas ornamentales en Catarina para luego ir al norte a vender.  
Las otras integrantes del grupo son Xiomara R. quien comercializa plantas en la isla de Ometepe  y Luisa Hernández quien se dedica al  comercio de las frutas y verduras e invertirá su crédito en la compra de cosechas.
texts.en: The group "Lluvia de Amor" is made up of 3 dedicated, hardworking and enterprising women.  One of these is Ninoska Pena, who since the time she was very young has been selling plants in the northern part of the country.  With the loan, she will buy ornamental plants in Catarina to later take to the north to sell.  The other members of the group are Xiomara R., who sells plants on the island of Ometepe, and Luisa H., who has a business selling fruits and vegetables.  Luisa will use her loan to buy produce.

loans.use: to purchase ornamental plants

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy two children's pedicure spas, to refurbish the salon floor, and to buy a television

loans.name: Isabel

texts.es:
Isabel Cristina G. es una mujer trabajadora, esforzada y emprendedora de 43 años quien se dedica al comercio de nacatamales, comida típica a base de cerdo, masa, especies, papa, arroz etc. que se comercializa por lo general los fines de semana. Ella en un principio destazaba pero como vio que era mucho esfuerzo para ella decidió mejor comprar la carne para realizar dicho producto.

G. comercializa sus nacatamales en Tipitapa ya que hay mayor concurrencia y sueña en poner una pequeña venta. Ella tiene cinco hijos de los cuales uno de ellos está a su cargo y es quien le ayuda en sus tiempos libre en el negocio.
texts.en:
Isabel Cristina G. is a hardworking, enterprising, woman who puts forth a lot of effort.  She is 43 years old and sells nacatamales, a typical food made from pork, spices, potatoes, and rice, wrapped in dough.  She usually sells these on the weekends.  She used to butcher her own meat, but later decided to buy it instead, to save on work.

G. sells her nacatamales in Tipitapa because many people gather there and she would like to set up a permanent stall.  She has five children , but only one who still depends on her for support.  He helps her with the business in his spare time.

loans.use: to buy ingredients

loans.name: Francisca

texts.es: Francisca tiene 40 años, es una mujer muy sencilla y trabajadora, vive en su casa propia junto a sus 2 queridos hijos Reyson de 15 y Jessica de 18 años, a quienes desea brindar una mejor calidad de vida. La actividad que realiza Francisca es la venta de zapatos, todos los días desde muy temprano camina por las calles en busca de clientes. Pero ella no solo se dedica a vender calzados sino que también los confecciona, es muy buena realizando su trabajo, motivo por el cual también reparte sus calzados a otras vendedoras. Lo que más le gusta de su trabajo es confeccionar los zapatos, por lo cual le pone mucho empeño, lleva 3 años en esta actividad y considera que lo más difícil es transportar los zapatos hasta su lugar de venta, ya que tiene que visitar muchos zonas, espera con el tiempo poner una tienda muy grande donde pueda vender los zapatos que confecciona. Es el tercer crédito con MFP, ha pagado puntualmente sus anteriores créditos y éste último espera pagarlo a tiempo también, en su banco comunal es muy participativa. Con los dos mil nuevos soles solicitados, comprará nuevos materiales para confeccionar una mayor cantidad de zapatos.
texts.en:
Francisca is 40 years old and a simple and hard-working woman.  She lives in her own home with her two children Reyson, 15, and Jessica, 18, who she would like to give a better quality of life.  

Francisca works selling shoes.  Beginning very early in the morning every day, she travels the streets looking for customers.  In addition to selling shoes, she also makes them.  She is very good at her work, so she also sells her shoes to other vendors.  The thing she likes best about her work is making the shoes, and she puts a lot of effort into it.  She has done this work for three years.  She thinks the most difficult thing about her work is transporting the shoes to where they are sold, because she has to visit many different areas.  She hopes that in the future she will have a large store where she can sell all the shoes she makes.

This is her third loan with MFP, and she has paid all of her past loans on time, and she plans to pay this loan on time also.  Her community bank is very active.  With the 2000 nuevos soles she has requested, she will purchase new materials to make a larger quantity of shoes.

loans.use: to purchase materials to make shoes.

loans.name: William

texts.en:
William L. is a videographer who makes wedding videos and commercials.  William started Bella Videography six years ago and has over 25 years of industry experience.  He worked at the Houston Independent School District for 16 years before deciding to open Bella Videography, a decision he has never regretted.  He loves being able to do what he loves and advises prospective entrepreneurs “to take the plunge… if you never do it, you’ll never know.”

Born in Colombia, William came to the United States when he was three years old.  Being fluent in Spanish helps William market to Houston’s Hispanic population, and is especially useful when dealing with older clients who don’t speak English.  Houston’s warm climate makes for a non-traditional, year-round wedding season that keeps William on the run.  A typical week for William has him editing footage during the business week and working events on the weekend.  He hires hourly, part-time employees who help him with events requesting multiple cameras.
