texts.es: La Señora María Cruz está solicitando nuestra ayuda, ya que ella se dedica a la venta de productos a diferentes distribuidores, pero ella considera que le iría mejor si ella misma vendiera esos productos por lo cual la ayuda que solicito en este crédito es para invertir en la mercancía que comprara y que espera que le brinde muy buenas ganancias, y también que sea un buen paso para seguir avanzando en su desempeño laboral para que así su esposo y sus tres hijos se sientan orgullosos de ella. Ella pagara este crédito con los ingresos que gana de la venta de los productos.
texts.en: María Cruz is asking for our help.  She works selling products to different distributors, but she thinks it will be better if she sold the products herself.  She is asking for this loan to invest in merchandise that she will buy and that she hopes will bring her a good income.  This will also be a good step to advance in her business development so that her husband and her three children will be proud of her.  She will pay this loan with the income she earns from the sale of the products.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise.

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mariela Viviana

texts.es:
En la ciudadela El Progreso de la ciudad de Portoviejo se reúne cada quince días el Banco Comunal Ilusiones, esta es una zona urbano marginal muy poblada en esta ciudad.se la conoce como el sector de la cárcel ya que en esta zona queda la cárcel de mujeres de Portoviejo.

En este lugar conocimos a la señora María Duran. Tiene 31 años de edad y es madre soltera de un niño de diez años de edad que estudia  en escuela, ella vive en la casa de sus padres. Está en el Banco Comunal desde el inicio y le gusta porque a través de los créditos ella ha podido financiar su negocio, ganar lo suficiente para terminar sus estudios superiores y darle lo mejor a su hijo.

Es secretaria de una empresa y también es comerciante, vende ropa interior de damas, perfumes y sabanas. Trabaja todos los días, les vende a sus compañeros de trabajo y en las noches recorre y ofrece sus productos a conocidos y amigos del sector, entrega la mercadería a crédito y cobra por semana o por quincena de acuerdo a como prefieran sus clientes. Lo que es perfumes y cremas le envía una tía de Estados Unidos, la ropa y las sabanas compra en Guayaquil una vez al mes. Lleva 4 años dedicada a sus actividades comerciales.

Este crédito es para pagar el próximo envío de perfumes que le llega.

 Su sueño es tener casa propia.
texts.en:
Ilusiones community bank meets every 15 days in a residential complex called El Progreso in the city of Portoviejo. This is a densely populated, marginalized urban zone known as the prison sector because it is where the Portoviejo women's prison is located. 

María Duran is a 31-year old single mother. Her son is 10 years old and attends primary school. They live with María's parents. María has been part of this banking group since it began. She likes it because the loans have enabled her to finance her business, to earn enough to cover her college tuition, and to provide her son with the best. 

She is a secretary at a local business and also a clothing vendor. She sells women's underwear, perfume, and sheets to her co-workers. In the evenings, María sells her products to acquaintances and friends in her neighborhood, offering items on credit for weekly or bi-weekly repayment. She gets her perfumes and lotions from her aunt in the U.S. and buys her clothing and sheets in Guayaquil once a month. María has been running this business for four years. 

This loan is to pay for her next shipment of perfume. María's dream is to one day own her own house.

loans.use: To buy perfume for business.

loans.name: Celia Aydee

texts.es:
La señora Celia Aydee tiene ya más de cuatro años dedicándose a la venta de ropa usada a fuera de su casa. 
Solicita un préstamo para invertir en el negocio ya que desea vender ropa nueva y de mejor calidad y moderna, pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para la inversión.
Pagara el crédito con las ganancias que obtiene del las ventas del negocio, ya que su esposo  Antonio se encargara de los gastos de la familia. 
Desea que su negocio tenga más mercancía y así en un futuro poder poner un local y así poder darle trabajo y ayudar a otra persona.
texts.en:
Celia Aydee has been selling used clothing in front of her house for more than four years.

She is requesting a loan to invest in the business. She would like to sell new, higher-quality, modern clothing, but she doesn’t have the money necessary for the investment.

She will pay the loan with the earnings she will have from her sales; her husband, Antonio, takes care of the family’s expenses.

She wants for her business to have more merchandise so that in the future she can open a store. That way she could provide a job to someone else, and help out that person.

loans.use: to buy merchandise for her business

payments.comment: Over-reported by partner.  Reduced to local price.

loans.name: Mirian Dora

texts.es: mirian tiene 53 años, vive con su esposo, hijos y nietos, ella se inició hace 2 años brindando pensión a sus vecinos, actualmente atienD. a mas D. 20 personas al día, todos la reconocen por su buena sazón y amabilidad en la atención, ella desea invertir en la compra D. utensilios e insumos para su negocio y D. esta manera generar mas ingresos, mirian sueña con tener su restaurante y así poder darle una mejor calidad D. vida a su familia.
texts.en: Mirian is 53 years old. She lives with her husband, children, and grandchildren. Two years ago she began cooking meals for her neighbors. She now cooks for more than 20 people per day. Everyone knows her because of her good cooking and her friendly manner. She would like to buy utensils and ingredients for her business so that she can earn more income. Mirian dreams of having her own restaurant and bringing a better quality of life to her family.

loans.use: to purchase kitchen utensils and supplies

loans.name: Juan Alberto

texts.es: El señor Juan Alberto formo una familia con la señora Juana y tienen un pequeño hijo de 3 años al cual quieren mucho y desean que su infancia sea tranquila y que tenga buenos recuerdos de ella cuando sea grande, deseo que se está viendo truncado porque por el momento el Sr. Juan no cuenta con el dinero suficiente para la construcción de portón en la parte de enfrente de la casa por lo cual la casa no es segura para que los integrantes de la familia estén afuera porque viven en un área muy transitada y no desean que pueda suceder algún accidente. Debido a esto el señor Juan esta solicitando nuestra ayuda para financiar este crédito y hacer la mejora antes dicha, el planea pagar este crédito con sus ingresos como coordinador de tráfico y con la ayuda de los ingresos que gana su esposa.
texts.en: Juan Alberto and Juana have a son who is 3 years old and whom they love very much. They want his childhood to be good and for him to have good memories of it when he grows up. The house [in the photo] is unfinished because at the moment Juan doesn’t have enough money to build the gate in front of the house, which makes the house unsafe for the family to spend time outside. The area they live in has a lot of traffic, and they don’t want an accident to happen. For this reason, Juan is requesting our help to finance this loan so that he can install the gate as soon as possible. He plans to repay the loan with his income from his job as a traffic coordinator and with the help of his wife’s income.

loans.use: to install a gate in front of his house

loans.name: Liz Gabriela

texts.es:
La señorita Liz tiene 20 años de edad, es soltera y vive con sus padres, en la ciudad de Curuguaty, en el Barrio San Miguel.
Tiene una tienda de ropas desde hace más de 2 años. Dicha ropería la pudo habilitar con un pequeño capital que había juntado, sólo así pudo montar su negocio. Hoy día Liz, con sacrificio inmenso, sale adelante, generando ingresos que aportan a la canasta familiar.
Actualmente posee clientela formada, pues su negocio está  ubicado en el centro mismo, sobre 14 de Mayo esq.  Nanawa, una de las principales avenidas y a unas cuadras antes de la terminal principal de ómnibus, donde concurre mucha gente cada día.
Necesita el crédito para la compra de abrigos y ropas de inviernya que se encuentra en la temporada invernal.
texts.en:
Liz is 20 years old. She is single and lives with her parents in the city of Curuguaty, in the Barrio San Miguel neighborhood.

She has had a clothing store for more than 2 years. She was able to open her store with a little bit of capital that she had saved—that was all she had to start with. Now, with great sacrifice, Liz is getting ahead and generating income that she contributes for the family’s expenses. 

She has an established client base because her business is located in the center of town, at the intersection of May 14 and Nanawa, one of the main avenues and just a few blocks from the main bus station, where many people gather every day. 

She needs the loan to buy coats and winter clothing, since it is now the winter season.

loans.use: to buy winter clothing

loans.name: Maria De La Luz

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria De La Luz le está haciendo faltas los acabados del interior así como enjarar  y pintar la casa. Pero no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar la mejora. 
Es por eso que esta solicitando un préstamo y así poder comprar el material que necesita para que su esposo realice la mejora en horario a adicional a su trabajo. 
Planea pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de limpieza de una casa particular, ya que su esposo el señor Victorino se encargara de los gastos de la casa y escolares de sus tres hijos. 
Desea mejorar el patrimonio de su familia ya que este me mejores condiciones y mas segura.
texts.en:
Maria De La Luz’s house needs finishing touches in the interior, such as stucco for the walls and paint. However, she doesn’t have the money that is necessary to make these improvements. 

For this reason, she is requesting a loan so that she can buy the materials she needs so that her husband can do the work after his job. 

She plans to repay the loan with the income she earns from her job as a housekeeper; her husband, Victorino, takes care of the household expenses and the school expenses for their three children.

She wants to improve her family’s house so that it will be in better condition and safer.

loans.use: to finish the interior of her house

loans.name: Ma De Los Ángeles

texts.es:
Al negocio de la señora Maria De Los Ángeles le está haciendo falta mas variedad de mercancía como es de ropa para niños, juguetes y zapatos también quiere comprar algunas maniquís para mostrar la ropa y así sea más fácil para sus clientes. 
Estas solicitando un préstamo porque no cuenta con el dinero necesario para realizar esta inversión en su negocio. 
Pagar el crédito con una parte de las ganancias que obtiene de las ventas del negocio ya que es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para ella ya que es soltera y vive sola.
texts.en:
Miss María de los Ángeles needs to add more variety to her business selling children's clothing, toys and shoes.  She also would like to buy mannequins to display the clothing, thus making it easier for her customers.

She is requesting a loan because she does not have the funds necessary to invest in her business.

She will pay it back with the profits from her sales, since it is the only source of income she has and she is single and lives alone.

loans.use: To buy merchandise for her business

loans.name: Ma Santos

texts.es:
A la vivienda de la señora Maria Santos le está haciendo falta cambiar toda la instalación de la electricidad en la casa, ya que esta actualmente esta en muy malas condiciones y tiene miedo que pueda pasar un accidente y le pueda pasar algo a su familia. 
Solicita el préstamo ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para poder comprar el material y pagarle a la persona que se encargara de relazar la mejora.
Pagar el crédito con el ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como empleada de una fabrica, ya que su esposo el señor Juan se encargara de los gastos familiares de la casa, con el sueldo que obtiene de su trabajo.
texts.en:
Mrs. María Santos's house is in need of a new electricity installation since the current one is in very bad shape and she is worried there could be an accident and someting could happen to her family.

She is requesting a loan because she doesn't have the money right now to buy the material she needs and to pay the person who will carry out this improvement.

She plans to pay back the loan with the income she earns from her job in a factory.  Her husband, Juan, covers the family's household expenses with his salary.

loans.use: To install electricity in her house

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy merchandise and a car for her business

loans.name: Costa San Antonio Group

texts.es:
Este Comité se formo a través de las Sras. Asteria I. y Manuela L., quienes se habían acercado hasta la Oficina de la Fundación Paraguaya para interiorizarse más acerca del Programa de Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras.
Las integrantes lo tomaron con mucho entusiasmo y dedicación, sus responsabilidades son tomadas con mucho esfuerzo y destaque.
La sra. Asteria se dedica a la venta de leche, ella produce la leche que vende mediante sus vacas, y cuando posee poca leche para la venta o la cantidad de demanda compra de un tambo cercano a precios buenos de modo que le genere ganancias.
Todas las mujeres de este grupo son muy trabajadoras y luchadoras, por ello solicitan el crédito para invertir en sus respectivos negocios, como en el caso de la sra. Asteria, quien desea invertir para la compra de  herramientas de trabajo como tarros y recipientes de litro.
texts.en:
This group was set up by Mrs. Asteria I. and Mrs. Manuela L., who went to the Paraguaya Foundation Office to find out about the Women Entrepreneurs' Group Program.

The members are very enthusiastic and dedicated; and they take their responsibilities very seriously and with much effort.

Mrs. Asteria sells milk which she gets from her dairy cattle.  When she does not have milk to sell or cannot meet demand she buys from a nearby dairy farm at good prices so she can earn a profit.

All of the women in the group are hard workers and struggle to get ahead.  They are requesting this loan to invest in their respective businesses, such as Mrs. Asteria's case.  She plans to buy work utensils such as liter-size jars and containers.

loans.use: To buy work utensils such as liter-size jars and containers

loans.name: Miguel Ángel

texts.es:
El señor Miguel Ángel esta agradecido por su cooperación en los dos créditos anteriores con los cuales a realizado mejoras a su casa. 
Esta solicitando un préstamo para poder colocar el piso de concreto en el patio trasero de su casa. Ya que en este momento no cuenta con el dinero necesario para comprar el materia y pagarle a la persona que se están encargando de realizar las mejoras en su vivienda. 
Desea mejorar su casa ya que es el patrimonio de sus hijos y de su esposa quienes están casi todo el día. 
Pagar el crédito con una parte del ingreso que obtiene de su trabajo como jefe de tráfico de una agencia aduanal, ya que este es la fuente de ingreso que tiene para su familia.
texts.en:
Mr. Miguel Ángel is grateful for the two previous loans he has had and used for home improvements.  He is requesting a new loan to lay a concrete floor in the back patio of his home.  He does not have the necessary funds right now to buy the materials and pay someone to carry out the job.

He wants to renovate his home for his children, who will inherit the property, and for his wife who is at home all day.

He plans to pay back the loan with part of the income he receives from his job as a Customs Agency Traffic Chief, since this is the only source of income for the family.

loans.use: To lay a concrete floor in his back patio

loans.name: Pascual

texts.es:
El Sr. Pascual es propietario de una despensa en Santa María Misiones y cuenta con clientela formada en el barrio, es conocido por su buena atención, y por contar con todas las necesidades básicas para el uso del hogar, es casado, y trabaja conjuntamente con su familia en su negocio, ha trabajado desde hace años en la misma actividad.
El optó por el crédito con la Fundación Paraguaya para adquirir más mercaderías para su negocio a fin de proporcionar a sus clientes mayor variedad de productos.
El cliente de Kiva manifiesta su satisfacción por trabajar con la Fundación por el apoyo al desarrollo y crecimiento para su actividad.
Espera poder contar con la ayuda de los inversionistas para la compra de mercaderías para despensa como panificados, fideos, bebidas, etc.
texts.en:
Pascual is the owner of a store in Santa María Misiones and he has regualr customers in the neighborhood. He is known for his good service and for having the basic neccesities for the home. He is married and works with his family in the business. He has worked for years in the same activity.  

He decided to get the loan from Fundación Paraguaya to acquire more merchandise for his business in order to provide his customers with a variety of products. This Kiva client shows his satisfaction for the support with the development and growth of his activity. 

He hopes to be able to count on the help of the investors to buy merchandise for the store, such as baked goods,

loans.use: to buy merchandise fo a store, such as baked goods, pasta, beverages, etc.

loans.name: Angelica

texts.es:
La Sra Angélica es oriunda de la ciudad de Eusebio Ayala, tiene  46 años, vive en  pareja hace 15 años, y tiene 2 hijos, uno de 15 años y otro de 13 en edad escolar.
La misma cuenta que su familia decidió venir  a Villa Elisa cuando ella tenia 20 años, que al principio fue bastante difícil ya que no tenia una profesión y por ente no podía conseguir un buen trabajo, entonces empezó trabajando en una casa de familia, luego trabajó en un local de negocios de juegos electrónicos, y más adelante conoció a una señora que le ayudó y le enseñó a coser en la máquina, fue así que aprendió la profesión de modista, la misma mujer le ayudó a comprar su primera máquina de coser.
Hoy día tiene muchos clientes, a quienes les confecciona las prendas.
Con los ingresos  obtenidos  pudo comprar para su terreno en la ciudad de Fernando de la Mora, en donde está construyendo de a  poco su casa.
Con el crédito que solicita piensa crecer y afianzarse un poco más en cuanto a su profesión, comprarse de a poco otras máquinas y obtener materias primas.
texts.en:
Angélica is from the city of Eusebio Ayala. She is 46 years old and has lived with her spouse for 15 years. She has 2 children, one 15 and the other 13, both school aged. 

She relates that the family decided to come to Villa Elisa when she was 20 years old. at first it was very difficult since she had no profession and therefore wasn't able to get a good job. So she started working at a family's house, Later she worked at a business that sold electronic games. Later, she met a lady who helped and her and taught her to sew with a machine. That is how she learned to be a seamstress. The same woman helped her buy a sewing machine.   

Today she has a lot of customers for whom she makes clothing. With the income she obtained, she was able to buy a plot of land in the city of Fernando de la Mora, where she is building her house little by little. With the loan she is asking for she plans on financing her self a little better in her profession by buying more machines and getting raw materials.

loans.use: to buy raw materials such as fabric and thread and more sewing machines.

loans.name: Maricor

texts.en:
Maricor B. is from the village of Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 35 years old. Maricor is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, she owns and operates a restaurant, serving a variety of different meals to customers in the local community. She has been engaged in her business for over nine years and earns approximately $192 a month for these activities.

In 2010, Maricor joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from PMPC. 

Maricor is requesting a new loan of 25,000 PHP which will be used to purchase raw ingredients for her different viand of her restaurant. This will be her 2nd loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase raw ingredients for her Restaurant Business

location.town: Villa Sudiacal, Liloy, ZAmboanga Del Norte

loans.name: Mary Ann

texts.en:
Mary Ann L. is from the village of Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 30 years old, married, and has a young child. To make a living, Mary Ann owns and operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from selling daily use products such as shampoo, soap, and toothpaste in the local community.  Mary Ann has been involved in her business for over five years, and she earns approximately 3000 PHP a month from the business.

In 2011, Mary Ann joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Mary Ann is requesting a new loan of 3000 PHP which will be used to purchase additional inventory to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional inventory to sell

location.town: Gil Sanchez, Labason, Zamboanga del Norte

loans.name: Luzviminda

texts.en:
Luzviminda B. is from the village of Farmington, Tampilisan, Zamboanga del Norte. She is 30 years old, married, and has one adult-aged child. To make a living, Luzviminda owns and operates a business making and selling food. The main source of income for the business comes from selling snacks and other delicacies in the local community. Luzviminda has been involved in her business for over four years, and she earns approximately 1000 PHP a month for these activities.

In 2011, Luzviminda joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business activities. Luzviminda is requesting a loan of 2000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be her first loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to supplement the family's income. 

About PMPC:

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Ramon

texts.es:
Ramón tiene 55 años de edad, vive con su esposa, en el distrito de La Victoria ubicado en la provincia de Chiclayo.  Este distrito se caracteriza por su gente emprendedora y deseosa de salir adelante y mejorar su calidad de vida.
Se dedica junto a su familia a la elaboración de adobes y ladrillos, cuenta con más de 15 años de experiencia en esta actividad.  Esta actividad es muy trabajosa y agotadora, pero a pesar de eso y por su clientela se mantiene en el rubro.  Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad le ayudan a cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su familia.
Ramón desea adquirir materia prima para la elaboración de adobes como pajilla y arcilla.  Para ello ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 700 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Ramón is 55 years old. He lives with his wife, in the district of La Victoria, located in the province of Chiclayo. This district is characterized by its enterprising people who want to get ahead and improve their quality of life. 

Together with his family, he makes adobe and bricks. He has more than 15 years experience in this activity. This activity is very arduous and exhausting. Despite this, and for his customers, he still works in this field. The income he gets from this activity helps him cover his personal expenses as well as those of his family. 

Ramón wants to acquire raw material to make adobe, such as straw and clay. For this he has decided to get a loan of 700 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy raw material

loans.name: Maria Esther

texts.es:
María tiene 55 años, es casada y tiene 4 hijos.  Su esposo trabaja como maestro D. obra (constructor). María y su familia residen en el distrito D. Pacasmayo, perteneciente al departamento D. La Libertad, ubicado a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.
María se dedica a la venta D. pan a sus vecinos D. su localidad.  Además brinda servicios D. costura, atendiendo con modelos exclusivos a su clientela, quienes ya conocen las labores que realiza.  Estas actividades las realiza en su propio domicilio y los ingresos que percibe sirven para apoyar a su esposo con los gastos familiares.
María desea comprar más tela para diseñar más prendas y poder percibir mayores ingresos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María is 55 years old. She is married and has 4 children. Her husband works as a builder (construction). Maria and her family live in the district of  Pacasmayo, which belongs to the department of La Libertad, located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, capital of the departament of Lambayeque.
María works selling bread to the residents of her community. She also is a seamstress, offering exclusive designs to her customers, who already know her work. She does these activities in her own home and the income she receives help her support her husband with the household expenses.   

María wants to buy more fabric to design more clothes and receive higher income. That is why she has decided to get a loan of  1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fabric.

loans.name: Maura

texts.es:
Maura tiene 49 años de edad, es conviviente y tiene 3 hijos. Vive en casa propia con su conviviente ubicada en el Distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, perteneciente a la Región Piura, ubicado a 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Maura se dedica a la crianza de chanchos y aves de corral. Ella tiene un corral y una granja apropiada para esta crianza. También cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona y tiene 5 años desarrollando esta actividad. Los animales cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los vende a sus vecinos y/o a los comerciantes que visitan la zona.  Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para solventar los gastos de su familia.
Maura desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales, con la finalidad de que alcancen el tamaño y peso apropiado en menos tiempo y poder venderlos.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Maura is 49 years old.  She has a common-law marriage and three children.  She lives with her partner in her own home which is located in the agricultural district of Tambogrande, in Piura region, four hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque department.

Maura's business is raising pigs and poultry.  She has a farmyard and farm where she raises her animals.  She has an established customer base in her area and has been in business for five years.  When her animals have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them to her neighbors and / or the traders who visit her area.  She uses the income from her business to cover her family's expenses.

Maura would like to buy balanced feed for her animals so that they reach a suitable size and weight in less time and she can sell them.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy balanced animal feed

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to purchase CDs

loans.name: Jesus Santos

texts.es:
Jesús tiene 28 años de edad,  vive con su cónyuge en el distrito de Santa Rosa perteneciente a la Provincia de Chiclayo. Este distrito se encuentra posterior al balneario de Pimentel, y está a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del Departamento de Lambayeque.

Se  dedica a la elaboración de todo tipo de pan en su domicilio desde hace más de un año. El pan que elabora es de muy buen sabor, el cual agrada a sus vecinos de la comunidad, quienes a la fecha prefieren y compran el pan que elabora.  Los ingresos que percibe en esta actividad le ayuda a cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su familia.

Jesús quisiera ampliar su negocio, vendiendo no solo pan sino también embutidos, que vendría a ser un producto complementario. Jesús quiere comprar todo tipo de embutidos para venderlo, es por ello que para lograr su objetivo desea obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Jesús is 28 years old and lives with his wife in the Santa Rosa district in the province of Chiclayo.  This district is located behind the Pimentel resort, and is 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.

He has worked making all types of bread in his home for more than a year.  The bread he makes has a good flavor, which appeals to his neighbors in the community so that to date, they prefer and purchase the bread he makes.  The income he makes from this activity help him cover his personal expenses and those of his family. 

Jesús wants to expand his business to also sell cold cuts, which he would sell as a complementary product. Jesus would like to purchase all types of cold cuts to sell. In order to do this, he has requested a loan of 1500 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase cold cuts to sell in his bakery

loans.name: Augusto

texts.es:
Augusto tiene 60 años de edad, es casado y vive en casa propia, ubicada en el distrito de Pacora, distrito poblado por gente trabajadora, emprendedora y pujante. El distrito está ubicado a 45 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
La actividad a la que se dedica el titular es la agricultura, específicamente el cultivo de maíz amarillo duro. El producto final lo comercializa en el mercado mayorista llamado Moshoqueque.  Los ingresos que percibe por la venta es utilizado para mantener a su hogar.
Augusto desea comprar fertilizantes para su cultivo.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Augusto is 60 years old, married, and lives in his own home located in the Pacora district, an area populated by hard-working, enterprising and thriving people.  The district is located about 45 minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.

Augusto works in agriculture, specifically the cultivation of hard yellow corn.  He sells the final product in the wholesale market of Moshoqueque.  The income he earns from the sale is used to maintain his home.

Augusto wants to purchase fertilizers for his crop, so he decided to obtain a loan of 2000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers.

loans.name: Nelida

texts.es:
Nélida tiene 56 años D. edad, casada y tiene 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo y su niño. La casa está ubicada en el Distrito agrícola D. TambogranD. en la Región Piura, el cual está ubicado a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.
Nélida se dedica a  la agricultura.  Ella tiene un terreno donD. siembra mango. Siembra mango desD. que tenía 10 años D. edad.  La actividad D. la agricultura la aprendió D. sus padres. También se dedica a la crianza D. ganado ovino, el cual alimenta y posteriormente venD..
Nélida desea realizar las labores agrícolas como son podas, aplicación D. fertilizante y agroquímicos. Así se logrará una cosecha óptima y oportuna.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1000 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Nélida is 56 years old, married and has one son.  She lives in her own house with her husband and child.  The house is located in the agricultural district of TambogranD. in the Piura region.  Piura is located 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the department of Lambayeque.  

Nélida works in agriculture and she has some land where she plants mango.  She has been planting mango since she was 10 years old.  Nélida learned how to work in agriculture from her parents.  She also raises sheep, which she fattens for later sale.  Nélida would like to perform agricultural work such as pruning and applying fertilizer and chemicals.  This will ensure an optimal and timely harvest.  For this reason, Nélida is requesting a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: To buy fertilizer.

loans.name: Eugenio

texts.es:
Eugenio tiene 51 años, es casado y vive en un lugar llamado La Matanza, ubicado en la región Piura.  Se encuentra a aproximadamente 4 horas de distancia de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.
Eugenio se dedica a la venta de libros en su localidad.  Esta actividad la aprendió de su familia quien también se dedicaba a la misma actividad.  Eugenio cuenta con clientela fidelizada y que acude siempre a su establecimiento.  Los ingresos percibidos los utiliza para cubrir sus gastos personales y los de su familia.
Eugenio necesita darle mantenimiento a su local, por lo que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Eugenio is 51 years old, married, and lives in a place called La Matanza, located in the Piura region, which is about four hours distance from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque department.

Eugenio works selling books in his store.  He learned this work from his family, who also work doing the same thing.  Eugenio has loyal customers who always come to his store.  He uses the income he earns to cover his personal expenses and those of his family.

Eugenio needs to do some maintenance in his store, so he has decided to ask Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 2000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to do maintenance at his book store.

loans.name: Pedro

texts.es: Pedro tiene 54 años de edad y es casado. Vive en casa propia con su esposa y sus hijos, quienes lo apoyan en su negocio. Residen en el distrito La Matanza, ubicado en la provincia de Morropon, en el norte de Perú. Se dedica a actividades agriculturas. Cuenta con un pequeño terreno donde siembra frijol. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace más de 20 años en su caserío. Aprendió esta actividad de su padre, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Desea usar su crédito para comprar fertilizantes y abonos que usará en el mantenimiento de su terreno agrícola y su cultivo de frijol. Con esta inversión, podrá sembrar una cantidad más grande de frijol que pueda vender al publico general y los negociantes  que suelen visitar la zona. Con sus ingresos, podrá solventar sus gastos familiares y del hogar. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) 1000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Pedro is 54 years old and married. He lives in his own home with his wife and kids, who support his business. They live in the district of La Matanza, located in the province of Morropon, in the north of Peru. He works in agriculture. He has a small plot of land where he plants beans. He has been doing this for more than 20 years in his village. He learned from his father, so he knows this field of work perfectly. 

He wants to use his loan to buy fertilizers and manure that will be used to maintain his farmland and his bean crop. With this investment, he will be able to plant a larger quantity of beans that he can sell to the general public and the businessmen that often visit the area. With his income, he will be able to cover his family's cost of living. For this reason, he has asked Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers for his bean crop

loans.name: Yrma Rosario

texts.es: Yrma tiene 52 años de edad. Es soltera y tiene dos hijos adultos. Vive con un hijo en el distrito de Guadalupe en Pacasmayo en el norte de Perú.  Desde hace 15 años, cuenta con una pequeña bodega en el central de su comunidad. Allí ofrecen en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida. Es muy conocida en la zona y tiene una clientela ya establecida. Desea generar más ingresos y pretende dividir su casa en dos partes para alquiler una parte a visitantes, estudiantes y empresarios que suelen visitar su distrito. Por ello, ha creido conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yrma is 52 years old, single and has 2 grown children. She lives with one son in the district of Guadalupe in Pacasmayo in the north of Peru. For 15 years she has had a small grocery store in the center of her community. There she sells diverse products of daily consumption, like staple goods and groceries, to her neighbors and customers. The business is well-received and well-known in the area, and she has an established clientele. 

She wants to generate more income and hopes to divide her house into two parts, so that she can rent one part to visitors, students and business people that often visit the district. For this reason, she has asked for a loan of 1000 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to make repairs to her home so that she can rent out part of it

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to build a house for his family

loans.name: Elma

texts.en:
Elma C. is from Dipolog City. She is 50 years old, married, and has six adult children. Elma owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of different products in the local community. Elma has been involved in her business for over two years, and she earns approximately 4,000 Philippine Pesos (PHP) a month from the business. She also maintains a rice field.

In 2010, Elma joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation, and her ability to engage in business activities. She successfully repaid a previous loan of 3,000 PHP. Elma is requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP which will be used to purchase fertilizers and pesticides for her rice field. This will be the third loan taken out by Elma from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model.

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partners to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: To purchase fertilizers and pesticides

loans.name: Merly Esther

texts.es: Merly tiene 23 años de edad. Es madre soltera de una hija. Vive en casa de padres con su hija en la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Merly se dedica a la venta de ropa por catálogo. Sus clientes hacen sus pedidos y Merly reparten la mercadería cada semana. Ella cuenta con clientes fidelizados en este negocio. Tiene una experiencia de más de 02 años en esta actividad. Adicionalmente cuenta con una mototaxi propia que alquila a un familiar, el cual le genera ingresos de forma diaria. Con los ingresos de estas actividades, Merly puede solventar sus gastos familiares. Desea aumentar su mercadería de ropa con más productos que puede vender durante la nueva temporada escolar en Perú. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa. Les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su apoyo en crecer su negocio.
texts.en:
Walther is 46 years old, married, and has four dependent children.  He lives in his own home in the rural part of La Victoria district, twenty minutes from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

For more than two years, Walther has been earning a living providing a transport service through a taxi company in his community.  He currently uses a vehicle which he hires by the day.

Walther would like to use part of the loan that he has requested from Edpyme Alternativa to enrol in a specialization course which will help him in his work and help him to increase his income.  He would like to use the rest of his loan to cover his children's school expenses now that the school year has begun in Peru.

Walther is very hard working and would like to continue improving in his field so that he can continue making a good income.  His biggest wish is to provide his children with a good-quality education.

loans.use: aumentar su mercadería de ropa con más productos que puede vender durante la nueva temporada escolar en Perú

loans.name: Maria Julia

texts.es: María tiene 55 años de edad, y es casada con 1 hijo. Vive en casa propia en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. María se dedica a la venta de refrescos y hamburguesas, y champu, un alimento tradicional de maíz, azúcar y fruta. Realiza esta actividad desde hace 05 años en un puesto del centro de su comunidad. Conoce a la perfección el rubro y cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Con sus ingresos, María puede ayudar a su esposo, quien se dedica a la agricultura, con el sostenimiento económico de su familia. María solicita un crédito para la compra de más insumos para utilizar en la preparación de su champu, comida y refrescos. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 800 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en: Maria is 55 years old, and is married with one child. She lives in her own house in a rural part of the Lambayeque district in the north of Peru. Maria works selling soft drinks and hamburgers as well as champu, a traditional delicacy of corn, sugar, and fruit. She has been pursuing this activity for five years in a stall in the center of her community. She knows the zone perfectly and has many established clients in the area. With her income, Maria can help her husband, who works in agriculture, with sustaining the family economically. Maria is asking for the loan to purchase more supplies to prepare the champu, as well as for the purchase of food and soft drinks. This is why she has thought it convenient to ask for a loan for 800 nuevos soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to purchase ingredients for her food business

loans.name: Lorena

texts.en:
Lorena S., age 41, cherishes being a community partner in CCT* because of the entrepreneurial training she receives, as well as the spiritual support being given to her. Lorena was not able to reach high school, but she is grateful to know that a good future lies ahead of her as she strives to lead a better life with a micro business of her own. Lorena is married to a younger husband named Richard, and together they are raising six children in their home in Tanza, Cavite.

Lorena focuses on her ready-to-wear (RTW) clothing business. She sells undergarments and other clothing apparel as well as such items as tablecloths to a set of valued customers composed of relatives, friends, and fellow community members. She has a commercial space in the public market of their community which she has managed on her own for four years now. She is able to earn a monthly income of approximately Php 12,000 a month.

To help her improve her business, Lorena has chosen to request a loan of Php 50,000. She will budget this money toward buying various merchandise items such as blouses, undershirts, and tablecloths to offer for sale. She believes that the loan will strongly sustain her capital and enable her to increase her profits. These will benefit her growing business and thus enable her to support the needs of her family and finance the education of her dear children.

The unstable prices of the merchandise she sells is one major difficulty Lorena faces at present. However, being an adept micro entrepreneur, she has ways to manage this problem and to grow as a person and as an entrepreneur. It is her goal to make her business stable and grow her profits. 

As a CCT community partner, she faithfully attends the group's weekly fellowship* meeting where she can also draw strength and inspiration from receiving the Word of God.

*All CCT community partners/clients are organized into fellowship groups that meet on a weekly basis. A fellowship group is composed of 15 to 30 community partners. The fellowship groups gather each week to study the Word of God, build social capital, and pay micro finance loans.

loans.use: to buy various merchandise items such as blouses, undershirts, and tablecloths to offer for sale

loans.name: Connie Adaro Group

texts.en:
Connie A. is from the village of Adorable, Jimenez, Misamis Occidental. She is 31 years old and is the leader of this three-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group members if they are delinquent or default.

Connie is married and has three school-aged children. 

She owns and operates a general store, selling a variety of products in the local community such as shampoo, toothpaste and soap. She has been engaged in her business for over three years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Connie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 5,000 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital.

Connie is requesting a new loan of 12,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase a variety of products to expand her product offering. This will be her fourth loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase products for her general store

loans.name: Jessie's Group

texts.en:
Jessie M. is from the village of Buenavista, Tudela, Misamis Occidental. She is 56 years old and is the leader of this two-member group loan offered by PMPC. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are collectively responsible for paying back the loan of their fellow group member if they are delinquent or default.

Jessie is married and has five adult-aged children. She has been a farmer for over 20 years and earns approximately 8,200 PHP a month.

In March, 2005, Jessie joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. She has successfully repaid a previous loan of 14,900 PHP from PMPC. This previous loan was used to purchase fertilizers.

Jessie is requesting a new loan of 14,900 PHP, which will be used to purchase fertilizers for her farm. This will be her eight loan from PMPC. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business for the improvement of her house.

About PMPC
Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers

loans.name: Anita

texts.en:
Mrs. Anita L., is from the village of Bañadero, Ozamiz City, Misamis Occidental. She is 47 years old. Anita is married and has three school-age children. 

To make a living, Anita owns and operates a fruit-vending business. Anita has been engaged in her business for over 20 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In May 2009, Anita joined PMPC to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Anita has successfully repaid a loan of 20,000 PHP. 

Anita is now requesting a new loan of 15,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional stocks of fruits. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family, especially in meeting their basic needs, saving for future use, loan repayment and the education of her children.

 About PMPC:
 Paglaum Multi-Purpose Cooperative (PMPC) is one of the most progressive cooperatives in northwestern Mindanao. It reaches out to the rural poor using the Grameen model. 

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional stock of fruits

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.es:
Esperanza se dedica a la costura en su casa de habitación, siendo el medio para apoyar  a su familia, junto  a su esposo el cual trabaja como ebanista.
También vende hielo, helados, para lograr cubrir los gastos básicos, ya que son de pocos recursos económicos, en donde han venido mejorando su pequeña casa con financiamiento que Afodenic ha dado atreves del crédito, ha logrado varias mejoras. 
Con este nuevo préstamo terminara de hacer el baño como el inodoro de concreto, ya que con el crédito anterior solo logro meter las aguas negras y cerro con zinc, ya que no ajusto, lo que espera comprar materiales de construcción para poder hacer de concretos el baño.
texts.en:
Esperanza's business is sewing.  She does this in her home and it is how she supports her family together with her husband who is a cabinetmaker.  Esperanza also sells ice and frozen treats in order to cover her basic expenses.  Hers is a family with limited financial means.

Esperanza has been improving her small home with the help of Afodenic loans.  She has managed to make several improvements.  With this new loan, she will finish building her bathroom and toilet room from concrete.  With her last loan, she only managed to install the sewage system and close it off with corrugated metal sheets.  She hopes to buy construction supplies so that she can construct her bathroom from concrete.

loans.use: to buy construction supplies to build her bathroom from concrete

loans.name: Vilsa

texts.es: La Sra. Vilsa vive en el barrio Paititi de la zona del plan 3000 vive en casa propia desde hace dos años, tiene dos hijos de 5 años y de 1 año, es madre soltera. Ella se dedica a la venta de dulces y chocolates como también a la venta de ropa de invierno, calcetines, medias y ropa deportiva. El crédito que esta solicitando es para la compra de material de construcción y así terminar de construir su baño y su acera y si poder brindar mayor comodidad a su familia. La Sra. Es una persona trabajadora, con muchas ganas de superación ya que es madre y `padre para sus hijos y tiene que trabajar mucho para sacar a su familia adelante.
texts.en: Vilsa lives in the Paititi neighborhood, in the Plan 3000 zone. She has lived in her own house for two years. She has two children, aged 5 and 1, and she is a single mother. Her work is selling sweets and chocolates, as well as selling winter clothing, socks, stockings and sports clothing. The loan that she is requesting is to buy construction materials, so that she can finish constructing her bathroom and wall surfacing and thus provide better comfort for her family. Vilsa is a hard-working person with a great desire for improvement, since she is both mother and father to her children, and she has to work hard to help her family get ahead.

loans.use: to finish her bathroom and wall surfacing

loans.name: Leonel Antonio

texts.es:
Leonel  es un padre de familia muy responsable en la educación de sus tres hijos. Durante varios años ha administrado un comedor que trabajan  en conjunto con la familia. 
Su objetivo ha sido la construcción de su vivienda en donde ha venido haciendo las mejoras a través de los financiamiento que Afodenic ha otorgado, en once ciclos, con el crédito anterior logro embaldosar su casa, ahora con este nuevo préstamo hará posible la compra de puertas y ventana, visagra a si como pago de su instalación, ya que solo están las verjas, y desea dar mejor seguridad a su propiedad.
texts.en:
Leonel is a family man who is very responsible about educating his three children.  For several years he has been running a dining room where he works with his family.

His goal has been the construction of his house.  He has been making improvements through the loans that Afodenic has granted him.  He has had eleven loan cycles, and with the last loan he managed to tile his house.

Now the new loan will make it possible to buy doors, windows, hinges and to pay for their installation.  Only the grates are there, and he wishes to provide his property with better security.

loans.use: to buy doors and windows to reinforce the grates

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: buy construction materials in order to make the front part of his house concrete

loans.name: Lucy

texts.es: El señora Lucy dedicada a la confección de poleras y cortos deportivos se dedica a esta actividad hace varios años atrás durante este tiempo fue recibiendo buena aceptación por los clientes de colegios y otros con los que la señora trabaja, la clienta desea el crédito para poder comprar maniquís para su nueva tienda comercial ya que esta inaugurando una tienda, este crédito ayudara mucho a la señora para poder surgir en este rubro que le apasiona tanto "vestir a la gente", es una persona muy trabajadora con muchas ganas de superación agradecida con la institución por el apoyo brindado.
texts.en:
Lucy makes polo style shirts and sportswear.  She has been engaged in this business activity for several years.  During this time she has been well-received by school customers and others who work with her.

She wants the loan to be able to buy mannequins for her new store that she is opening.  This loan will help her a lot to be able to advance in the field of “vestir la gente” (dressing the people) that she is so passionate about.

She is a very hard-working person with a great desire to get ahead.  She is grateful to the institution for the support it has provided.

loans.use: to buy mannequins

loans.name: Olimpia

texts.es:
Olimpia vende en su casa de habitación, desde hace varios años ya que logro poner una pulpería en donde hoy en día, con AFODENIC sus niveles de venta aumentaron al ofrecer más variedad en sus mercaderías.
Contenta ya que ha logrado el equilibrio y el apoyo  a su familia,  mediante la inversión, ya que cuando inicio lo hizo con venta de tortillas. Lo que mejoro mediante doce ciclos de financiamientos. Con este nuevo préstamo hará nuevas compras en productos enlatados, jugos, gaseosas, frutas, verduras, productos personales de limpieza entre otros productos que ayude a mejorar sus niveles de ventas
texts.en:
Olimpia set up a grocery store in her home several years ago and she sells products from her home.  With the help of AFODENIC, her sales levels have risen and she now sells a wider variety of merchandise.

Olimpia is happy because she has managed to achieve some balance and support her family through her investments as, when she started out, she only sold tortillas.  She has improved her business through twelve loan cycles.

Olimpia will use this new loan to buy canned goods, juice, soda, fruit, vegetables, personal care products etc. which will help her to improve her sales levels.

loans.use: to invest in canned goods, juice, soda, vegetables and other products

loans.name: Villa Bolivia Group

texts.es: El Banco de Emprendimiento Villa Bolivia esta ubicado en el barrio villa Bolivia de la zona del plan 3000, esta conformada por 10 integrantes todas mujeres. La presidenta es la Sra. Yoana ella se dedica a la venta de ropa americana en diferentes ferias de la zona del plan 3000, ella viaja a la ciudad de Oruro a comprar su mercadería, actividad a la que dedica hace bastante tiempo y le va muy bien,  tiene 2 hijos que se encuentran en edad escolar, con el dinero del crédito comprara mercadería. La mayoría de las socias de Villa Bolivia se dedica a la venta de abarrotes, promotoras y venta de ropa americana. Villa Bolivia esta en su tercer ciclo. Las socias son personas trabajadoras que quieren salir adelante para darles un futuro a sus hijos.
texts.en:
The Villa Bolivia community bank is located in Villa Bolivia neighborhood, in Plan 3000 suburb.  The group has ten members who are all women.  The group's president is Yoana who sells American clothes in different street markets in Plan 3000 suburb.  She travels to the city of Oruro to buy her merchandise.  She has been in this business for quite a while and it is doing very well.  Yoana has two school-age children.  She will use her loan money to buy merchandise.

The other members of Villa Bolivia sell groceries, work as sales reps and sell American clothes.  The group is in its third loan cycle.  The members are hard-working people who would like to get ahead so that they can provide their children with a future.

loans.use: to buy a bundle of clothes

loans.name: Lucia

texts.en: Lucia is 55 years old and has three children. She is a member of the communal bank "Musuq Rumi" which means "New Stone" in Quechua. She has a grocery store in her home where she sells general groceries, fruits, vegetables and meat. She will be using her loan of 1,200 PEN to purchase supplies such as sugar, rice, sweets, meat, eggs, and chicken. Lucia has been a member of FINCA Peru for four years now and wants to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to supply her grocery store

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to sort out some paperwork for his vehicle

loans.name: Esperanza

texts.en: Esperanza is a member of the communal bank Musuq Rumi ("New Stone", in Quechua) which is in its 22nd loan cycle at FINCA Peru. She has been working with FINCA Peru for several years and was previously president of the communal bank and now acts as treasurer. She has three children, two of whom are still studying. She sells firewood from her home, which she purchases from producers. She will be using her loan of 500 PEN to purchase more firewood. She would like eventually to increase her sales and expand to sell other items such as groceries.

loans.use: to purchase firewood from producers to resell

loans.name: Tahira's Group

texts.en:
Tahira lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its tannery industry. Her home is located in the area of Pakka Qilah and contains two rooms. She came here with her family 20 years ago. She is 40 years old and married to M. Irshad. To support her husband and to fulfill the basic needs of family, Tahira started a clothes-selling business three years ago. She takes orders from different clothes shops and from her community clients and fulfills them to earn income for the family. She purchases clothes from Lahore, which is a nearby city and the capital of Punjab province. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for the improvement of her clothes selling business. With the loan, she will purchase clothes in bulk, which will not only help her offer more variety to her clients but also cut the cost of traveling as a result of bulk purchasing. She is very hopeful that her business will improve after the loan and she will be able to provide better living facilities for her family as a result. She is a new loan applicant of Asasah.

loans.use: To buy clothes in bulk

loans.name: Aurelia

texts.en:
Aurelia is 39 years old and has one daughter. She is a member of the communal bank Musuq Rumi which means “New Stone” in Quechua.

Aurelia has sold candy wholesale for four years now. She has been a member of FINCA Peru for three years and is grateful that they facilitate her loans, allowing her to work. She has been able to open two small stores due to support from FINCA Peru.

With her new loan of 2,000 PEN she is going to travel to Lima to purchase novelty items to sell in Ayacucho. She is currently saving money to purchase her own house.

loans.use: To purchase novelties in Lima to sell in her store

loans.name: Shahnaz's Group

texts.en:
Shahnaz is a housewife who stays at home and does her household responsibilities. She is also a very caring mother who is bringing up her children very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her son wants to improve his mobile phone selling business. He has a shop in the market where he sells new and used mobile phones and mobile phone accessories. Through his shop, he offers mobile phones in different price ranges, which helps him target every kind of client. With the loan, he will buy mobile phones and mobile accessories to put in his shop to sell and earn good profits. He has been doing this business for the past six years and Shahnaz is hopeful that a loan will help him do his business better. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah.  

Shahnaz lives in Kasur, which is a small city in Punjab, Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has been living there in a small two-room home in the area of Pakka Qilah for the past 10 years. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Shahnaz.

loans.use: To buy mobile phones and mobile accessories to sell

loans.name: Rosalina Elizabeth

texts.es:
Rosalina es una pequeña comerciante, de venta de ropa y cosmético con varios años en las ventas, logrando cada día mejores objetivos en su negocio gracias a los financiamientos que Afodenic ha dado, con los cuales ha comprado variedad de productos, con mejores ventas.
Con este nuevo préstamo comprara mercadería en ropa, cremas de manos, crema para el cutis, pintura de labio, vanidad, perfume de dama y caballero, cremas para el cabello entre otros productos que se venden por ser de buena calidad y de costo bajos.
texts.en:
Rosalina is a small business owner who sells clothing and cosmetics. She has several years of experience in this business and is meeting higher goals all the time thanks to the loans she receives through Afodenic, with which she has purchased a variety of products and improved her sales. 

With this new loan she will purchase clothing merchandise, hand creams, skin creams, lipstick, perfumes, colognes, hair creams and other products which are popular due to their good quality and low cost.

loans.use: to purchase a variety of cosmetics to improve her sales.

loans.name: Tasleem's Group

texts.en:
Tasleem lives in Kasur, which is known for its tannery industry. It is located in Punjab, Pakistan and is an old historic city. She is married to R. A. who has a dairy business. He has some buffalos at his home. He gets up early in the morning and gets milk from his buffalos. He then sells that milk to his community clients and generates income for the family.  Tasleem herself is a housewife who stays at home and does her household work. In her spare time, she also supports her husband by taking care of his cattle and getting milk from them. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to buy another buffalo to expand his dairy business. By purchasing another buffalo, he will be able to increase the milk production to sell to more customers to earn better profits. Tasleem is hopeful that a loan will help her husband make more profits and improve the living standards of his family. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Tasleem.

loans.use: To buy another buffalo

loans.name: Sakina's Group

texts.en:
Sakina lives in Kasur, which is a small city located in Punjab, Pakistan known for its leather industry. She has been living there in the area of Mangal Mandi with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 18 years. She is a seamstress by profession and sews clothes for her neighboring clients. She is a very talented woman and sews very good quality clothes. She has a good number of clients in her area who give her regular orders every month. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband whose name is R. A.. He runs a grocery store in the community. Through his store, he sells daily-used items such as sugar, spices, cooking oil, etc to the community and generates income for the family. With the loan, he will buy groceries in bulk to put in his store to fulfill the customer needs on time and increase his monthly profits. 

She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. She is confident about the progress of her husband’s business as a result of the loan investment. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Sakina.

loans.use: To buy groceries to sell

loans.name: Elmer

texts.es:
Elmer  tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y que reside junto a sus padres en  el sector Villa en Sol del distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz. Uno de los distritos más poblados de la región Lambayeque, caracterizado principalmente por tener altos índices de pobreza, ya que las personas viven generalmente en zonas urbanas marginales que carecen de servicios básicos.

Elmer se dedica a brindar servicio de transporte de persona en mototaxi, recorre toda la zona del distrito hasta la ciudad de Chiclayo. El ya tiene cinco años dedicándose a esta actividad y gracias a ella solventa los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea realizar algunos trámites de licencia para conducir autos lo cual le permitirá brindar otro servicio mejor remunerado, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar por primera vez a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 500 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Elmer, 29, is single and lives with his parents in the Villa en Sol sector of José Leonardo Ortiz district. This is one of the most densely populated districts in the Lambayeque region, and is mainly known for having high poverty rates, since the people generally live in outlying urban zones that lack basic services. 

Elmer offers personal transportation services by motortaxi, traveling all over the area, from his district to the city of Chiclayo. He has been doing this for five years now, and it allows him to pay the family's expenses. He wants to go through the licensing procedures to drive cars, which would allow him to offer another, better paying, service. Therefore, he thought it best to request his first loan from Edpyme Alternativa for 500 soles.

loans.use: to pay procedural expenses for a driver's license

loans.name: Eugenia

texts.es:
Eugenia es una madre de familia de 37 años de edad que reside junto a su familia en el caserío La Matanza del distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Eugenia cuenta con una pequeña bodega instalada en su domicilio desde hace cuatro años. Allí ofrece en venta a los vecinos y clientes de la zona diversos productos de consumo diario, entre productos de primera necesidad y abarrotes. El negocio cuenta con muy buena acogida debido a la buena calidad de los productos que ofrece y a la buena atención que brindan. Con los ingresos que le brinda esta actividad ella se encarga de ayudar con el sostenimiento económico de su familia.

La creciente demanda que su bodega ha venido experimentando ha hecho que piense en ampliarla adquiriendo más productos, por ello ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa satisfacer la demanda de sus clientes.
texts.en:
Eugenia, 37, lives with her family in the tiny village of La Matanza in the agricultural Tambogrande district around Piura, more than four hours from Chiclayo, the capital city of Lambayeque region.

Eugenia has a small general store in her house that she has run for four years. There she sells many everyday items, groceries and basic necessities to her neighbors and customers from around the area. The business has been well received due to the high quality of the products and service offered. With the income from this business she has been able to help with her family's household expenses. 

Due to the increased demand that her store has been experiencing, she has been thinking about enlarging it and getting more products. Therefore, she thought it best to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which she hopes to meet the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to purchase merchandise for her business

loans.name: Eshrat's Group

texts.en:
Eshrat lives in a small city called Kasur, which is located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. It is famous for its leather industry. Her house is located in the area of Khara road where she has been living with her family for the past six years. Her husband's name is A. D. and he is a gardener by profession. He is very good in his work and does his job with great responsibility. Eshrat supports her family financially by selling clothes. She purchases clothes from Lahore and sells to different clothes shops in the city. She has given birth to three daughters. All of them are very young and haven’t started their education yet. Eshrat is a very good mother and a housewife and does her household responsibilities very well. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah to improve her clothes-selling business. With the loan, she will buy clothes in bulk to offer more variety to her clients and to increase her monthly profits. She is hopeful that her business will improve further with the loan investment.  She is a new loan user and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Eshrat.

loans.use: To buy clothes to sell

loans.name: Juan Jose

texts.es:
Juan tiene  45 años de edad, es casado y reside junto a su familia en el distrito de Batangrande , una zona agrícola que se encuentra situada en el distrito de Ferreñafe  en la provincia de Lambayeque, en la región del mismo nombre, a más de treinta minutos  de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica al alquiler de motobombas de riego. El negocio tiene mucha acogida en la zona ya que ella es una de las pocas personas que brinda este servicio y además es bastante rentable, esta actividad la realiza hace 5 años. Los ingresos que percibe de esta actividad los utiliza para el sostenimiento de los gastos económicos de su familia.

El desea adquirir reparar su maquinaria para brindar mejor servicio, y ampliar su negocio, por ello a creído conveniente  solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 1000 nuevos soles con los cuales piensa lograr su objetivo.
texts.en:
Juan, 45, is married and lives with his family in Batangrande district, an agricultural area located in Ferreñafe province, more than 30 minutes from Chiclayo, the capital city of the Lambayeque region.

He makes a living renting motorized irrigation pumps. The business has been well-received in the area since he is one of the few people to offer this service. He has done this for 5 years, and it is quite profitable. The income he earns from this he uses to cover his family's household expenses. He wants to repair his machinery so he can offer better service and expand his business. Therefore, he thought it best to request a loan of 1000 soles from Edpyme Alternativa, with which he hopes to meet this goal.

loans.use: to repair his machinery

loans.name: Dario

texts.es:
Dario tiene 29 años de edad, es soltero y reside en el sector Calera, una zona rural que tiene como actividad principal a la agricultura y que se encuentra ubicada en el distrito de Reque, a cuarenta minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

Se dedica a trabajar en labores asociadas a la agricultura desde hace más de10 años, el cuenta con un pequeño terreno de cultivo con el que cuenta, adicionalmente ayuda a su madre a conducir el manejo de unos terrenos agrícolas de su propiedad.

Dario desea adquirir fertilizantes para brindar mantenimiento a su cultivo, con esta acción el espera obtener una buena cosecha. Por ello se ha visto en la necesidad de solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un crédito de 2000 nuevos soles.
texts.en:
Dario is 29 years old.  He is single and lives in Calera sector.  This is a rural area whose inhabitants mainly work in agriculture.  It is located in Reque district, forty minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Dario has been farming for more than 10 years.  He owns a small plot of farmland and also helps his mother to manage some farmland that she owns.

Dario would like to acquire fertilizers to maintain his crop.  In this way, he hopes to obtain a good harvest.  For this reason, he has requested a loan for 2,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: to buy fertilizers

loans.name: Bushra Perveen's Group

texts.en:
Bushra Perveen lives in a small city called Kasur, which is located near Lahore, Pakistan. Kasur is famous for its leather industry. She is 48 years old and has spent more than half of her life in Kasur. She lives there in the area of Kot Pakka Qilah in a two-room brick house. She is married to 60-year-old A. H. who sells manual mixers. The mixer is called chattu watta in the local language and is made of marble stone used to blend onions, pepper, ginger & garlic etc.  His business is going very well because it is a unique business.  Therefore, Bushra has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah because her husband wants to improve his business further. Through the loan, he will purchase mixers in a larger quantity. Bushra is sure that her husband’s business will improve further after making the loan investment and her family will be able to enjoy better living facilities as a result. She is a new loan applicant and this is her first loan application to Asasah. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a raised hand is Bushra Perveen.

loans.use: To buy manual mixers (chattu watta in local language) used to blend onions, pepper, ginger and garlic etc

loans.name: Susy

texts.es: La señora Susy tiene 38 años de edad es madre soltera y tiene 3 hijos que están  en edad escolar, se dedica a vender comida desde el año 2007 anteriormente le ayudaba a su madre y fue ella quien la motivo para que inicie un negocio de comida y genere mas ingresos que le permita cubrir los gastos de su familia, gana s/.100, el desafío que ella enfrenta es que vive en casa alquilada al lado de sus hijos paga alquiler y es una entrada menos para su familia, su sueño en un futuro es hacer crecer su negocio y con ello adquirir un local para  poner un restaurante y además de comprarse una casa para brindarle una mayor comodidad a sus hijos el dinero será invertido en comprar mesas, y los utensilios cucharas tenedores, menaje, ollas entre otras cosas y así poder otorgar un mejor servicio a sus clientes, Susi esta muy agradecida por el apoyo que se esta brindando.
texts.en:
Susy is 38 years old.  She is a single mother and has three school-age children.  She has been selling meals since 2007.  Before that, she used to help her mother and it was her mother who motivated her to start a food business and make more income which would allow her to cover her family expenses.  She earns 100 Peruvian soles.

The challenge that Susy faces is that she lives in a rental home with her children.  She pays rent and this means less money for her family.  Her dream for the future is to grow her business and acquire premises so that she can set up a restaurant and also buy a house so that she can make her children more comfortable.

Susy will invest her loan money in buying tables and utensils, spoons, forks, kitchenware, pans and other items so that she can provide a better service to her customers.  Susy is very grateful for the support that she is being given.

loans.use: to buy cooking utensils, tables, chairs, spoons, forks, etc.

loans.name: Abdul

texts.en:
This is 25-year-old Abdul S. K.. He is married, and has two children aged two and four years. He is very serious and dedicated.

In 2009, Abdul established his stationery business. Working six days a week and ten hours a day, he earns about 500,000 SLL every month.

Abdul would like a loan in the amount of 3,000,000 SLL to buy business stock such as cartons of ledger books, duplicating papers and exercise books. He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately 100,000 SLL.

In the future, Abdul plans to educate his children to university level, construct a house and buy a car. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy cartons of ledger books, duplicating papers and exercise books

loans.name: Nazeeran's Group

texts.en:
