Nazeeran lives in a small city in Punjab, Pakistan called kot radha kishen. Kot radha kishen is known for its dairy industry. She has been living there in the area of Usman town with her family in a two-room brick house for the past 20 years.  

She operates a business selling shawls (a clothing item used to cover the shoulders and arms) to share the financial burden with her husband. Her clientele base is her community and she sells a good number of shawls every month and generates income for the family.  She is married to M. Y. who sells sewing machines. He has been operating this business for the past 20 years and obtained a good reputation among his clients.  Nazeeran has given birth to a son and two daughters. All of them are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. Nazeeran is an uneducated lady but she wants her children to complete their education and become successful in their lives. 
 
She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her shawls-selling business. With the loan, she will buy a variety of different shawls such as embroidered and simple to sell to her clients and generate more income. Nazeeran is hopeful that after making an investment in her business, her business will improve and she will be able to provide better living facilities for her family as a result.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Nazeeran.   Also, the woman who is cutting vegetables does not belong to this group.

loans.use: To buy shawls (a clothing item used to cover the shoulders and arms)

loans.name: Rehana's Group

texts.en:
Rehana sells ready-made garments to support her family financially. She purchases them from Lahore, which is a big city in Pakistan. She visits Lahore once a month to buy the stock and then sells in her city for a profit. She started this business after the death of her husband a few years ago. 
She also prepares embroidered dresses for her neighborhood clients but her primary business is selling ready-made clothes. She is also a responsible mother. She takes care of her children and does her household work very well.  She has given birth to two sons and a daughter. Her eldest son works as a compounder in a medical clinic. Her remaining two children are enrolled in a local school and are getting their education. 

She has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her own business because she wants to improve it further. With the loan, she will buy ready-made garments in bulk that will not only cut the cost of travelling but also allow her to offer more variety to her clients to earn better profits. Rehana has good experience in her business. She hopes that she will be able to make her business more profitable after investing the loan in it. She is a resident of a small city called Kot Radha Kishen located in the Punjab province of Pakistan. She lives there in a three-room brick house with her family.  

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Rehana.

loans.use: To buy ready-made garments to sell

loans.name: Farhat's Group

texts.en:
Farhat, 46 years old, married A. R. and moved to Kot Radha Kishan 16 years ago. Kot Radha Kishan is a small city in Pakistan located in Punjab province and famous for its dairy industry. She lives there in the area of Usman town in a three-room brick house with her family. She is a housewife as well as a working lady. She stays at home and does her household work. She also operates her embroidery business at her home. She crafts beautiful embroidered designs on clothes which gets good acknowledgment from her community clients. 

Farhat is the mother of two sons. Both are young and getting their education by attending a local school. Her husband operates a milk and yogurt shop in the market. He never compromises on quality and that’s why he has a good number of clients who buys milk and yogurt from him regularly.  

Farhat has applied for a loan from Kiva partner Asasah for her husband who wants to improve his business. Using the loan, he will buy milk in larger quantity to make yogurt from it so he will be able to sell his products to many more customers and increase his monthly profits. 

Farhat is hopeful that by investing loan money into her husband’s business, her husband will be able to  increase his sales and profits which will help her family to have a better standard of living. She is a regular loan user of Asasah and this is her 3rd loan application. In previous loan years, she has maintained a good credit behavior and never missed any meeting. 

Note: In the photo, the lady with a book (called Asasah Passbook) is Farhat.

loans.use: To buy milk for milk & yogurt sales business.

loans.name: Virgilio

texts.es:
El solicitante es el señor Virgilio González de 47 años de edad, está  casado y tiene casa propia con todas las comodidades necesarias, es del Barrio  San Blas  de la ciudad de Encarnación, tiene 3 hijos, 2 de edad escolar y uno más pequeño.
El mismo es microempresario, propietario de una despensa y frutería, además de ofrecer servicios de electricidad; cuenta con 8 años de antigüedad  lo que le permite contar con muy buena clientela e ingresos.
Está solicitando el crédito para las compras de mercaderías como ser harina, aceite, azúcar yerba y otros productos traídos de  Argentina, pues posee mejores costos allí, lo que le deja un mayor margen de ganancia.
texts.en:
Virgilio González is 47 years old, married, and owns his own home which has all the basic comforts he needs.  He lives in San Blas neighborhood, in the city of Encarnación.  Virgilio has three children.  Two of his children are school age and one is not yet old enough for school.

Virgilio is a small businessman.  He owns a grocery store and fruit shop and also offers electricity services.  He has been in this line of work for 8 years which means that he has very good customers and income.

Virgilio is requesting a loan to buy merchandise such as flour, oil, sugar, yerba mate and other products from Argentina since he gets his goods for a better price there which gives him a better profit margin.

loans.use: to buy essentials, flour, oil, yerba mate, sugar, etc.

loans.name: Dora

texts.es:
La señora es soltera, tiene 56 años de edad, vive en la ciudad de Pilar, en el Barrio Villa Paso, tiene casa propia, donde posee las condiciones básicas para desarrollar sus actividades dentro del seno familiar y movilidad propia (moto).
Ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderías de primera necesidad como gaseosas y víveres. Desarrolla esta actividad desde hace como 4 años, posee la infraestructura necesaria para el correcto desarrollo por lo que su local es muy reconocido y visitado por los vecinos ya, además es una señora muy amable.
Solicita el crédito para invertir en la compra de víveres y agradece  la Fundación Paraguaya por el apoyo.
texts.en:
The lady is single and 56 years old.  She lives in the city of Pilar’s Villa Paso neighborhood.  She owns her house which has the basic conditions necessary for her to carry out activities within the family nucleus; she also has her own vehicle (motorcycle).

She sells groceries and soft drinks.  She’s been in this line of work for about 4 years.  She has the required infrastructure for correct development so her store is very well known and patronized by her neighbors; besides, she’s a very kind woman.

She is asking for the loan to buy groceries and thanks Fundación Paraguaya for the support.

loans.use: to buy groceries.

loans.name: San Vicente Group

texts.es:
El Comité de Mujeres Emprendedoras San Vicente es de la Ciudad de Villa Hayes-Chaco, Barrio Remancito. Actualmente se encuentran en el primer ciclo todas las integrantes. En su mayoría, las clientes se dedican a la  venta de escobas.
Gracias a Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva tienen el deseo de superarse cada vez más, y seguir avanzando más.
La sra. Laura Victoria es la miembro que más se dedica a la venta de escobas desde hace mucho tiempo, realiza dicho negocio de casa en casa, de manera ambulante,  a pesar de que es un trabajo muy sacrificado le genera ingresos, que aunque no son muchos, le permite vivir con decencia.
Todas las integrantes desean poder contar con el apoyo económico de los inversionistas, ya que sería difícil superarse sin dicha ayuda.
texts.en:
The Mujeres Emprendedoras San Vicente (San Vicente Enterprising Women) committee is from the Remancito neighborhood in Villa Hayes-Chaco.  Al the members are currently in their first cycle.  Most of the members are broom merchants.  Thanks to Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva they are driven to do better each time and to continue advancing more.

Laura Victoria is the member who is most dedicated to selling brooms; she’s been doing it for a long time.  The business is conducted door-to-door.  Despite it being very demanding work, it produces income, though not much, that allows her to live decently.  All the members hope to have support from investors because it would be very difficult to get ahead without such help.

loans.use: to buy brooms and cleaning supplies.

loans.name: Sudamerica Group

texts.es:
Las mujeres del presente comité son de la Compañia Tuyucua de la cuidad de Caacupé.
La Presidenta del comité es la Sra. Nancy V., ella se dedica a la artesanía en ñanduti, vive con su marido que es empleado y dos hijos estudiantes, la Sra. Nancy es una persona muy responsable y sacrificada, trabaja todos los días con una de sus hijas, quien le ayuda para hacer los tejidos de ñanduti, que semanalmente tiene que entregar. 
La Sra. Nancy trabaja directamente con una persona, quién es la que compra los tejidos de ella y los comercializa en la ciudad de Itagua.
Ella como todas sus compañeras del comité están muy contentas por el apoyo que les brinda la Fundación Paraguaya y Kiva para poder seguir invirtiendo en sus pequeños negocios.
texts.en:
The women in this committee are from Tuyucua in the city of Caacupé.  The group President is Mrs. Nancy V..  She is a ñanduti craftswoman (“ñanduti=spider web; typical Paraguayan lace).  She lives with her husband, who is employed, and her two student children.  

Nancy is a very responsible, dedicated woman.  She works every day with one of her daughters who helps her make the ñanduti lace which she has to deliver weekly.  Nancy works directly with a person who buys her lace and then sells it in the city of Itagua.  Like all her fellow members, she is happy for the support Fundación Paraguaya and Kiva provides to continue investing in their small businesses.

loans.use: to buy fabric, thread, handlooms, needles and notions.

loans.name: Isatu I

texts.en:
This is 43-year-old Isatu C.. She is married and has four children, aged 3, 6, 10 and 12 years. In 2001, Isatu established her essential drugs business. She began her business because she wanted to help her husband provide a livelihood for their family.  Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about 400,000 Sierra Leone leones (Le) every month from this business. 

She would like a loan in the amount of Le 3,000,000. Isatu requires a loan in order to buy essential drugs for her drug store. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 350,000. In the future, Isatu plans to buy larger quantities to supply to other traders, hire a sales person, and open another drug store. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy essential drugs for her drug store

loans.name: Mujeres Valientes Group

texts.es:
El comité se ha formado con la gestión de la señora Teodora C., quien formaba parte de un comité de la zona de km 9 Monday. Ella contactó con la Fundación Paraguaya para conformar el comité entre sus amigas y vecinas de la zona.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Valientes”. Las señoras tienen sus propios ingresos; algunas poseen despensa, cría de animales, venta de cosméticos, venta de ropas y otras se dedican como empleaD. doméstica.
Están en el Tercer Ciclo y está constituido por 10 integrantes; el grupo se destaca  en el barrio por ser muy unido y solidario. Las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, pretenden trabajar en conjunto en  la realización de actividades para recaudar fondos que puedan salvaguardar al comité en caso de necesidad.
La sra. Teodora se dedica a la venta de cosméticos por catálogo, pero como muchas veces los catálogos no le bastan para adquirir mayor cantidad de clientes, decidió poder comprar los productos y venderlos de manera directa, por eso necesita este crédito, para poder cumplir su objetivo, el cual es el de comprar cosméticos en grandes cantidades y obtener un mayor margen de ganancia. De este modo podrá mejorar su calidad de viD. y la de su familia.
Ella espera poder contar con el apoyo de Kiva mediante Fundación Paraguaya.
texts.en:
The committee came together thanks to Mrs. Teodora C.’s leadership.  She used to be a member of a committee in the Km.9 Monday zone.  She contacted Fundación Paraguaya to form a committee among her friends and neighbors in the area.

The committee is called “Mujeres Valientes” (Brave Women).  The women have their own income.  Some have grocery stores; others raise animals, sell cosmetics or clothes.  Others work as domestic employees.

They are in their third cycle and have 10 members.  The group stands out in the neighborhood for being very united and mutually supportive.  The members have strong entrepreneurial spirits and intend to work together carrying out their activities to raise funds that will safeguard the committee in case of need.

Teodora sells catalogue cosmetics.  However, because often the catalogues aren’t sufficient for her to acquire a larger number of customers, she decided to buy the products and sell them directly and this is why she needs this loan to reach her goal which is to buy large amounts of cosmetics in order to have a larger profit margin.  This way she’ll be able to improve her and her family’s quality of life.  She hopes to have Kiva support through Fundación Paraguaya.

loans.use: to buy cosmetics.

loans.name: Marta

texts.es:
La señora Marta vive en la ciudad de Pilar, tiene una casa propia, y vive con dignidad aunque no posee muchas comodidades, sólo las básicas.
Ella se dedica a la venta de víveres en general en su pequeña despensa, la cual se encuentra en la misma localidad que su hogar.
Se dedica a este negocio desde hace muchos años, le genera buenos ingresos, lo necesario como para vivir sin necesidades extremas, pero la vida es dura dice ella y trata de esmerarse cada día más para aumentar su clientela y la calidad de sus productos, por ello solicita el crédito, para invertir en la compra de víveres, panificados y bebidas en mayor cantidad y mejor calidad, de modo que obtenga su meta, la cual es mejorar su reconocimiento de servicio en la comunidad.
texts.en:
Marta lives in the city of Pilar.  She owns her house and lives with dignity despite having only the basics.  She sells groceries in general in her small store located in the same location as her home.

She’s been in business for many years and it generates her own income which is enough to live as long as need isn’t extreme.  But life is hard and she tries hard every day to increase her customer base and the quality of her products.  This is why she’s asking for a loan in order to buy groceries, baked goods and beverages in larger amounts and better quality to reach her goal which is to improve her service profile in the community.

loans.use: to buy baked goods, beverages and groceries in general.

loans.name: Candelaria

texts.es:
La Sra. Candelaria A., de 38 años de edad, está casada  hace 6 años con el señor Reinaldo Oviedo de 39 años de edad, pero como pareja ya tienen mas de veinte años viviendo juntos, la pareja tiene 4 hijos de 17, 12, 10 años y el último de 6 meses, la mayor está cursando el 2do. año de peluquería, carrera que siguió después de terminar el noveno grado, los demás están en el colegio aún.
La señora Candelaria tiene este negocio, el de realizar masas dulces, desde hace 9 años , empezaron con un pequeño ahorro y actualmente han crecido bastante en el comercio, cuentan con más clientes y siempre es ayudada por su esposo e hijos,  también gracias a esto sus hijos están estudiando y en el futuro desean que puedan terminar una carrera universitaria.
Solicita este préstamo para la  compra de harina, miel, azucar, condimentos y otros que serán utilizados en la producción de masitas, bollos, pastafrola, tortas, boquerón y otras masas dulces (postres), para asi poder cumplir con todos los pedidos que tiene.
texts.en:
Mrs. Candelaria A., 38, has been married to Mr. Reinaldo Oviedo, 39, for the last six years but they’ve been a couple living together for over 20 years.  They have four children who are 17, 12, and 10 years old; the baby is 6 months old.  Their oldest is in the second year of barber school, a career he’s been studying since finishing 9th grade; the others are still in school.

Candelaria has this business: she’s made sweet cookies and pastries for the last 9 years.  They started out with a small amount of savings and have grown quite a bit in the business.  They have more customers now and she’s always assisted by her husband and children.  Thanks to this, her children are studying and in the future they want to finish university careers.

She is asking for this loan to buy flour, honey, sugar, condiments and other items that will be used in making the cookies, rolls, pie dough, cakes, Boquerón (typical Paraguayan sweet bread) and other pastry dough (desserts) to fill all her pending orders.

loans.use: to buy flour, honey, sugar, baking supplies and other merchandise.

loans.name: Isata M

texts.en:
This is 35 year-old Isata J., who is married and has four children aged 4, 7, 9, and 15 years. In 2001, Isata established her imported assorted foodstuff business in order to generate income and help her husband provide for their family. Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, she earns about Le 350,000 every month from this business.

She is now requesting a loan of Le 4,000,000 to buy more imported foodstuffs for her enterprise. She hopes that this loan will enable her to increase her monthly profits by approximately Le 400,000. In the future, Isata plans to buy larger quantities to supply other traders, open another food stall, and generate enough income to educate her children to the university level. She thanks you for your support.

loans.use: to buy various imported foodstuffs for her business.

loans.name: Dulce Esperanza Group

texts.es:
El comité “Dulce Esperanza” se formó con la unión de varias vecinas de la ciudad de Mariano Roque Alonso.
Todas las integrantes del comité desarrollan actividades independientes  ,  como son las ventas, preparación de comidas rápidas, modista etc.
Las integrantes formaron un grupo muy unido y capaz de realizar conjuntamente actividades que fortalecen su compañerismo. 
La Señora Maria C. es una de las integrantes del comité, ella se dedica a la venta de mercaderías comestibles  para poder mantener a sus sobrinos, que quedaron sin mamá (huérfanos) siendo muy pequeños.
Es una señora muy trabajadora y joven. Ella no tiene hijos y su marido es electricista. Además se encuentra muy satisfecha con su actividad y las capacitaciones que recibe el grupo.
La señora Maria solicita el crédito para la compra de mas variedad y cantidad de viveres.
texts.en:
The “Dulce Esperanza” (Sweet Hope) committee was formed when several neighbors from the city of Mariano Roque Alonso joined together.  All the committee members carry out independent activities like: sales, fast food preparation, dressmaking, etc.  The members formed a very united group that’s able to carry out activities together that strengthen their companionship.

Mrs. María Centurión is one of the members.  She sells foodstuffs to support her nieces and nephews who were left motherless (orphans) at a very young age.  

She is a very hard working young woman.  She does not have any children of her own and her husband’s an Electrician.  She is very satisfied with her activity and with the training the group gets.  

María is asking for the loan to buy a greater variety and amount of groceries.

loans.use: to buy more groceries.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy local food for her market

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: To buy raw materials to produce gara clothing

loans.name: Mujeres Vencedoras Group

texts.es:
El comité fue formado gracias a la gestión de la señora Teresa Dávalos, integrante del comité Virgen de Fátima, domiciliada en el km 16 Acaray de Minga Guazú, Ciudad del Este, quien tiene muchas conocidas en la zona del km 22 de dicha ciudad, con quienes contactó para formar el comité en esa localidad.
El comité se denomina “Mujeres Vencedoras”, están en el Primer Ciclo con 12  integrantes. Es un grupo conformado por personas muy unidas, solidarias y responsables, las integrantes poseen un gran espíritu emprendedor, por lo que se comprometen en cumplir con cabalidad los compromisos asumidos con la Fundación;  desean realizar actividades de recaudación de fondos para ayudarse mutuamente. 
La sra.  María del Pilar se dedica a la venta de ropas, como Ciudad del Este es una ciudad comercial por excelencia, ella posee muchos clientes pero también mucha competencia, por eso dfesea poder comprar ropas de otoño – invierno para poder ofrecer las mejores prendas a sus consumidores.
Es una mujer con ganas de superarse y ofrecer una mejor calidad de vida a su familia, en especial a sus hijos, demostrándoles que con esfuerzo todo se puede lograr.
texts.en:
The committee was formed thanks to the initiative of Mrs. Teresa Dávalos, a member of the Virgen de Fátima committee, located in Kilometer 16 Acaray de Minga Guazú, Ciudad del Este.  She has a lot of acquaintances in the Kilometer 22 zone of this city that she gathered together to form a committee in this location.

It’s called “Mujeres Vencedoras” (Triumphant Women) and they are in their first cycle with 12 members.  The group consists of very united, mutually supportive and responsible people.  They have a strong enterprising spirit and are committed to meet the responsibilities they’ve taken on with the Fundación.  They want to carry out fund raising activities to help each other out.

Mrs. María del Pilar sells clothing.  Because Ciudad del Este is a commercial city of note, she has many customers but also much competition.  Because of this she wants to buy fall-winter clothes in order to offer the best items to her consumers.

She is a woman with a desire to de better and provide a better quality of life for her family, especially her children, showing them that everything can be attained with effort.

loans.use: to buy fall-winter clothing.

loans.name: Santa Isabel Group

texts.es:
El comité Santa Isabel es de la zona de San Ramon, ciudad de San Lorenzo, las señoras se dedican a diversas actividades. Son todas señoras con antigüedad en la Fundacion Paraguaya, desde hace más de 5 años que están obteniendo créditos y nunca tuvieron atrasos gracias a todas las señoras que son muy pagadoras y responsables.
La sra. Lorenza se dedica a la venta de ropas interiores, en especial de la línea Kalúa, una marca muy popular y de buena calidad en Latinoamerica.
Ella es muy humilde y este negocio le permite obtener ingresos económicos considerables, Lorenza espera poder contar con el apoyo de los inversionistas de Kiva para poder comprar más ropas interiores, teniendo en cuenta que a mayor cantidad de productos menor es el costo al pagarlos (comercio al por mayor), y cuando los revende obtiene mayor cantidad de ganancias (comercio al por menor).
texts.en:
The Santa Isabel committee is in San Ramón neighborhood in the city of San Lorenzo.  The women are in a variety of activities.  They’re all long-standing clients of Fundación Paraguaya; they’ve been getting loans for over five years and have never been late with their repayments because all the women are responsible and punctual payers.

Lorenza sells underwear, especially of the Kalúa brand, a very popular, high quality brand in Latin America. She is very humble and this business allows her to earn considerable income.  

Lorenza hopes to have support from Kiva lenders to buy more underwear keeping in mind that the larger the amount bought, the lower the cost (wholesale commerce) and when she resells them her profits are higher (retail sales).

loans.use: to buy underwear.

loans.name: Abu Bakarr

texts.en:
This is 41-year-old Abu Bakarr K.. He is married, and has two children aged 10 and 25 years. 

In 2008, Abu established his chair-upholstering business. He began his business because he needed to generate income to support his family. 

Working six days a week and 10 hours a day, he earns about SLL 700,000 every month from this business. He would like a loan in the amount of  SLL 3,000,000. Abu has already received and successfully repaid one loan and now requires this new loan in order to add more stock to his business for more profit. 

He hopes that this loan will enable him to increase his monthly profits by approximately SLL 300,000. 

In the future, Abu Bakarr K. plans to educate his children to university level and open another shop. He thanks you for your support.

loans.use: To buy upholstery materials

loans.name: Bendicion Group

texts.es:
El comité Bendición se creó desde hace más de dos años mediante la gestión y el apoyo de otro comité que se encontraba trabajando en dicho lugar.
Este comité es de San Lorenzo y en estos más de dos años de intenso trabajo han crecido tanto social como económicamente, son reconocidas en el lugar como mujeres muy trabajadoras. 
La sra. Ceferina se dedica a la venta de frutas, posee una pequeña frutería donde trata de proveer de los mejores frutos a todas las personas que deseen ser sus clientes, para ella la calidad es la clave del éxito, por ello trata de que sus productos se encuentren en excelentes condiciones para la venta y el consumo.
Ella, como las demás integrantes se preocupan mucho por el bienestar de sus familias, y desean el crédito para poder adquirir mayor cantidad de mercaderías, en este caso la sra. Ceferina desea poder comprar más frutas para ofrecer, pues la demanda es mucha y desea poder satisfacer las necesidades de sus clientes.
texts.en:
The Bendición (Blessing) committee was created more than two years ago through the leadership and support of another committee that worked in the same region. The members of the committee are from San Lorenzo, and in more than two years of very hard work they have grown socially as well as economically. They are known throughout the area as very hardworking women.

Sra. Ceferina sells fruit from a small fruit stand where she tries to sell high quality fruit to all her customers. In her opinion, this is the key to her success. Her goal is to have fruit in excellent condition for both selling and eating. 

Like the other members, Ceferina is concerned about the wellbeing of her family. They all want to use their loan to buy more merchandise. Ceferina, for example, wishes to buy more fruit because the demand is there and she wants to satisfy the needs of her customers.

loans.use: to buy citrus fruit like pineapples, oranges, grapefruit, etc.

loans.name: Anonymous
loans.use: to buy more drinks, batteries and sweets

loans.name: Marisol

texts.es:
Marisol tiene 31 años de edad, es casada y tiene 2 hijos.  Reside junto a su familia en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza de ganado ovino y aves de corral como pavos y gallinas. Ella engorda a su ganado para luego comercializarlos en el mercado local.  Esta actividad la realizan desde hace más de 4 años en la parte posterior de su casa, donde tiene corrales acondicionados para esta actividad.  Los ingresos que percibe le sirve para cubrir los gsatos de su familia. 

Marisol anhela que su ganado alcance el peso y tamaño adecuado para venderlo, con los ingresos comprar más ganado y engordarlo.  Sin duda lo logrará, es sabido que los pobladores de Tambogrande son gente emprendedora y pujante.  Para lograr su objetivo, Marisol ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
31-year old Marisol is married and has two children. She lives with her family in the agricultural area of Tambogrande in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.

Marisol earns her living by raising sheep and poultry such as turkeys and chickens. Once they are fattened, she sells them in the local market. She’s been doing this work for more than four years at the back of her house where there are pens specially made for this purpose. The money she earns pays for the household expenses.

Marisol’s greatest wish is for her livestock to reach the best weight and size possible before she sells them. With the income she will buy more animals to fatten. There’s no doubt that she will succeed, as the inhabitants of Tambogrande are known for their entrepreneurial and vigorous spirit. To achieve her goal, Marisol has asked Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles.

loans.use: to buy nutritious animal feed

loans.name: Socorro

texts.es:
Socorro tiene 56 años D. edad, es casada y no tiene hijos a su cargo. Vive en casa propia con su esposo, dicha casa está ubicada en el Distrito D. Chulucanas, perteneciente a la región Piura, a 4 horas D. la ciudad D. Chiclayo, capital del departamento D. Lambayeque.

Se dedica a la crianza la crianza D. ganado ovino, esta actividad la realiza desD. hace más D. 3 años. Cuenta con corrales apropiados y espaciosos. Los ovinos cuando alcanzan tamaño y peso ideal los comercializa en el mercado local.
El esposo D. Socorro trabaja en la parcela que tienen en común, la cual ha sido heredada.

Socorro anhela que su ganado alcance el peso y tamaño adecuado para venderlo, con los ingresos comprar más ganado y engordarlo.  Sin duda lo logrará, es sabido que los pobladores D. esa localidad son gente emprendedora y pujante.  Para lograr su objetivo, Socorro ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo D. 1500 nuevos soles D. Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
56-year old Socorro is married and doesn’t have the responsibility of children to look after. She and her husband live in their own house located in Chulucanas District, in the region of Piura, more than four hours from the town of Chiclayo, the capital of Lambayeque region.
 
Socorro has raised sheep for more than three years. She has specially built, large pens for the animals. Once the sheep have reached an ideal size and weight, she sells them in the local market. Her husband also works on the same plot of land that they inherited. 
 
Her greatest wish is for her livestock to reach the best weight and size possible before she sells them. With the income she will buy more animals to fatten. There’s no doubt that she will succeed, as the inhabitants here are known for their entrepreneurial and vigorous spirit. To achieve her goal, Socorro has asked Kiva partner Edpyme Alternativa for a loan of 1500 soles.

loans.use: to buy nutritious animal feed

loans.name: Rafael

texts.es:
Rafael tiene 24 años de edad, es soltero y vive con sus padres en el distrito agrícola de Tambogrande, una zona agrícola situada en la región Piura, a más de cuatro horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital de la región Lambayeque.  Tambogrande es un lugar que se caracteriza por sus deseos de superarse 


Rafael  dedica al servicio de mototaxi, que es un vehículo que consiste en una moto y una cabina para transportar personas.  Su unidad está en buen estado y operativa, pero es necesario hacerle mantenimiento para mantener esta operatividad. Con los ingresos que percibe cubre sus gastos personales y los de sus padres.

Rafael necesita darle mantenimiento a su unidad móvil, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles en Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Rafael, 24, is single living with his parents in the farming Tambogrande District, a farming area located in Piura Region over four hours from the city of Chiclayo, Lambayeque Region’s capital.  Tambogrande is a place that’s noted for their desire to improve.

Rafael provides mototaxi transport services; this is a vehicle consisting of a motorcycle with an attached passenger transport cabin.  His vehicle is in good working order but to keep it this way maintenance is required.  Income he earns cover his personal expenses as well as his parents’.

Rafael needs to provide maintenance for his vehicle and this is why he’s asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 1500 new sol loan.

loans.use: to provive vehicle maintenance.

loans.name: Yolanda

texts.es:
Yolanda tiene 42  años, es casada,  vive en casa propia y tiene 03 hijos. Cliente vive en   un caserío, ubicado a 10 minutos de la ciudad de Lambayeque.  La provincia de Lambayeque se encuentra a 20 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo.

La actividad que realiza Yolanda es la crianza y venta de animales, los cuales negocia quincenalmente en los  mercados de Chiclayo y Lambayeque. Rafael cría sus animales en corrales ubicados en la parte exterior de su domicilio.
Los ingresos que percibe le sirve para cubrir los gastos de su familia. Su esposo se dedica a la agricultura.

Yolanda desea comprar alimento balanceado para sus animales.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un crédito de 500 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
Yolanda, 42, is married and lives in her own house; she has three children.  She lives in a hamlet located ten minutes from the city of Lambayeque.  Lambayeque Province is located 20 minutes from the city of Chiclayo.

Yolanda raises animals that she sells biweekly at the Chiclayo and Lambayeque markets.  She raises the animals in corrals located in her back yard.
Income is used to cover family expenses.  Her husband is a farmer.

Yolanda wants to buy nutritionally balanced feed for her animals so she has asked Edpyme Alternativa for a 500 new sol loan to do so.

loans.use: to buy nutritionally balanced animal feed.

loans.name: Yaneth Del Milagro

texts.es:
Yaneth tiene 27 años de edad, conviviente con 1 hijo a cargo. Vive en casa de padres. La cual está ubicada en el Caserio Chacupe Bajo, el cual es un caserío pequeño rural que pertenece al distrito de La Victoria, en la provincia de Chiclayo.. Pero aun no tiene servicios (agua y luz). Sus actividades principales en dicho caserío son lla agricultura ,  crianza de animales de engorde y actividades artesanales.

Yaneth se dedica a la confección de sombreros de palma, los cuales son vendidos a turistas y comerciantes mayoristas de artesanía en Monsefú, Tiene más de 15 años en dicha actividad, también realiza actividades agrícolas como obrera.  Los ingresos que percibe los utiliza para los gastos de su familia.

Yaneth quiere comprar útiles escolares, palma  y otros materiales para confección  de sombreros.  Es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 300 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.  El dinero lo quiere utilizar sobre todo para ayudar a su hijo  con los implementos necesarios para  su educación.
texts.en:
Yaneth is 27 years old, lives with her partner, and has one child in her care.  She lives in her parents' home which is located in the village of Chacupe Bajo: a small rural village in La Victoria district, in Chiclayo province.  The village still does not have access to basic services (water and electricity).  The main business activities carried out in the village are farming, livestock raising and making handicrafts.

Yaneth makes palm leaf hats which are sold to tourists and craft wholesalers in Monsefú.  She has been in this line of work for more than 15 years.  She also works as a laborer, doing farm work.  She uses the income that she makes to cover her family's expenses.

Yaneth would like to buy school supplies as well as palm leaf and other materials for making hats.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 300 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  She would like to use the money, above all, to help provide her son with the tools he needs for his education.

loans.use: to buy materials and to cover her son's school expenses

loans.name: Maria De La Cruz

texts.es:
María De La Cruz tiene 65 años de edad, es casada y con su familia en casa propia en el distrito de Mochumí, pertenenciente a la provincia de Lambayeque. Está ubicado a 35 minutos de la ciudad de Chiclayo, capital del departamento de Lambayeque.

María De La Cruz se dedica a labores ligadas a la agricultura.  Actualmente tiene cultivos de maíz, el cual una vez cosechado lo vende en el mercado de Moshoqueque, el cual es muy concurrido ya que es un mercado mayorista.  Los ingresos que percibe los invierte en su familia.

María De La Cruz desea comprar abono y fertilizantes para sus terrenos de cultivo, es por ello que ha creído conveniente obtener un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles de Edpyme Alternativa.
texts.en:
María De La Cruz is 65 years old, married, and lives with her family in their own home in the district of Mochumí - part of the Lambayeque province - located 35 minutes from the province's capital city of Chiclayo.

María De La Cruz works very hard in agriculture. At the moment she is growing corn and, once it's been harvested, she sells it on the the well-attended, wholesaler market in Moshoqueque. The income earned is spent on her family.

María De La Cruz wishes to purchase manure and fertilisers, so she thought it appropriate to apply for loan of 2000 Nuevos Soles from Edpyme Alternativa.

loans.use: For the purchase of fertilisers

loans.name: Rosemarie

texts.en:
Rosemarie V. is from the town of Qurino, Calamagui 1st, Ilagan, Isabela. She is 33 years old. Rosemarie is married and has one infant child. 

To make a living, Rosemarie owns and operates a general store. Rosemarie has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 8,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rosemarie joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rosemarie is requesting a loan of 25,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Rosemarie from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Marcelina

texts.en:
Marcelina J., from the village of Sinama, is 58 years old, married, and has four school-aged children. To make a living, Marcelina has been planting and harvesting corn for sale for over 28 years, earning approximately 20,000 PHP a month.

In 2008, Marcelina joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Having repaid her previous loan of 35,000 PHP from ASKI that was used to purchase additional seeds, seedlings and young crops to grow, she is now requesting her eighth loan of 50000 PHP to purchase fertilizers such as manure. Marcelina plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family.

About ASKI:

ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolks and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva. Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase fertilizers such as manure

loans.name: Dominga's Group

texts.en:
Dominga B. is from the village of Catabban. She is 45 years old. Dominga is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Dominga B.'s Group.

Dominga is married and has three school-aged children. To make a living, Dominga owns and operates a furniture-making business. Dominga has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 7,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Dominga joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Dominga has successfully repaid a previous loan of 25,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. 

Dominga is requesting a new loan of 20,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture. This will be the 11th loan taken out by Dominga from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to pay the tuition fees of her children. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw materials to make additional furniture

loans.name: Andrea's Group

texts.en:
Andrea N. is from the village of Dalig Viejo. She is 52 years old. Andrea is the leader of a six-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Andrea N.'s Group.

Andrea is married. To make a living, Andrea owns and operates a tricycle transport service. (A tricycle is a motorcycle with an attached passenger cab.) Andrea has been engaged in her business for over 11 years and earns approximately 5,000 PHP a month.

In 2007, Andrea joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Andrea has successfully repaid a previous loan of 18,000 PHP from ASKI. This previous loan was used to purchase tires and other accessories. 

Andrea is requesting a new loan of 7,000 PHP, which will be used to repair her vehicle for better service. This will be the eighth loan taken out by Andrea from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve the general living conditions of her family. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to repair her existing vehicle for better service

loans.name: Rosa Angelica

texts.es: Rosa tiene 38 años de edad y es soltera. Vive con su hija de 17 años de edad quien la ayuda con su negocio. Vive en casa de un familiar, la cual está ubicada en el distrito de José Leonardo Ortiz, uno de los más grandes distritos de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Su comunidad es urbana y cuenta con los servicios básicos de agua y luz. Desde hace muchos años, Rosa se dedica a la comercialización de juguetes y otros accesorios para niños. Además comenzó a vender productos de belleza y salud desde hace mas de 1 año y medio. Solicita un crédito para destinarlo a la compra de más juguetes para vender a sus clientes. Rosa es muy conocida en la zona y cuenta con una clientela ya establecida. Ha manejado otros préstamos y los canceló de manera puntual. Con la ayuda de sus préstamos, han mejorada sus ingresos mensuales por ahora cuenta con más mercadería a vender. Rosa les agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por su ayudar en seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en:
Rosa is 38 years old and single.  She lives with her 17 year-old daughter who helps her with her business.  Rosa lives in a family member's home which is located in José Leonardo Ortiz district, one of the biggest districts in the city of Chiclayo.  Her community is an urban community which has access to basic services of water and electricity.

For many years, Rosa has been selling toys and other children's accessories.  She also started selling beauty and health products more than one and a half years ago.  She is requesting this loan to buy more toys to sell to her customers.  Rosa is very well known in her area and she has an established customer base.  She has received previous loans and paid them back punctually.  With the help of her loans, she has improved her monthly income and she now has more merchandise to sell.  Rosa is grateful to Kiva lenders for helping her to continue growing in her business.

loans.use: to buy more toys to sell

loans.name: Alberto's Group

texts.en:
Alberto R. is from the village of Bacnor East. He is 33 years old. Alberto is the leader of a five-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Alberto R.'s Group.

Alberto is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Alberto makes and sells food, primarily barbecue pork and chicken. Alberto has been engaged in his business for over 11 years and earns approximately 4,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Alberto joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve his business and living situation. Alberto is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional products to sell. This will be the first loan taken out by Alberto from ASKI. He plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand his business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products to sell

loans.name: Maria Ignacia

texts.es: Maria tiene 49 años de edad. Vive con su esposo quien trabaja como chofer de taxi. Tienen dos hijos de 11 y 12 años de edad. Residen en el distrito de San José, unos 15 minutos de la provincia de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Esta pequeña comunidad se dedica principalmente a la agricultura y ganadería. Desde hace 25 años, se dedica al servicio de costura en su domicilio. Cuenta con una máquina de costura. Brinda un servicio profesional y de alta calidad, por lo que es muy conocida en la zona. Su instrumento de trabajo ha sufrido un desperfecto, por lo que está solicitando un crédito para repararlo. De esa manera, podrá seguir apoyando con su servicio a la comunidad. Su más grande sueño es tener un taller de confecciones y dar trabajo a sus vecinos. Esté es su primer crédito con Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) y agradece a los prestamistas de Kiva por la oportunidad brindada a ella a seguir creciendo su negocio.
texts.en: Maria is 49 years old. She lives with her husband who works as a taxi driver. They have two children who are 11 and 12 years old. They live in the San Jose district, some 15 minutes from the province of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. This little community is primarily agricultural and livestock-raising. For 25 years, she has been making clothes from her home. She has a sewing machine. She offers a professional, high-quality service, and so she is well known in the area. Her work tool has been damaged, and she is requesting a loan in order to repair it. In this way, she will be able to keep offering her service to the community. Her biggest dream is to have a tailoring workshop and to be able to give work to her neighbors. This is her first loan from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) and she is grateful to the Kiva lenders for the opportunity offered to her to keep growing her business.

loans.use: to fix her sewing machine so she can keep serving her customers.

loans.name: Blanca Betty

texts.es: Blanca tiene 49 años de edad. Vive en hogar estable con su esposo y sus 02 hijos en el distrito de Las Lomas, una zona agrícola situada en la provincia de Piura, unas 4 horas de la ciudad de Chiclayo, la capital de la región de Lambayeque. Blanca se dedica a la agricultura, contando con un terreno que su esposo recibió en herencia de sus difuntos padres. El cultivo que tiene es mango y maracuyá, la cual está por abonarse y a la fecha está con buen desarrollo y vigor. Cosecha su cultivo semanalmante. Su esposo es profesor nombrado y con su sueldo cubre obligaciones familiares y crediticias. Blanca solicita un crédito para la compra de fertilizantes para su maracuyá y también para labores de control de plagas de su cultivo. Con esta inversión, podrá asegurar una buena producción de su cultivo. Por ello, Blanca solicita un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). Posee muy buenas referencias laborales y personales de sus vecinos y conocidos.
texts.en: Blanca is 49 years old. She lives in a stable home with her husband and their 2 children in the district of Las Lomas, an agricutural zone in the province of Piura, some 4 hours from the city of Chiclayo, the capital of the Lambayeque region. Blanca works in agriculture, and has some land that her husband inherited from his parents. She has crops of mango and passion fruit, which are fertilized and currently in good growth and vigorous. She harvests her crops weekly. Her husband is a teacher and his salary covers the family obligations and credit. Blanca is requesting a loan to buy fertilizers for her passion fruit and also to keep pests from her crops. With this loan, she will be able to ensure a good harvest. For this reason, Blanca is requesting $550  from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). She has good work and personal references from her neighbors and others who know her.

loans.use: to by fertilizer for her passion fruit crop

loans.name: Henrry Augusto

texts.es: Henrry tiene 27 años de edad. Vive con su pareja y 1 hijo en un caserío cerca de Olmos, una zona agrícola bastante comercial que pertenece a la provincia de Lambayeque y se encuentra situada a más de una hora y media de la ciudad de Chiclayo. Se dedica a la crianza y comercialización de ganado ovino y caprino. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 08 años, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuando sus animales ya han alcanzado un buen tamaño y peso, los vende a los negociantes que suelen visitar las zonas. Cuentan con clientela ya establecida en la zona. Henrry solicita un préstamo para comprar más animales y alimento balanceado. Con esta inversión, podrá aumentar sus ingresos  mejor cubrir sus gastos familiares.
texts.en: Henrry is 27 years old. He lives with his partner and 1 son in a hamlet near to Olmos, a quite commercial agricultural area in the province of Lambayeque, which is located more than an hour and a half from the city of Chiclayo. He works raising and selling sheep and goats. He has been doing this for 8 years, and he knows perfectly how to do it. When his animals reach a good size and weight, he sells them to the middlemen who often visit the area. He has established customers in the area. Henrry is requesting a loan to buy more animals and livestock feed. With this loan, he will be able to increase his income and better cover the family expenses.

loans.use: to buy more animals and livestock feed.

loans.name: Maria Teresa

texts.es: Maria tiene 47 años de edad. Es soltera y tiene hijos adultos e independientes. Vive en casa propia que ha ido arreglando de a pocos en el distrito de Ferreñafe en el norte de Perú.  Se dedica a la venta de especerías y condimentos  en el mercado central de Ferreñafe.  Tiene una experiencia de más de 05 años en el negocio. Trabaja todos los días en el mercado y cuenta con una clientela fiel y establecida. Desea aumentar su mercadería y comprar más especias para vender. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa un préstamo de 1500 nuevos soles. Espera usar sus ingresos para seguir arreglando y mejorando su casa.
texts.en: Maria is 47 years old. She is single and has adult children. She lives in her own home, which she has gradually been fixing up, in the district of Ferrenafe in the north of Peru. She works selling spices and condiments in the central market of Ferrenafe. She has more than 5 years experience in this business. She works in the market every day and has a loyal and established clientele. She wants to increase her supplies and buy more spices to sell. For this reason, she has seen fit to request a loan of $550 from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). She hopes to use her income to keep fixing-up and improving her house.

loans.use: to buy more supplies of spices and condiments to sell

loans.name: Asuncion

texts.es:
Asuncion tiene 59  años de edad, y es casado. Tiene 2 hijos menores. Vive en casa propia en la zona rural del distrito de Tucume en la región del Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Cuenta con el servicio básico de agua solamente,  no de energía eléctrica. Su comunidad es pequeña con un aproximado de 50 familias.

Se gana la vida desde hace 20  años criando y vendiendo animales menores en corrales ubicados en la parte posterior de su domicilio. El suele criar ganado porcino, ovino y pavos y patos y cuando estos ya han alcanzado un buen punto de desarrollo las ofrece en venta a los negociantes que siempre visitan la zona en donde vive. Aprendió esta actividad de sus padres, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro.  Desea usar su crédito para invertir en la compra de aves menores para engorde y alimento balanceado para sus animales. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar a Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner) un préstamo de 2000 nuevos soles. Espera aumentar sus ingresos para poder seguir ofreciendo una mejor calidad de vida a su familia.
texts.en:
Asuncion is 59 years old and is married. He has 2 small children. He lives in his own home in the rural district of Tucume in the Lambayeque region in the north of Peru. The only home utility he receives is water - he does not have electrical supply. His community is small, with about 50 families living there. 
For 20 years, he has been earning a living raising and selling young animals in corrals located in the back part of his home. He typically raises pigs, sheep, turkeys, and ducks, and when they have reached a good point of development he offers them for sale to the middlemen who always visit the area where he lives. He learned this work from his parents, and he knows exactly how to do it. He wants to use the loan to buy some young birds to fatten-up and feed for his animals. For this reason, he has seen fit to request a loan of $725 from Edpyme Alternativa (Kiva Field Partner). He hopes to increase his income to be able to offer a better quality of live to his family.

loans.use: to buy more baby birds to fatten and feed for his livestock

loans.name: Jessica Milagros

texts.es: Jessica tiene 26 años de edad y es soltera sin hijos. Vive en casa de abuelos en la parte rural del distrito de Lambayeque en el norte de Perú. Gana la vida vendiendo productos de belleza y salud. También ofrece el servicio de locutorio en el cual sus clientes pueden usar sus teléfonos para hacer llamadas tanto nacionales como extranjeras. Esta actividad la realiza desde hace 1 año en su domicilio, es decir conoce a la perfección el rubro. Cuenta con clientela ya establecida en la zona. El destino del crédito será para la compra de una caja de instalación y chips de teléfonos para el normal funcionamiento del locutorio. Por ello, ha creído conveniente solicitar un préstamo de 1000 nuevos soles a Edpyme Alternativa. Con esta inversión, podrá ofrecer un mejor servicio a sus clientes y aumentar sus ingresos.
texts.en:
Jessica is 26 years old, single, and doesn't have any children.  She lives in her grandparents' home in the rural part of Lambayeque district, in the north of Peru.

Jessica earns a living selling beauty and health products.  She also offers a 'locutorio' service where people use her telephones to make both national and international calls.  She has been running this business from her home for one year.  She knows the business very well and already has an established customer base in her area.

Jessica will use her loan to buy an installation box and telephone chips for her establishment.  For this reason, she has requested a loan for 1,000 Peruvian soles from Edpyme Alternativa.  As a result of this investment, she will be able to offer a better service to her customers and increase her income.

loans.use: to buy equipment and more telephone chips for her 'locutorio' (an establishment that provides phones for public use)

loans.name: Rowena's Group

texts.en:
Rowena N. is from the village of San Pedro. She is 24 years old. Rowena is the leader of a seven-member group loan offered by ASKI. While each member of the group receives an individual loan, they are all collectively responsible for paying back the loans of their fellow group members if someone is delinquent or defaults. The official name of this borrowing group is Rowena N. Group.

Rowena is married and has two infant children. To make a living, Rowena prepares and sells barbecue pork and chicken. Rowena has been engaged in her business for over a year and earns approximately 3,000 PHP a month.

In 2011, Rowena joined ASKI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Rowena is requesting a loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale. This will be the first loan taken out by Rowena from ASKI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About ASKI:
ASKI is one of the most successful microfinance institutions in the Philippines. It has 38 branches covering the Central and Northeastern areas. Its clients are mostly farmers, fisherfolk and small entrepreneurs.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, Kiva created this template for our Field Partner to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase raw ingredients needed to make products for sale

loans.name: Zenith

texts.en:
Zenith C. is from the village of Poblacion, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 36 years old. Zenith is married and has six school-aged children. 

To make a living, Zenith owns and operates a mini-restaurant, serving a variety of meals like caldereta, afritada, adobo and bulalo to local customers. Zenith has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 10,000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Zenith joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her business and living situation. Zenith has successfully repaid a previous loan of 11,000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to to purchase additional ingredients and for working capital. 

Zenith is requesting a new loan of 14,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices and vegetables. This will be the fourth loan taken out by Zenith from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the loan to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:
HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional ingredients like meat, spices and vegetables

loans.name: Wilma

texts.en:
Wilma M. is from the village of Minongan, Quezon, Bukidnon. She is 46 years old and widowed, with 4 adult-aged children. To make a living, Wilma  runs a sari-sari (variety) store, where she sells canned goods, snack foods, beverages, shampoo, soap and biscuits. Wilma has been engaged in her business for more than 11 years and earns approximately 10000 PHP a month.

In 2009, Wilma joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Wilma has successfully repaid a previous loan of 12000 PHP from HSPFI. This previous loan was used to purchase additional inventory and as working capital. Wilma is requesting a new loan of 15000 PHP,  which will be used to purchase additional products such as canned goods, beverages and instant noodles. This loan will be the fifth loan taken out by Wilma from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business. 

About HSPFI:

HSPFI is an accredited partner of Opportunity International in the Philippines. It is based in Cagayan de Oro City and is reaching out to the poor households of Northern Mindanao.

*Note: To maximize efficiency and reduce costs, this loan was posted using a template to automate the translation by Kiva.  Given that manual translation of entrepreneur profiles is costly, we created this template for our field staff to allow them to continue to post loans in English while providing quality and accurate information to Kiva lenders.

loans.use: to purchase additional products such as canned goods, beverages and  instant noodles

She plans to use the additional revenue generated to improve and expand her business.

loans.name: Helen

texts.en: Helen A. is from the village of Balila, Lantapan, Bukidnon. She is 51 years old. Helen is married and has two school-aged children. To make a living, Helen operates a specialized retail store. The main source of income for the business comes from buying and selling steel wool, miraculous (insecticidal) chalk, mothballs, kids toys and hair products. Helen has been engaged in her business for over five years and earns approximately 5,000 Philippines pesos (PHP) a month for these activities. In 2011, Helen joined HSPFI to gain access to financial services to help improve her living situation and ability to engage in business activities. Helen is requesting a new loan of 5,000 PHP, which will be used to purchase additional kids toys and kitchen utensils. This will be the first loan taken out by Helen from HSPFI. She plans to use the additional revenue generated from the business to improve/expand her business. About HSPFI: HSPFI is one of the accredited partners of Opportunity International in the Philippines. loans.name: Reynaldo

Reynaldo joined HSPFI this year to gain access to financial services to help improve his living situation and ability to engage in business activities.
